75/*
76 * Speed up all those if ( blarg == "structure" ) statements that are used everywhere;
77 * assemble "structure" once here instead of repeatedly later.
78 */
79static const std::string part_location_structure( "structure" );
80static const std::string part_location_center( "center" );
81static const std::string part_location_onroof( "on_roof" );
82
83static const itype_id fuel_type_animal( "animal" );
84static const itype_id fuel_type_battery( "battery" );
85static const itype_id fuel_type_muscle( "muscle" );
86static const itype_id fuel_type_plutonium_cell( "plut_cell" );
87static const itype_id fuel_type_wind( "wind" );
88
89static const fault_id fault_belt( "fault_engine_belt_drive" );
90static const fault_id fault_filter_air( "fault_engine_filter_air" );
91static const fault_id fault_filter_fuel( "fault_engine_filter_fuel" );
92static const fault_id fault_immobiliser( "fault_engine_immobiliser" );
93
94static const activity_id ACT_VEHICLE( "ACT_VEHICLE" );
95
96static const bionic_id bio_jointservo( "bio_jointservo" );
97
98static const efftype_id effect_harnessed( "harnessed" );
99
100static const itype_id itype_battery( "battery" );
101static const itype_id itype_plut_cell( "plut_cell" );
102static const itype_id itype_water( "water" );
103static const itype_id itype_water_clean( "water_clean" );
104static const itype_id itype_water_purifier( "water_purifier" );
105
106static const std::string flag_PERPETUAL( "PERPETUAL" );
107
108static bool is_sm_tile_outside( const tripoint &real_global_pos );
109static bool is_sm_tile_over_water( const tripoint &real_global_pos );
110
111static const itype_id fuel_type_mana( "mana" );
112
113// 1 kJ per battery charge
114const int bat_energy_j = 1000;
115
116// For reference what each function is supposed to do, see their implementation in
117// @ref DefaultRemovePartHandler. Add compatible code for it into @ref MapgenRemovePartHandler,
118// if needed.
119class RemovePartHandler
120{
121 public:
122 virtual ~RemovePartHandler() = default;
123
124 virtual void unboard( const tripoint &loc ) = 0;
125 virtual void add_item_or_charges( const tripoint &loc, item it, bool permit_oob ) = 0;
126 virtual void set_transparency_cache_dirty( int z ) = 0;
127 virtual void set_floor_cache_dirty( int z ) = 0;
128 virtual void removed( vehicle &veh, int part ) = 0;
129 virtual void spawn_animal_from_part( item &base, const tripoint &loc ) = 0;
130};
131
132class DefaultRemovePartHandler : public RemovePartHandler
133{
134 public:
135 ~DefaultRemovePartHandler() override = default;
136
137 void unboard( const tripoint &loc ) override {
138 g->m.unboard_vehicle( loc );
139 }
140 void add_item_or_charges( const tripoint &loc, item it, bool /*permit_oob*/ ) override {
141 g->m.add_item_or_charges( loc, std::move( it ) );
142 }
143 void set_transparency_cache_dirty( const int z ) override {
144 map &here = get_map();
145 here.set_transparency_cache_dirty( z );
146 here.set_seen_cache_dirty( tripoint_zero );
147 }
148 void set_floor_cache_dirty( const int z ) override {
149 get_map().set_floor_cache_dirty( z );
150 }
151 void removed( vehicle &veh, const int part ) override {
152 avatar &player_character = get_avatar();
153 // If the player is currently working on the removed part, stop them as it's futile now.
154 const player_activity &act = player_character.activity;
155 map &here = get_map();
156 if( act.id() == ACT_VEHICLE && act.moves_left > 0 && act.values.size() > 6 ) {
157 if( veh_pointer_or_null( here.veh_at( tripoint( act.values[0], act.values[1],
158 player_character.posz() ) ) ) == &veh ) {
159 if( act.values[6] >= part ) {
160 player_character.cancel_activity();
161 add_msg( m_info, _( "The vehicle part you were working on has gone!" ) );
162 }
163 }
164 }
165 // TODO: maybe do this for all the nearby NPCs as well?
166
167 if( g->u.get_grab_type() == OBJECT_VEHICLE && g->u.grab_point == veh.global_part_pos3( part ) ) {
168 if( veh.parts_at_relative( veh.part( part ).mount, false ).empty() ) {
169 add_msg( m_info, _( "The vehicle part you were holding has been destroyed!" ) );
170 g->u.grab( OBJECT_NONE );
171 }
172 }
173
174 here.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( &veh );
175 }
176 void spawn_animal_from_part( item &base, const tripoint &loc ) override {
177 base.release_monster( loc, 1 );
178 }
179};
180
181class MapgenRemovePartHandler : public RemovePartHandler
182{
183 private:
184 map &m;
185
186 public:
187 MapgenRemovePartHandler( map &m ) : m( m ) { }
188
189 ~MapgenRemovePartHandler() override = default;
190
191 void unboard( const tripoint &/*loc*/ ) override {
192 debugmsg( "Tried to unboard during mapgen!" );
193 // Ignored. Will almost certainly not be called anyway, because
194 // there are no creatures that could have been mounted during mapgen.
195 }
196 void add_item_or_charges( const tripoint &loc, item it, bool permit_oob ) override {
197 if( !m.inbounds( loc ) ) {
198 if( !permit_oob ) {
199 debugmsg( "Tried to put item %s on invalid tile %s during mapgen!",
200 it.tname(), loc.to_string() );
201 }
202 tripoint copy = loc;
203 m.clip_to_bounds( copy );
204 assert( m.inbounds( copy ) ); // prevent infinite recursion
205 add_item_or_charges( copy, std::move( it ), false );
206 return;
207 }
208 m.add_item_or_charges( loc, std::move( it ) );
209 }
210 void set_transparency_cache_dirty( const int /*z*/ ) override {
211 // Ignored for now. We don't initialize the transparency cache in mapgen anyway.
212 }
213 void set_floor_cache_dirty( const int /*z*/ ) override {
214 // Ignored for now. We don't initialize the floor cache in mapgen anyway.
215 }
216 void removed( vehicle &veh, const int /*part*/ ) override {
217 // TODO: check if this is necessary, it probably isn't during mapgen
218 m.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( &veh );
219 }
220 void spawn_animal_from_part( item &/*base*/, const tripoint &/*loc*/ ) override {
221 debugmsg( "Tried to spawn animal from vehicle part during mapgen!" );
222 // Ignored. The base item will not be changed and will spawn as is:
223 // still containing the animal.
224 // This should not happend during mapgen anyway.
225 // TODO: *if* this actually happens: create a spawn point for the animal instead.
226 }
227};
228
229// Vehicle stack methods.
230vehicle_stack::iterator vehicle_stack::erase( vehicle_stack::const_iterator it )
231{
232 return myorigin->remove_item( part_num, it );
233}
234
235void vehicle_stack::insert( const item &newitem )
236{
237 myorigin->add_item( part_num, newitem );
238}
239
240units::volume vehicle_stack::max_volume() const
241{
242 if( myorigin->part_flag( part_num, "CARGO" ) && !myorigin->part( part_num ).is_broken() ) {
243 // Set max volume for vehicle cargo to prevent integer overflow
244 return std::min( myorigin->part( part_num ).info().size, 10000_liter );
245 }
246 return 0_ml;
247}
248
249// Vehicle class methods.
250
251vehicle::vehicle( const vproto_id &type_id, int init_veh_fuel,
252 int init_veh_status ): type( type_id )
253{
254 turn_dir = 0_degrees;
255 face.init( 0_degrees );
256 move.init( 0_degrees );
257 of_turn_carry = 0;
258
259 if( !type.str().empty() && type.is_valid() ) {
260 const vehicle_prototype &proto = type.obj();
261 // Copy the already made vehicle. The blueprint is created when the json data is loaded
262 // and is guaranteed to be valid (has valid parts etc.).
263 *this = *proto.blueprint;
264 init_state( init_veh_fuel, init_veh_status );
265 }
266 precalc_mounts( 0, pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[0] );
267 refresh();
268}
269
270vehicle::vehicle() : vehicle( vproto_id() )
271{
272 sm_pos = tripoint_zero;
273}
274
275vehicle::~vehicle() = default;
276
277bool vehicle::player_in_control( const Character &p ) const
278{
279 // Debug switch to prevent vehicles from skidding
280 // without having to place the player in them.
281 if( tags.count( "IN_CONTROL_OVERRIDE" ) ) {
282 return true;
283 }
284
285 const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( p.pos() );
286 if( vp && &vp->vehicle() == this &&
287 ( ( part_with_feature( vp->part_index(), "CONTROL_ANIMAL", true ) >= 0 &&
288 has_engine_type( fuel_type_animal, false ) && has_harnessed_animal() ) ||
289 ( part_with_feature( vp->part_index(), VPFLAG_CONTROLS, false ) >= 0 ) ) &&
290 p.controlling_vehicle ) {
291 return true;
292 }
293
294 return remote_controlled( p );
295}
296
297bool vehicle::remote_controlled( const Character &p ) const
298{
299 vehicle *veh = g->remoteveh();
300 if( veh != this ) {
301 return false;
302 }
303
304 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( "REMOTE_CONTROLS" ) ) {
305 if( rl_dist( p.pos(), vp.pos() ) <= 40 ) {
306 return true;
307 }
308 }
309
310 add_msg( m_bad, _( "Lost connection with the vehicle due to distance!" ) );
311 g->setremoteveh( nullptr );
312 return false;
313}
314
315/** Checks all parts to see if frames are missing (as they might be when
316 * loading from a game saved before the vehicle construction rules overhaul). */
317void vehicle::add_missing_frames()
318{
319 static const vpart_id frame_id( "frame_vertical" );
320 //No need to check the same spot more than once
321 std::set<point> locations_checked;
322 for( auto &i : parts ) {
323 if( locations_checked.count( i.mount ) != 0 ) {
324 continue;
325 }
326 locations_checked.insert( i.mount );
327
328 bool found = false;
329 for( auto &elem : parts_at_relative( i.mount, false ) ) {
330 if( part_info( elem ).location == part_location_structure ) {
331 found = true;
332 break;
333 }
334 }
335 if( !found ) {
336 // Install missing frame
337 parts.emplace_back( frame_id, i.mount, item( frame_id->item ) );
338 }
339 }
340}
341
342// Called when loading a vehicle that predates steerable wheels.
343// Tries to convert some wheels to steerable versions on the front axle.
344void vehicle::add_steerable_wheels()
345{
346 int axle = INT_MIN;
347 std::vector< std::pair<int, vpart_id> > wheels;
348
349 // Find wheels that have steerable versions.
350 // Convert the wheel(s) with the largest x value.
351 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
352 if( vp.has_feature( "STEERABLE" ) || vp.has_feature( "TRACKED" ) ) {
353 // Has a wheel that is inherently steerable
354 // (e.g. unicycle, casters), this vehicle doesn't
355 // need conversion.
356 return;
357 }
358
359 if( vp.mount().x < axle ) {
360 // there is another axle in front of this
361 continue;
362 }
363
364 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_WHEEL ) ) {
365 vpart_id steerable_id( vp.info().get_id().str() + "_steerable" );
366 if( steerable_id.is_valid() ) {
367 // We can convert this.
368 if( vp.mount().x != axle ) {
369 // Found a new axle further forward than the
370 // existing one.
371 wheels.clear();
372 axle = vp.mount().x;
373 }
374
375 wheels.push_back( std::make_pair( static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() ), steerable_id ) );
376 }
377 }
378 }
379
380 // Now convert the wheels to their new types.
381 for( auto &wheel : wheels ) {
382 parts[ wheel.first ].id = wheel.second;
383 }
384}
385
386void vehicle::init_state( int init_veh_fuel, int init_veh_status )
387{
388 // vehicle parts excluding engines are by default turned off
389 for( auto &pt : parts ) {
390 pt.enabled = pt.base.is_engine();
391 }
392
393 bool destroySeats = false;
394 bool destroyControls = false;
395 bool destroyTank = false;
396 bool destroyEngine = false;
397 bool destroyTires = false;
398 bool blood_covered = false;
399 bool blood_inside = false;
400 bool has_no_key = false;
401 bool destroyAlarm = false;
402
403 // More realistically it should be -5 days old
404 last_update = calendar::start_of_cataclysm;
405
406 // veh_fuel_multiplier is percentage of fuel
407 // 0 is empty, 100 is full tank, -1 is random 7% to 35%
408 int veh_fuel_mult = init_veh_fuel;
409 if( init_veh_fuel == - 1 ) {
410 veh_fuel_mult = rng( 1, 7 );
411 }
412 if( init_veh_fuel > 100 ) {
413 veh_fuel_mult = 100;
414 }
415
416 // veh_status is initial vehicle damage
417 // -1 = light damage (DEFAULT)
418 // 0 = undamaged
419 // 1 = disabled, destroyed tires OR engine
420 int veh_status = -1;
421 if( init_veh_status == 0 ) {
422 veh_status = 0;
423 }
424 if( init_veh_status == 1 ) {
425 int rand = rng( 1, 100 );
426 veh_status = 1;
427
428 if( rand <= 5 ) { // seats are destroyed 5%
429 destroySeats = true;
430 } else if( rand <= 15 ) { // controls are destroyed 10%
431 destroyControls = true;
432 veh_fuel_mult += rng( 0, 7 ); // add 0-7% more fuel if controls are destroyed
433 } else if( rand <= 23 ) { // battery, minireactor or gasoline tank are destroyed 8%
434 destroyTank = true;
435 } else if( rand <= 29 ) { // engine are destroyed 6%
436 destroyEngine = true;
437 veh_fuel_mult += rng( 3, 12 ); // add 3-12% more fuel if engine is destroyed
438 } else if( rand <= 66 ) { // tires are destroyed 37%
439 destroyTires = true;
440 veh_fuel_mult += rng( 0, 18 ); // add 0-18% more fuel if tires are destroyed
441 } else { // vehicle locked 34%
442 has_no_key = true;
443 }
444 }
445 // if locked, 16% chance something damaged
446 if( one_in( 6 ) && has_no_key ) {
447 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
448 destroyTank = true;
449 } else if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
450 destroyEngine = true;
451 } else {
452 destroyTires = true;
453 }
454 } else if( !one_in( 3 ) ) {
455 //most cars should have a destroyed alarm
456 destroyAlarm = true;
457 }
458
459 //Provide some variety to non-mint vehicles
460 if( veh_status != 0 ) {
461 //Leave engine running in some vehicles, if the engine has not been destroyed
462 //chance decays from 1 in 4 vehicles on day 0 to 1 in (day + 4) in the future.
463 int current_day = std::max( to_days<int>( calendar::turn - calendar::turn_zero ), 0 );
464 if( veh_fuel_mult > 0 && !empty( get_avail_parts( "ENGINE" ) ) &&
465 one_in( current_day + 4 ) && !destroyEngine && !has_no_key &&
466 has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) ) {
467 engine_on = true;
468 }
469
470 auto light_head = one_in( 20 );
471 auto light_whead = one_in( 20 ); // wide-angle headlight
472 auto light_dome = one_in( 16 );
473 auto light_aisle = one_in( 8 );
474 auto light_hoverh = one_in( 4 ); // half circle overhead light
475 auto light_overh = one_in( 4 );
476 auto light_atom = one_in( 2 );
477 for( auto &pt : parts ) {
478 if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_CONE_LIGHT ) ) {
479 pt.enabled = light_head;
480 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_WIDE_CONE_LIGHT ) ) {
481 pt.enabled = light_whead;
482 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_DOME_LIGHT ) ) {
483 pt.enabled = light_dome;
484 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_AISLE_LIGHT ) ) {
485 pt.enabled = light_aisle;
486 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_HALF_CIRCLE_LIGHT ) ) {
487 pt.enabled = light_hoverh;
488 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_CIRCLE_LIGHT ) ) {
489 pt.enabled = light_overh;
490 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_ATOMIC_LIGHT ) ) {
491 pt.enabled = light_atom;
492 }
493 }
494
495 if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
496 blood_covered = true;
497 }
498
499 if( one_in( 8 ) ) {
500 blood_inside = true;
501 }
502
503 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_parts_including_carried( "FRIDGE" ) ) {
504 vp.part().enabled = true;
505 }
506
507 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_parts_including_carried( "FREEZER" ) ) {
508 vp.part().enabled = true;
509 }
510
511 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_parts_including_carried( "WATER_PURIFIER" ) ) {
512 vp.part().enabled = true;
513 }
514 }
515
516 cata::optional<point> blood_inside_pos;
517 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
518 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
519 vehicle_part &pt = vp.part();
520
521 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_REACTOR ) ) {
522 // De-hardcoded reactors. Should always start active
523 pt.enabled = true;
524 }
525
526 if( pt.is_reactor() ) {
527 if( veh_fuel_mult == 100 ) { // Mint condition vehicle
528 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() );
529 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) { // Randomize charge a bit
530 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult + rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
531 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) {
532 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult - rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
533 } else {
534 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100 );
535 }
536 }
537
538 if( pt.is_battery() ) {
539 if( veh_fuel_mult == 100 ) { // Mint condition vehicle
540 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() );
541 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) { // Randomize battery ammo a bit
542 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult + rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
543 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) {
544 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult - rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
545 } else {
546 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100 );
547 }
548 }
549
550 if( pt.is_tank() && !type->parts[p].fuel.is_null() ) {
551 int qty = pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100;
552 qty *= std::max( type->parts[p].fuel->stack_size, 1 );
553 qty /= to_milliliter( units::legacy_volume_factor );
554 pt.ammo_set( type->parts[ p ].fuel, qty );
555 } else if( pt.is_fuel_store() && !type->parts[p].fuel.is_null() ) {
556 int qty = pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100;
557 pt.ammo_set( type->parts[ p ].fuel, qty );
558 }
559
560 if( vp.has_feature( "OPENABLE" ) ) { // doors are closed
561 if( !pt.open && one_in( 4 ) ) {
562 open( p );
563 }
564 }
565 if( vp.has_feature( "BOARDABLE" ) ) { // no passengers
566 pt.remove_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag );
567 }
568
569 // initial vehicle damage
570 if( veh_status == 0 ) {
571 // Completely mint condition vehicle
572 set_hp( pt, vp.info().durability );
573 } else {
574 //a bit of initial damage :)
575 //clamp 4d8 to the range of [8,20]. 8=broken, 20=undamaged.
576 int broken = 8;
577 int unhurt = 20;
578 int roll = dice( 4, 8 );
579 if( roll < unhurt ) {
580 if( roll <= broken ) {
581 set_hp( pt, 0 );
582 pt.ammo_unset(); //empty broken batteries and fuel tanks
583 } else {
584 set_hp( pt, ( roll - broken ) / static_cast<double>( unhurt - broken ) * vp.info().durability );
585 }
586 } else {
587 set_hp( pt, vp.info().durability );
588 }
589
590 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_ENGINE ) ) {
591 // If possible set an engine fault rather than destroying the engine outright
592 if( destroyEngine && pt.faults_potential().empty() ) {
593 set_hp( pt, 0 );
594 } else if( destroyEngine || one_in( 3 ) ) {
595 do {
596 pt.fault_set( random_entry( pt.faults_potential() ) );
597 } while( one_in( 3 ) );
598 }
599
600 } else if( ( destroySeats && ( vp.has_feature( "SEAT" ) || vp.has_feature( "SEATBELT" ) ) ) ||
601 ( destroyControls && ( vp.has_feature( "CONTROLS" ) || vp.has_feature( "SECURITY" ) ) ) ||
602 ( destroyAlarm && vp.has_feature( "SECURITY" ) ) ) {
603 set_hp( pt, 0 );
604 }
605
606 // Fuel tanks should be emptied as well
607 if( destroyTank && pt.is_fuel_store() ) {
608 set_hp( pt, 0 );
609 pt.ammo_unset();
610 }
611
612 //Solar panels have 25% of being destroyed
613 if( vp.has_feature( "SOLAR_PANEL" ) && one_in( 4 ) ) {
614 set_hp( pt, 0 );
615 }
616
617 /* Bloodsplatter the front-end parts. Assume anything with x > 0 is
618 * the "front" of the vehicle (since the driver's seat is at (0, 0).
619 * We'll be generous with the blood, since some may disappear before
620 * the player gets a chance to see the vehicle. */
621 if( blood_covered && vp.mount().x > 0 ) {
622 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
623 //Loads of blood. (200 = completely red vehicle part)
624 pt.blood = rng( 200, 600 );
625 } else {
626 //Some blood
627 pt.blood = rng( 50, 200 );
628 }
629 }
630
631 if( blood_inside ) {
632 // blood is splattered around (blood_inside_pos),
633 // coordinates relative to mount point; the center is always a seat
634 if( blood_inside_pos ) {
635 const int distSq = std::pow( blood_inside_pos->x - vp.mount().x, 2 ) +
636 std::pow( blood_inside_pos->y - vp.mount().y, 2 );
637 if( distSq <= 1 ) {
638 pt.blood = rng( 200, 400 ) - distSq * 100;
639 }
640 } else if( vp.has_feature( "SEAT" ) ) {
641 // Set the center of the bloody mess inside
642 blood_inside_pos.emplace( vp.mount() );
643 }
644 }
645 }
646 //sets the vehicle to locked, if there is no key and an alarm part exists
647 if( vp.has_feature( "SECURITY" ) && has_no_key && pt.is_available() ) {
648 is_locked = true;
649
650 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
651 // if vehicle has immobilizer 50% chance to add additional fault
652 pt.fault_set( fault_immobiliser );
653 }
654 }
655 }
656 // destroy tires until the vehicle is not drivable
657 if( destroyTires && !wheelcache.empty() ) {
658 int tries = 0;
659 while( valid_wheel_config() && tries < 100 ) {
660 // wheel config is still valid, destroy the tire.
661 set_hp( parts[random_entry( wheelcache )], 0 );
662 tries++;
663 }
664 }
665
666 invalidate_mass();
667}
668
669void vehicle::activate_magical_follow()
670{
671 for( vehicle_part &vp : parts ) {
672 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_mana ) {
673 vp.enabled = true;
674 is_following = true;
675 engine_on = true;
676 } else {
677 vp.enabled = true;
678 }
679 }
680 refresh();
681}
682
683void vehicle::activate_animal_follow()
684{
685 for( size_t e = 0; e < parts.size(); e++ ) {
686 vehicle_part &vp = parts[ e ];
687 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal ) {
688 monster *mon = get_pet( e );
689 if( mon && mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
690 vp.enabled = true;
691 is_following = true;
692 engine_on = true;
693 }
694 } else {
695 vp.enabled = true;
696 }
697 }
698 refresh();
699}
700
701void vehicle::autopilot_patrol()
702{
703 /** choose one single zone ( multiple zones too complex for now )
704 * choose a point at the far edge of the zone
705 * the edge chosen is the edge that is smaller, therefore the longer side
706 * of the rectangle is the one the vehicle drives mostly parallel too.
707 * if its perfect square then choose a point that is on any edge that the
708 * vehicle is not currently at
709 * drive to that point.
710 * then once arrived, choose a random opposite point of the zone.
711 * this should ( in a simple fashion ) cause a patrolling behavior
712 * in a criss-cross fashion.
713 * in an auto-tractor, this would eventually cover the entire rectangle.
714 */
715 // if we are close to a waypoint, then return to come back to this function next turn.
716 if( autodrive_local_target != tripoint_zero ) {
717 if( rl_dist( global_square_location().raw(), autodrive_local_target ) <= 3 ) {
718 autodrive_local_target = tripoint_zero;
719 return;
720 }
721 if( !g->m.inbounds( g->m.getlocal( autodrive_local_target ) ) ) {
722 autodrive_local_target = tripoint_zero;
723 is_patrolling = false;
724 return;
725 }
726 drive_to_local_target( autodrive_local_target, false );
727 return;
728 }
729 zone_manager &mgr = zone_manager::get_manager();
730 const auto &zone_src_set = mgr.get_near( zone_type_id( "VEHICLE_PATROL" ),
731 global_square_location().raw(), 60 );
732 if( zone_src_set.empty() ) {
733 is_patrolling = false;
734 return;
735 }
736 // get corners.
737 tripoint min;
738 tripoint max;
739 for( const tripoint &box : zone_src_set ) {
740 if( min == tripoint_zero ) {
741 min = box;
742 max = box;
743 continue;
744 }
745 min.x = std::min( box.x, min.x );
746 min.y = std::min( box.y, min.y );
747 min.z = std::min( box.z, min.z );
748 max.x = std::max( box.x, max.x );
749 max.y = std::max( box.y, max.y );
750 max.z = std::max( box.z, max.z );
751 }
752 const bool x_side = ( max.x - min.x ) < ( max.y - min.y );
753 const int point_along = x_side ? rng( min.x, max.x ) : rng( min.y, max.y );
754 const tripoint max_tri = x_side ? tripoint( point_along, max.y, min.z ) : tripoint( max.x,
755 point_along,
756 min.z );
757 const tripoint min_tri = x_side ? tripoint( point_along, min.y, min.z ) : tripoint( min.x,
758 point_along,
759 min.z );
760 tripoint chosen_tri = min_tri;
761 if( rl_dist( max_tri, global_square_location().raw() ) >= rl_dist( min_tri,
762 global_square_location().raw() ) ) {
763 chosen_tri = max_tri;
764 }
765 autodrive_local_target = chosen_tri;
766 drive_to_local_target( autodrive_local_target, false );
767}
768
769std::set<point> vehicle::immediate_path( units::angle rotate )
770{
771 std::set<point> points_to_check;
772 const int distance_to_check = 10 + ( velocity / 800 );
773 units::angle adjusted_angle = normalize( face.dir() + rotate );
774 // clamp to multiples of 15.
775 adjusted_angle = round_to_multiple_of( adjusted_angle, 15_degrees );
776 tileray collision_vector;
777 collision_vector.init( adjusted_angle );
778 point top_left_actual = global_pos3().xy() + coord_translate( front_left );
779 point top_right_actual = global_pos3().xy() + coord_translate( front_right );
780 std::vector<point> front_row = line_to( g->m.getabs( top_left_actual ),
781 g->m.getabs( top_right_actual ) );
782 for( const point &elem : front_row ) {
783 for( int i = 0; i < distance_to_check; ++i ) {
784 collision_vector.advance( i );
785 point point_to_add = elem + point( collision_vector.dx(), collision_vector.dy() );
786 points_to_check.emplace( point_to_add );
787 }
788 }
789 collision_check_points = points_to_check;
790 return points_to_check;
791}
792
793static int get_turn_from_angle( const units::angle angle, const tripoint &vehpos,
794 const tripoint &target, bool reverse = false )
795{
796 if( angle > 10.0_degrees && angle <= 45.0_degrees ) {
797 return reverse ? 4 : 1;
798 } else if( angle > 45.0_degrees && angle <= 90.0_degrees ) {
799 return 3;
800 } else if( angle > 90.0_degrees && angle < 180.0_degrees ) {
801 return reverse ? 1 : 4;
802 } else if( angle < -10.0_degrees && angle >= -45.0_degrees ) {
803 return reverse ? -4 : -1;
804 } else if( angle < -45.0_degrees && angle >= -90.0_degrees ) {
805 return -3;
806 } else if( angle < -90.0_degrees && angle > -180.0_degrees ) {
807 return reverse ? -1 : -4;
808 // edge case of being exactly on the button for the target.
809 // just keep driving, the next path point will be picked up.
810 } else if( ( angle == 180_degrees || angle == -180_degrees ) && vehpos == target ) {
811 return 0;
812 }
813 return 0;
814}
815
816void vehicle::drive_to_local_target( const tripoint &target, bool follow_protocol )
817{
818 if( follow_protocol && g->u.in_vehicle ) {
819 stop_autodriving();
820 return;
821 }
822 refresh();
823 tripoint vehpos = global_square_location().raw();
824 units::angle angle = get_angle_from_targ( target );
825 // now we got the angle to the target, we can work out when we are heading towards disaster.
826 // Check the tileray in the direction we need to head towards.
827 std::set<point> points_to_check = immediate_path( angle );
828 bool stop = false;
829 for( const point &pt_elem : points_to_check ) {
830 point elem = g->m.getlocal( pt_elem );
831 if( stop ) {
832 break;
833 }
834 const optional_vpart_position ovp = g->m.veh_at( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) );
835 if( g->m.impassable_ter_furn( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) ) || ( ovp &&
836 &ovp->vehicle() != this ) ) {
837 stop = true;
838 break;
839 }
840 if( elem == g->u.pos().xy() ) {
841 if( follow_protocol || g->u.in_vehicle ) {
842 continue;
843 } else {
844 stop = true;
845 break;
846 }
847 }
848 bool its_a_pet = false;
849 if( g->critter_at( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) ) ) {
850 npc *guy = g->critter_at<npc>( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) );
851 if( guy && !guy->in_vehicle ) {
852 stop = true;
853 break;
854 }
855 for( const auto &p : parts ) {
856 monster *mon = get_pet( index_of_part( &p ) );
857 if( mon && mon->pos().xy() == elem ) {
858 its_a_pet = true;
859 break;
860 }
861 }
862 if( !its_a_pet ) {
863 stop = true;
864 break;
865 }
866 }
867 }
868 if( stop ) {
869 if( autopilot_on ) {
870 sounds::sound( global_pos3(), 30, sounds::sound_t::alert,
871 string_format( _( "the %s emitting a beep and saying \"Obstacle detected!\"" ),
872 name ) );
873 }
874 stop_autodriving();
875 return;
876 }
877 int turn_x = get_turn_from_angle( angle, vehpos, target );
878 int accel_y = 0;
879 // best to cruise around at a safe velocity or 40mph, whichever is lowest
880 // accelerate when it dosnt need to turn.
881 // when following player, take distance to player into account.
882 // we really want to avoid running the player over.
883 // If its a helicopter, we dont need to worry about airborne obstacles so much
884 // And fuel efficiency is terrible at low speeds.
885 int safe_player_follow_speed = 400;
886 if( g->u.movement_mode_is( CMM_RUN ) ) {
887 safe_player_follow_speed = 800;
888 } else if( g->u.movement_mode_is( CMM_CROUCH ) ) {
889 safe_player_follow_speed = 200;
890 }
891 if( follow_protocol ) {
892 if( ( ( turn_x > 0 || turn_x < 0 ) && velocity > safe_player_follow_speed ) ||
893 rl_dist( vehpos, g->m.getabs( g->u.pos() ) ) < 7 + ( ( mount_max.y * 3 ) + 4 ) ) {
894 accel_y = 1;
895 }
896 if( ( velocity < std::min( safe_velocity(), safe_player_follow_speed ) && turn_x == 0 &&
897 rl_dist( vehpos, g->m.getabs( g->u.pos() ) ) > 8 + ( ( mount_max.y * 3 ) + 4 ) ) ||
898 velocity < 100 ) {
899 accel_y = -1;
900 }
901 } else {
902 if( ( turn_x > 0 || turn_x < 0 ) && velocity > 1000 ) {
903 accel_y = 1;
904 }
905 if( ( velocity < std::min( safe_velocity(), is_rotorcraft() &&
906 is_flying_in_air() ? 12000 : 32 * 100 ) && turn_x == 0 ) || velocity < 500 ) {
907 accel_y = -1;
908 }
909 if( is_patrolling && velocity > 400 ) {
910 accel_y = 1;
911 }
912 }
913 selfdrive( point( turn_x, accel_y ) );
914}
915
916units::angle vehicle::get_angle_from_targ( const tripoint &targ )
917{
918 tripoint vehpos = global_square_location().raw();
919 rl_vec2d facevec = face_vec();
920 point rel_pos_target = targ.xy() - vehpos.xy();
921 rl_vec2d targetvec = rl_vec2d( rel_pos_target.x, rel_pos_target.y );
922 // cross product
923 double crossy = ( facevec.x * targetvec.y ) - ( targetvec.x * facevec.y );
924 // dot product.
925 double dotx = ( facevec.x * targetvec.x ) + ( facevec.y * targetvec.y );
926
927 return units::atan2( crossy, dotx );
928}
929
930/**
931 * Smashes up a vehicle that has already been placed; used for generating
932 * very damaged vehicles. Additionally, any spot where two vehicles overlapped
933 * (i.e., any spot with multiple frames) will be completely destroyed, as that
934 * was the collision point.
935 */
936void vehicle::smash( map &m, float hp_percent_loss_min, float hp_percent_loss_max,
937 float percent_of_parts_to_affect, point damage_origin, float damage_size )
938{
939 for( auto &part : parts ) {
940 //Skip any parts already mashed up or removed.
941 if( part.is_broken() || part.removed ) {
942 continue;
943 }
944
945 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( part.mount, true );
946 int structures_found = 0;
947 for( auto &square_part_index : parts_in_square ) {
948 if( part_info( square_part_index ).location == part_location_structure ) {
949 structures_found++;
950 }
951 }
952
953 if( structures_found > 1 ) {
954 //Destroy everything in the square
955 for( int idx : parts_in_square ) {
956 mod_hp( parts[ idx ], 0 - parts[ idx ].hp(), DT_BASH );
957 parts[ idx ].ammo_unset();
958 }
959 continue;
960 }
961
962 int roll = dice( 1, 1000 );
963 int pct_af = ( percent_of_parts_to_affect * 1000.0f );
964 if( roll < pct_af ) {
965 double dist = damage_size == 0.0f ? 1.0f :
966 clamp( 1.0f - trig_dist( damage_origin, part.precalc[0].xy() ) /
967 damage_size, 0.0f, 1.0f );
968 //Everywhere else, drop by 10-120% of max HP (anything over 100 = broken)
969 if( mod_hp( part, 0 - ( rng_float( hp_percent_loss_min * dist,
970 hp_percent_loss_max * dist ) *
971 part.info().durability ), DT_BASH ) ) {
972 part.ammo_unset();
973 }
974 }
975 }
976
977 std::unique_ptr<RemovePartHandler> handler_ptr;
978 // clear out any duplicated locations
979 for( int p = static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) - 1; p >= 0; p-- ) {
980 vehicle_part &part = parts[ p ];
981 if( part.removed ) {
982 continue;
983 }
984 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( part.mount, true );
985 for( int other_i = static_cast<int>( parts_here.size() ) - 1; other_i >= 0; other_i -- ) {
986 int other_p = parts_here[ other_i ];
987 if( p == other_p ) {
988 continue;
989 }
990 const vpart_info &p_info = part_info( p );
991 const vpart_info &other_p_info = part_info( other_p );
992
993 if( p_info.get_id() == other_p_info.get_id() ||
994 ( !p_info.location.empty() && p_info.location == other_p_info.location ) ) {
995 // Deferred creation of the handler to here so it is only created when actually needed.
996 if( !handler_ptr ) {
997 // This is a heuristic: we just assume the default handler is good enough when called
998 // on the main game map. And assume that we run from some mapgen code if called on
999 // another instance.
1000 if( g && &g->m == &m ) {
1001 handler_ptr = std::make_unique<DefaultRemovePartHandler>();
1002 } else {
1003 handler_ptr = std::make_unique<MapgenRemovePartHandler>( m );
1004 }
1005 }
1006 remove_part( other_p, *handler_ptr );
1007 }
1008 }
1009 }
1010}
1011
1012int vehicle::lift_strength() const
1013{
1014 units::mass mass = total_mass();
1015 return std::max<std::int64_t>( mass / 10000_gram, 1 );
1016}
1017
1018void vehicle::toggle_specific_engine( int e, bool on )
1019{
1020 toggle_specific_part( engines[e], on );
1021}
1022void vehicle::toggle_specific_part( int p, bool on )
1023{
1024 parts[p].enabled = on;
1025}
1026bool vehicle::is_engine_type_on( int e, const itype_id &ft ) const
1027{
1028 return is_engine_on( e ) && is_engine_type( e, ft );
1029}
1030
1031bool vehicle::has_engine_type( const itype_id &ft, const bool enabled ) const
1032{
1033 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
1034 if( is_engine_type( e, ft ) && ( !enabled || is_engine_on( e ) ) ) {
1035 return true;
1036 }
1037 }
1038 return false;
1039}
1040bool vehicle::has_engine_type_not( const itype_id &ft, const bool enabled ) const
1041{
1042 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
1043 if( !is_engine_type( e, ft ) && ( !enabled || is_engine_on( e ) ) ) {
1044 return true;
1045 }
1046 }
1047 return false;
1048}
1049
1050bool vehicle::has_engine_conflict( const vpart_info *possible_conflict,
1051 std::string &conflict_type ) const
1052{
1053 std::vector<std::string> new_excludes = possible_conflict->engine_excludes();
1054 // skip expensive string comparisons if there are no exclusions
1055 if( new_excludes.empty() ) {
1056 return false;
1057 }
1058
1059 bool has_conflict = false;
1060
1061 for( int engine : engines ) {
1062 std::vector<std::string> install_excludes = part_info( engine ).engine_excludes();
1063 std::vector<std::string> conflicts;
1064 std::set_intersection( new_excludes.begin(), new_excludes.end(), install_excludes.begin(),
1065 install_excludes.end(), back_inserter( conflicts ) );
1066 if( !conflicts.empty() ) {
1067 has_conflict = true;
1068 conflict_type = conflicts.front();
1069 break;
1070 }
1071 }
1072 return has_conflict;
1073}
1074
1075bool vehicle::is_engine_type( const int e, const itype_id &ft ) const
1076{
1077 return parts[engines[e]].ammo_current().is_null() ? parts[engines[e]].fuel_current() == ft :
1078 parts[engines[e]].ammo_current() == ft;
1079}
1080
1081bool vehicle::is_perpetual_type( const int e ) const
1082{
1083 const itype_id &ft = part_info( engines[e] ).fuel_type;
1084 return item( ft ).has_flag( "PERPETUAL" );
1085}
1086
1087bool vehicle::is_engine_on( const int e ) const
1088{
1089 return parts[ engines[ e ] ].is_available() && is_part_on( engines[ e ] );
1090}
1091
1092bool vehicle::is_part_on( const int p ) const
1093{
1094 return parts[p].enabled;
1095}
1096
1097bool vehicle::is_alternator_on( const int a ) const
1098{
1099 auto alt = parts[ alternators [ a ] ];
1100 if( alt.is_unavailable() ) {
1101 return false;
1102 }
1103
1104 return std::any_of( engines.begin(), engines.end(), [this, &alt]( int idx ) {
1105 auto &eng = parts [ idx ];
1106 //fuel_left checks that the engine can produce power to be absorbed
1107 return eng.is_available() && eng.enabled && fuel_left( eng.fuel_current() ) &&
1108 eng.mount == alt.mount && !eng.faults().count( fault_belt );
1109 } );
1110}
1111
1112bool vehicle::has_security_working() const
1113{
1114 bool found_security = false;
1115 if( fuel_left( fuel_type_battery ) > 0 ) {
1116 for( int s : speciality ) {
1117 if( part_flag( s, "SECURITY" ) && parts[ s ].is_available() ) {
1118 found_security = true;
1119 break;
1120 }
1121 }
1122 }
1123 return found_security;
1124}
1125
1126void vehicle::backfire( const int e ) const
1127{
1128 const int power = part_vpower_w( engines[e], true );
1129 const tripoint pos = global_part_pos3( engines[e] );
1130 sounds::sound( pos, 40 + power / 10000, sounds::sound_t::movement,
1131 // single space after the exclaimation mark because it does not end the sentence
1132 //~ backfire sound
1133 string_format( _( "a loud BANG! from the %s" ), // NOLINT(cata-text-style)
1134 parts[ engines[ e ] ].name() ), true, "vehicle", "engine_backfire" );
1135}
1136
1137const vpart_info &vehicle::part_info( int index, bool include_removed ) const
1138{
1139 if( index < static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
1140 if( !parts[index].removed || include_removed ) {
1141 return parts[index].info();
1142 }
1143 }
1144 return vpart_id::NULL_ID().obj();
1145}
1146
1147// engines & alternators all have power.
1148// engines provide, whilst alternators consume.
1149int vehicle::part_vpower_w( const int index, const bool at_full_hp ) const
1150{
1151 const vehicle_part &vp = parts[ index ];
1152 int pwr = vp.info().power;
1153 if( part_flag( index, VPFLAG_ENGINE ) ) {
1154 if( pwr == 0 ) {
1155 pwr = vhp_to_watts( vp.base.engine_displacement() );
1156 }
1157 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal ) {
1158 monster *mon = get_pet( index );
1159 if( mon != nullptr && mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
1160 // An animal that can carry twice as much weight, can pull a cart twice as hard.
1161 pwr = mon->get_speed() * mon->get_size() * 3
1162 * ( mon->get_mountable_weight_ratio() * 5 );
1163 } else {
1164 pwr = 0;
1165 }
1166 }
1167 ///\EFFECT_STR increases power produced for MUSCLE_* vehicles
1168 pwr += ( g->u.str_cur - 8 ) * part_info( index ).engine_muscle_power_factor();
1169 /// wind-powered vehicles have differing power depending on wind direction
1170 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_wind ) {
1171 const weather_manager &weather = get_weather();
1172 int windpower = weather.windspeed;
1173 rl_vec2d windvec;
1174 double raddir = ( ( weather.winddirection + 180 ) % 360 ) * ( M_PI / 180 );
1175 windvec = windvec.normalized();
1176 windvec.y = -std::cos( raddir );
1177 windvec.x = std::sin( raddir );
1178 rl_vec2d fv = face_vec();
1179 double dot = windvec.dot_product( fv );
1180 if( dot <= 0 ) {
1181 dot = std::min( -0.1, dot );
1182 } else {
1183 dot = std::max( 0.1, dot );
1184 }
1185 int windeffectint = static_cast<int>( ( windpower * dot ) * 200 );
1186 pwr = std::max( 1, pwr + windeffectint );
1187 }
1188 }
1189
1190 if( pwr < 0 ) {
1191 return pwr; // Consumers always draw full power, even if broken
1192 }
1193 if( at_full_hp ) {
1194 return pwr; // Assume full hp
1195 }
1196 // Damaged engines give less power, but some engines handle it better
1197 double health = parts[index].health_percent();
1198 // dpf is 0 for engines that scale power linearly with damage and
1199 // provides a floor otherwise
1200 float dpf = part_info( index ).engine_damaged_power_factor();
1201 double effective_percent = dpf + ( ( 1 - dpf ) * health );
1202 return static_cast<int>( pwr * effective_percent );
1203}
1204
1205// alternators, solar panels, reactors, and accessories all have epower.
1206// alternators, solar panels, and reactors provide, whilst accessories consume.
1207// for motor consumption see @ref vpart_info::energy_consumption instead
1208int vehicle::part_epower_w( const int index ) const
1209{
1210 int e = part_info( index ).epower;
1211 if( e < 0 ) {
1212 return e; // Consumers always draw full power, even if broken
1213 }
1214 return e * parts[ index ].health_percent();
1215}
1216
1217int vehicle::power_to_energy_bat( const int power_w, const time_duration &d ) const
1218{
1219 // Integrate constant epower (watts) over time to get units of battery energy
1220 // Thousands of watts over millions of seconds can happen, so 32-bit int
1221 // insufficient.
1222 int64_t energy_j = power_w * to_seconds<int64_t>( d );
1223 int energy_bat = energy_j / bat_energy_j;
1224 int sign = power_w >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
1225 // energy_bat remainder results in chance at additional charge/discharge
1226 energy_bat += x_in_y( std::abs( energy_j % bat_energy_j ), bat_energy_j ) ? sign : 0;
1227 return energy_bat;
1228}
1229
1230int vehicle::vhp_to_watts( const int power_vhp )
1231{
1232 // Convert vhp units (0.5 HP ) to watts
1233 // Used primarily for calculating battery charge/discharge
1234 // TODO: convert batteries to use energy units based on watts (watt-ticks?)
1235 constexpr int conversion_factor = 373; // 373 watts == 1 power_vhp == 0.5 HP
1236 return power_vhp * conversion_factor;
1237}
1238
1239bool vehicle::has_structural_part( const point &dp ) const
1240{
1241 for( const int elem : parts_at_relative( dp, false ) ) {
1242 if( part_info( elem ).location == part_location_structure &&
1243 !part_info( elem ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
1244 return true;
1245 }
1246 }
1247 return false;
1248}
1249
1250/**
1251 * Returns whether or not the vehicle has a structural part queued for removal,
1252 * @return true if a structural is queue for removal, false if not.
1253 * */
1254bool vehicle::is_structural_part_removed() const
1255{
1256 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
1257 if( vp.part().removed && vp.info().location == part_location_structure ) {
1258 return true;
1259 }
1260 }
1261 return false;
1262}
1263
1264/**
1265 * Returns whether or not the vehicle part with the given id can be mounted in
1266 * the specified square.
1267 * @param dp The local coordinate to mount in.
1268 * @param id The id of the part to install.
1269 * @return true if the part can be mounted, false if not.
1270 */
1271bool vehicle::can_mount( const point &dp, const vpart_id &id ) const
1272{
1273 //The part has to actually exist.
1274 if( !id.is_valid() ) {
1275 return false;
1276 }
1277
1278 //It also has to be a real part, not the null part
1279 const vpart_info &part = id.obj();
1280 if( part.has_flag( "NOINSTALL" ) ) {
1281 return false;
1282 }
1283
1284 const std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( dp, false );
1285
1286 //First part in an empty square MUST be a structural part
1287 if( parts_in_square.empty() && part.location != part_location_structure ) {
1288 return false;
1289 }
1290 // If its a part that harnesses animals that don't allow placing on it.
1291 if( !parts_in_square.empty() && part_info( parts_in_square[0] ).has_flag( "ANIMAL_CTRL" ) ) {
1292 return false;
1293 }
1294 //No other part can be placed on a protrusion
1295 if( !parts_in_square.empty() && part_info( parts_in_square[0] ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
1296 return false;
1297 }
1298
1299 //No part type can stack with itself, or any other part in the same slot
1300 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1301 const vpart_info &other_part = parts[elem].info();
1302
1303 //Parts with no location can stack with each other (but not themselves)
1304 if( part.get_id() == other_part.get_id() ||
1305 ( !part.location.empty() && part.location == other_part.location ) ) {
1306 return false;
1307 }
1308 // Until we have an interface for handling multiple components with CARGO space,
1309 // exclude them from being mounted in the same tile.
1310 if( part.has_flag( "CARGO" ) && other_part.has_flag( "CARGO" ) ) {
1311 return false;
1312 }
1313
1314 }
1315
1316 // All parts after the first must be installed on or next to an existing part
1317 // the exception is when a single tile only structural object is being repaired
1318 if( !parts.empty() ) {
1319 if( !is_structural_part_removed() &&
1320 !has_structural_part( dp ) &&
1321 !has_structural_part( dp + point_east ) &&
1322 !has_structural_part( dp + point_south ) &&
1323 !has_structural_part( dp + point_west ) &&
1324 !has_structural_part( dp + point_north ) ) {
1325 return false;
1326 }
1327 }
1328
1329 // only one exclusive engine allowed
1330 std::string empty;
1331 if( has_engine_conflict( &part, empty ) ) {
1332 return false;
1333 }
1334
1335 // Check all the flags of the part to see if they require other flags
1336 // If other flags are required check if those flags are present
1337 for( const std::string &flag : part.get_flags() ) {
1338 if( !json_flag::get( flag ).requires_flag().empty() ) {
1339 bool anchor_found = false;
1340 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1341 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( json_flag::get( flag ).requires_flag() ) ) {
1342 anchor_found = true;
1343 }
1344 }
1345 if( !anchor_found ) {
1346 return false;
1347 }
1348 }
1349 }
1350
1351 //Mirrors cannot be mounted on OPAQUE parts
1352 if( part.has_flag( "VISION" ) && !part.has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
1353 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1354 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( "OPAQUE" ) ) {
1355 return false;
1356 }
1357 }
1358 }
1359 //Opaque parts cannot be mounted on mirrors parts
1360 if( part.has_flag( "OPAQUE" ) ) {
1361 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1362 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( "VISION" ) &&
1363 !part_info( elem ).has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
1364 return false;
1365 }
1366 }
1367 }
1368
1369 //Turret mounts must NOT be installed on other (modded) turret mounts
1370 if( part.has_flag( "TURRET_MOUNT" ) ) {
1371 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1372 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( "TURRET_MOUNT" ) ) {
1373 return false;
1374 }
1375 }
1376 }
1377
1378 //Anything not explicitly denied is permitted
1379 return true;
1380}
1381
1382bool vehicle::can_unmount( const int p ) const
1383{
1384 std::string no_reason;
1385 return can_unmount( p, no_reason );
1386}
1387
1388bool vehicle::can_unmount( const int p, std::string &reason ) const
1389{
1390 if( p < 0 || p > static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
1391 return false;
1392 }
1393
1394 // Find all the flags on parts in this tile that require other flags
1395 const point pt = parts[p].mount;
1396 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( pt, false );
1397
1398 for( auto &elem : parts_here ) {
1399 for( const std::string &flag : part_info( elem ).get_flags() ) {
1400 if( part_info( p ).has_flag( json_flag::get( flag ).requires_flag() ) ) {
1401 reason = string_format( _( "Remove the attached %s first." ), part_info( elem ).name() );
1402 return false;
1403 }
1404 }
1405 }
1406
1407 //Can't remove an animal part if the animal is still contained
1408 if( parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::animal_flag ) ) {
1409 reason = _( "Remove carried animal first." );
1410 return false;
1411 }
1412
1413 //Structural parts have extra requirements
1414 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure ) {
1415
1416 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, false );
1417 /* To remove a structural part, there can be only structural parts left
1418 * in that square (might be more than one in the case of wreckage) */
1419 for( auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1420 if( part_info( elem ).location != part_location_structure ) {
1421 reason = _( "Remove all other attached parts first." );
1422 return false;
1423 }
1424 }
1425
1426 //If it's the last part in the square...
1427 if( parts_in_square.size() == 1 ) {
1428
1429 /* This is the tricky part: We can't remove a part that would cause
1430 * the vehicle to 'break into two' (like removing the middle section
1431 * of a quad bike, for instance). This basically requires doing some
1432 * breadth-first searches to ensure previously connected parts are
1433 * still connected. */
1434
1435 //First, find all the squares connected to the one we're removing
1436 std::vector<vehicle_part> connected_parts;
1437
1438 for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
1439 const point next = parts[p].mount + point( i < 2 ? ( i == 0 ? -1 : 1 ) : 0,
1440 i < 2 ? 0 : ( i == 2 ? -1 : 1 ) );
1441 std::vector<int> parts_over_there = parts_at_relative( next, false );
1442 //Ignore empty squares
1443 if( !parts_over_there.empty() ) {
1444 //Just need one part from the square to track the x/y
1445 connected_parts.push_back( parts[parts_over_there[0]] );
1446 }
1447 }
1448
1449 /* If size = 0, it's the last part of the whole vehicle, so we're OK
1450 * If size = 1, it's one protruding part (i.e., bicycle wheel), so OK
1451 * Otherwise, it gets complicated... */
1452 if( connected_parts.size() > 1 ) {
1453
1454 /* We'll take connected_parts[0] to be the target part.
1455 * Every other part must have some path (that doesn't involve
1456 * the part about to be removed) to the target part, in order
1457 * for the part to be legally removable. */
1458 for( const auto &next_part : connected_parts ) {
1459 if( !is_connected( connected_parts[0], next_part, parts[p] ) ) {
1460 //Removing that part would break the vehicle in two
1461 reason = _( "Removing this part would split the vehicle." );
1462 return false;
1463 }
1464 }
1465
1466 }
1467
1468 }
1469 }
1470 //Anything not explicitly denied is permitted
1471 return true;
1472}
1473
1474/**
1475 * Performs a breadth-first search from one part to another, to see if a path
1476 * exists between the two without going through the excluded part. Used to see
1477 * if a part can be legally removed.
1478 * @param to The part to reach.
1479 * @param from The part to start the search from.
1480 * @param excluded_part The part that is being removed and, therefore, should not
1481 * be included in the path.
1482 * @return true if a path exists without the excluded part, false otherwise.
1483 */
1484bool vehicle::is_connected( const vehicle_part &to, const vehicle_part &from,
1485 const vehicle_part &excluded_part ) const
1486{
1487 const auto target = to.mount;
1488 const auto excluded = excluded_part.mount;
1489
1490 //Breadth-first-search components
1491 std::list<vehicle_part> discovered;
1492 std::list<vehicle_part> searched;
1493
1494 //We begin with just the start point
1495 discovered.push_back( from );
1496
1497 while( !discovered.empty() ) {
1498 vehicle_part current_part = discovered.front();
1499 discovered.pop_front();
1500 auto current = current_part.mount;
1501
1502 for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
1503 point next = current + offset;
1504
1505 if( next == target ) {
1506 //Success!
1507 return true;
1508 } else if( next == excluded ) {
1509 //There might be a path, but we're not allowed to go that way
1510 continue;
1511 }
1512
1513 std::vector<int> parts_there = parts_at_relative( next, true );
1514
1515 if( !parts_there.empty() && !parts[ parts_there[ 0 ] ].removed &&
1516 part_info( parts_there[ 0 ] ).location == "structure" &&
1517 !part_info( parts_there[ 0 ] ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
1518 //Only add the part if we haven't been here before
1519 bool found = false;
1520 for( auto &elem : discovered ) {
1521 if( elem.mount == next ) {
1522 found = true;
1523 break;
1524 }
1525 }
1526 if( !found ) {
1527 for( auto &elem : searched ) {
1528 if( elem.mount == next ) {
1529 found = true;
1530 break;
1531 }
1532 }
1533 }
1534 if( !found ) {
1535 vehicle_part next_part = parts[parts_there[0]];
1536 discovered.push_back( next_part );
1537 }
1538 }
1539 }
1540 //Now that that's done, we've finished exploring here
1541 searched.push_back( current_part );
1542 }
1543 //If we completely exhaust the discovered list, there's no path
1544 return false;
1545}
1546
1547/**
1548 * Installs a part into this vehicle.
1549 * @param dp The coordinate of where to install the part.
1550 * @param id The string ID of the part to install. (see vehicle_parts.json)
1551 * @param force Skip check of whether we can mount the part here.
1552 * @return false if the part could not be installed, true otherwise.
1553 */
1554int vehicle::install_part( const point &dp, const vpart_id &id, bool force )
1555{
1556 if( !( force || can_mount( dp, id ) ) ) {
1557 return -1;
1558 }
1559 return install_part( dp, vehicle_part( id, dp, item( id.obj().item ) ) );
1560}
1561
1562int vehicle::install_part( const point &dp, const vpart_id &id, item &&obj, bool force )
1563{
1564 if( !( force || can_mount( dp, id ) ) ) {
1565 return -1;
1566 }
1567 return install_part( dp, vehicle_part( id, dp, std::move( obj ) ) );
1568}
1569
1570int vehicle::install_part( const point &dp, const vehicle_part &new_part )
1571{
1572 // Should be checked before installing the part
1573 bool enable = false;
1574 if( new_part.is_engine() ) {
1575 enable = true;
1576 } else {
1577 // TODO: read toggle groups from JSON
1578 static const std::vector<std::string> enable_like = {{
1579 "CONE_LIGHT",
1580 "CIRCLE_LIGHT",
1581 "AISLE_LIGHT",
1582 "AUTOPILOT",
1583 "DOME_LIGHT",
1584 "ATOMIC_LIGHT",
1585 "STEREO",
1586 "CHIMES",
1587 "FRIDGE",
1588 "FREEZER",
1589 "RECHARGE",
1590 "PLOW",
1591 "REAPER",
1592 "PLANTER",
1593 "SCOOP",
1594 "SPACE_HEATER",
1595 "COOLER",
1596 "WATER_PURIFIER",
1597 "ROCKWHEEL",
1598 "ROADHEAD"
1599 }
1600 };
1601
1602 for( const std::string &flag : enable_like ) {
1603 if( new_part.info().has_flag( flag ) ) {
1604 enable = has_part( flag, true );
1605 break;
1606 }
1607 }
1608 }
1609
1610 parts.push_back( new_part );
1611 auto &pt = parts.back();
1612
1613 pt.enabled = enable;
1614
1615 pt.mount = dp;
1616
1617 refresh();
1618 coeff_air_changed = true;
1619 return parts.size() - 1;
1620}
1621
1622bool vehicle::try_to_rack_nearby_vehicle( const std::vector<std::vector<int>> &list_of_racks )
1623{
1624 for( const auto &this_bike_rack : list_of_racks ) {
1625 std::vector<vehicle *> carry_vehs;
1626 carry_vehs.assign( 4, nullptr );
1627 vehicle *test_veh = nullptr;
1628 std::set<tripoint> veh_partial_match;
1629 std::vector<std::set<tripoint>> partial_matches;
1630 partial_matches.assign( 4, veh_partial_match );
1631 for( auto rack_part : this_bike_rack ) {
1632 tripoint rack_pos = global_part_pos3( rack_part );
1633 int i = 0;
1634 for( const point &offset : four_cardinal_directions ) {
1635 tripoint search_pos( rack_pos + offset );
1636 test_veh = veh_pointer_or_null( g->m.veh_at( search_pos ) );
1637 if( test_veh == nullptr || test_veh == this ) {
1638 continue;
1639 } else if( test_veh != carry_vehs[ i ] ) {
1640 carry_vehs[ i ] = test_veh;
1641 partial_matches[ i ].clear();
1642 }
1643 partial_matches[ i ].insert( search_pos );
1644 if( partial_matches[ i ] == test_veh->get_points() ) {
1645 return merge_rackable_vehicle( test_veh, this_bike_rack );
1646 }
1647 ++i;
1648 }
1649 }
1650 }
1651 return false;
1652}
1653
1654bool vehicle::merge_rackable_vehicle( vehicle *carry_veh, const std::vector<int> &rack_parts )
1655{
1656 // Mapping between the old vehicle and new vehicle mounting points
1657 struct mapping {
1658 // All the parts attached to this mounting point
1659 std::vector<int> carry_parts_here;
1660
1661 // the index where the racking part is on the vehicle with the rack
1662 int rack_part;
1663
1664 // the mount point we are going to add to the vehicle with the rack
1665 point carry_mount;
1666
1667 // the mount point on the old vehicle (carry_veh) that will be destroyed
1668 point old_mount;
1669 };
1670 invalidate_towing( true );
1671 // By structs, we mean all the parts of the carry vehicle that are at the structure location
1672 // of the vehicle (i.e. frames)
1673 std::vector<int> carry_veh_structs = carry_veh->all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
1674 std::vector<mapping> carry_data;
1675 carry_data.reserve( carry_veh_structs.size() );
1676
1677 //X is forward/backward, Y is left/right
1678 std::string axis;
1679 if( carry_veh_structs.size() == 1 ) {
1680 axis = "X";
1681 } else {
1682 for( auto carry_part : carry_veh_structs ) {
1683 if( carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount.x || carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount.y ) {
1684 axis = carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount.x ? "X" : "Y";
1685 }
1686 }
1687 }
1688
1689 units::angle relative_dir = normalize( carry_veh->face.dir() - face.dir() );
1690 units::angle relative_180 = units::fmod( relative_dir, 180_degrees );
1691 units::angle face_dir_180 = normalize( face.dir(), 180_degrees );
1692
1693 // if the carrier is skewed N/S and the carried vehicle isn't aligned with
1694 // the carrier, force the carried vehicle to be at a right angle
1695 if( face_dir_180 >= 45_degrees && face_dir_180 <= 135_degrees ) {
1696 if( relative_180 >= 45_degrees && relative_180 <= 135_degrees ) {
1697 if( relative_dir < 180_degrees ) {
1698 relative_dir = 90_degrees;
1699 } else {
1700 relative_dir = 270_degrees;
1701 }
1702 }
1703 }
1704
1705 // We look at each of the structure parts (mount points, i.e. frames) for the
1706 // carry vehicle and then find a rack part adjacent to it. If we don't find a rack part,
1707 // then we can't merge.
1708 bool found_all_parts = true;
1709 for( auto carry_part : carry_veh_structs ) {
1710
1711 // The current position on the original vehicle for this part
1712 tripoint carry_pos = carry_veh->global_part_pos3( carry_part );
1713
1714 bool merged_part = false;
1715 for( int rack_part : rack_parts ) {
1716 size_t j = 0;
1717 // There's no mathematical transform from global pos3 to vehicle mount, so search for the
1718 // carry part in global pos3 after translating
1719 point carry_mount;
1720 for( const point &offset : four_cardinal_directions ) {
1721 carry_mount = parts[ rack_part ].mount + offset;
1722 tripoint possible_pos = mount_to_tripoint( carry_mount );
1723 if( possible_pos == carry_pos ) {
1724 break;
1725 }
1726 ++j;
1727 }
1728
1729 // We checked the adjacent points from the mounting rack and managed
1730 // to find the current structure part were looking for nearby. If the part was not
1731 // near this particular rack, we would look at each in the list of rack_parts
1732 const bool carry_part_next_to_this_rack = j < four_adjacent_offsets.size();
1733 if( carry_part_next_to_this_rack ) {
1734 mapping carry_map;
1735 point old_mount = carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount;
1736 carry_map.carry_parts_here = carry_veh->parts_at_relative( old_mount, true );
1737 carry_map.rack_part = rack_part;
1738 carry_map.carry_mount = carry_mount;
1739 carry_map.old_mount = old_mount;
1740 carry_data.push_back( carry_map );
1741 merged_part = true;
1742 break;
1743 }
1744 }
1745
1746 // We checked all the racks and could not find a place for this structure part.
1747 if( !merged_part ) {
1748 found_all_parts = false;
1749 break;
1750 }
1751 }
1752
1753 // Now that we have mapped all the parts of the carry vehicle to the vehicle with the rack
1754 // we can go ahead and merge
1755 const point mount_zero{};
1756 if( found_all_parts ) {
1757 decltype( loot_zones ) new_zones;
1758 for( auto carry_map : carry_data ) {
1759 std::string offset = string_format( "%s%3d", carry_map.old_mount == mount_zero ? axis : " ",
1760 axis == "X" ? carry_map.old_mount.x : carry_map.old_mount.y );
1761 std::string unique_id = string_format( "%s%3d%s", offset,
1762 static_cast<int>( to_degrees( relative_dir ) ),
1763 carry_veh->name );
1764 for( int carry_part : carry_map.carry_parts_here ) {
1765 parts.push_back( carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ] );
1766 vehicle_part &carried_part = parts.back();
1767 carried_part.mount = carry_map.carry_mount;
1768 carried_part.carry_names.push( unique_id );
1769 carried_part.enabled = false;
1770 carried_part.set_flag( vehicle_part::carried_flag );
1771 //give each carried part a tracked_flag so that we can re-enable overmap tracking on unloading if necessary
1772 if( carry_veh->tracking_on ) {
1773 carried_part.set_flag( vehicle_part::tracked_flag );
1774 }
1775 parts[ carry_map.rack_part ].set_flag( vehicle_part::carrying_flag );
1776 }
1777
1778 const std::pair<std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator, std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator>
1779 zones_on_point = carry_veh->loot_zones.equal_range( carry_map.old_mount );
1780 for( std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::const_iterator it = zones_on_point.first;
1781 it != zones_on_point.second; ++it ) {
1782 new_zones.emplace( carry_map.carry_mount, it->second );
1783 }
1784 }
1785
1786 for( auto &new_zone : new_zones ) {
1787 zone_manager::get_manager().create_vehicle_loot_zone(
1788 *this, new_zone.first, new_zone.second );
1789 }
1790
1791 // Now that we've added zones to this vehicle, we need to make sure their positions
1792 // update when we next interact with them
1793 zones_dirty = true;
1794
1795 //~ %1$s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
1796 add_msg( _( "You load the %1$s on the rack" ), carry_veh->name );
1797 map &here = get_map();
1798 here.destroy_vehicle( carry_veh );
1799 here.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( this );
1800 here.set_transparency_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z );
1801 here.set_seen_cache_dirty( tripoint_zero );
1802 refresh();
1803 } else {
1804 //~ %1$s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
1805 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You can't get the %1$s on the rack" ), carry_veh->name );
1806 }
1807 return found_all_parts;
1808}
1809
1810/**
1811 * Mark a part as removed from the vehicle.
1812 * @return bool true if the vehicle's 0,0 point shifted.
1813 */
1814bool vehicle::remove_part( const int p )
1815{
1816 DefaultRemovePartHandler handler;
1817 return remove_part( p, handler );
1818}
1819
1820bool vehicle::remove_part( const int p, RemovePartHandler &handler )
1821{
1822 // NOTE: Don't access g or g->m or anything from it directly here.
1823 // Forward all access to the handler.
1824 // There are currently two implementations of it:
1825 // - one for normal game play (vehicle is on the main map g->m),
1826 // - one for mapgen (vehicle is on a temporary map used only during mapgen).
1827 if( p >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
1828 debugmsg( "Tried to remove part %d but only %d parts!", p, parts.size() );
1829 return false;
1830 }
1831 if( parts[p].removed ) {
1832 /* This happens only when we had to remove part, because it was depending on
1833 * other part (using recursive remove_part() call) - currently curtain
1834 * depending on presence of window and seatbelt depending on presence of seat.
1835 */
1836 return false;
1837 }
1838
1839 const tripoint part_loc = global_part_pos3( p );
1840
1841 // Unboard any entities standing on removed boardable parts
1842 if( part_flag( p, "BOARDABLE" ) && parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag ) ) {
1843 handler.unboard( part_loc );
1844 }
1845
1846 // If `p` has flag `parent_flag`, remove child with flag `child_flag`
1847 // Returns true if removal occurs
1848 const auto remove_dependent_part = [&]( const std::string & parent_flag,
1849 const std::string & child_flag ) {
1850 if( part_flag( p, parent_flag ) ) {
1851 int dep = part_with_feature( p, child_flag, false );
1852 if( dep >= 0 && !magic ) {
1853 handler.add_item_or_charges( part_loc, parts[dep].properties_to_item(), false );
1854 remove_part( dep, handler );
1855 return true;
1856 }
1857 }
1858 return false;
1859 };
1860
1861 // if a windshield is removed (usually destroyed) also remove curtains
1862 // attached to it.
1863 if( remove_dependent_part( "WINDOW", "CURTAIN" ) || part_flag( p, VPFLAG_OPAQUE ) ) {
1864 handler.set_transparency_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z );
1865 }
1866
1867 if( part_flag( p, VPFLAG_ROOF ) || part_flag( p, VPFLAG_OPAQUE ) ) {
1868 handler.set_floor_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z + 1 );
1869 }
1870
1871 remove_dependent_part( "SEAT", "SEATBELT" );
1872 remove_dependent_part( "BATTERY_MOUNT", "NEEDS_BATTERY_MOUNT" );
1873
1874 // Release any animal held by the part
1875 if( parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::animal_flag ) ) {
1876 item base = parts[p].get_base();
1877 handler.spawn_animal_from_part( base, part_loc );
1878 parts[p].set_base( base );
1879 parts[p].remove_flag( vehicle_part::animal_flag );
1880 }
1881
1882 // Update current engine configuration if needed
1883 if( part_flag( p, "ENGINE" ) && engines.size() > 1 ) {
1884 bool any_engine_on = false;
1885
1886 for( auto &e : engines ) {
1887 if( e != p && is_part_on( e ) ) {
1888 any_engine_on = true;
1889 break;
1890 }
1891 }
1892
1893 if( !any_engine_on ) {
1894 engine_on = false;
1895 for( auto &e : engines ) {
1896 toggle_specific_part( e, true );
1897 }
1898 }
1899 }
1900
1901 //Remove loot zone if Cargo was removed.
1902 const auto lz_iter = loot_zones.find( parts[p].mount );
1903 const bool no_zone = lz_iter != loot_zones.end();
1904
1905 if( no_zone && part_flag( p, "CARGO" ) ) {
1906 // Using the key here (instead of the iterator) will remove all zones on
1907 // this mount points regardless of how many there are
1908 loot_zones.erase( parts[p].mount );
1909 zones_dirty = true;
1910 }
1911 parts[p].removed = true;
1912 removed_part_count++;
1913
1914 handler.removed( *this, p );
1915
1916 const point &vp_mount = parts[p].mount;
1917 const auto iter = labels.find( label( vp_mount ) );
1918 if( iter != labels.end() && parts_at_relative( vp_mount, false ).empty() ) {
1919 labels.erase( iter );
1920 }
1921
1922 for( auto &i : get_items( p ) ) {
1923 // Note: this can spawn items on the other side of the wall!
1924 // TODO: fix this ^^
1925 tripoint dest( part_loc + point( rng( -3, 3 ), rng( -3, 3 ) ) );
1926 if( !magic ) {
1927 // This new point might be out of the map bounds. It's not
1928 // reasonable to try to spawn it outside the currently valid map,
1929 // so we pass true here to cause such points to be clamped to the
1930 // valid bounds without printing an error (as would normally
1931 // occur).
1932 handler.add_item_or_charges( dest, i, true );
1933 }
1934 }
1935 refresh();
1936 coeff_air_changed = true;
1937 return shift_if_needed();
1938}
1939
1940void vehicle::part_removal_cleanup()
1941{
1942 bool changed = false;
1943 map &here = get_map();
1944 for( std::vector<vehicle_part>::iterator it = parts.begin(); it != parts.end(); /* noop */ ) {
1945 if( it->removed ) {
1946 auto items = get_items( std::distance( parts.begin(), it ) );
1947 while( !items.empty() ) {
1948 items.erase( items.begin() );
1949 }
1950 const tripoint &pt = global_part_pos3( *it );
1951 here.clear_vehicle_point_from_cache( this, pt );
1952 it = parts.erase( it );
1953 changed = true;
1954 } else {
1955 ++it;
1956 }
1957 }
1958 removed_part_count = 0;
1959 if( changed || parts.empty() ) {
1960 refresh();
1961 if( parts.empty() ) {
1962 here.destroy_vehicle( this );
1963 return;
1964 } else {
1965 here.add_vehicle_to_cache( this );
1966 }
1967 }
1968 shift_if_needed();
1969 refresh(); // Rebuild cached indices
1970 coeff_air_dirty = coeff_air_changed;
1971 coeff_air_changed = false;
1972}
1973
1974void vehicle::remove_carried_flag()
1975{
1976 for( vehicle_part &part : parts ) {
1977 if( part.carry_names.empty() ) {
1978 // note: we get here if the part was added while the vehicle was carried / mounted. This is not expected.
1979 // still try to remove the carried flag, if any.
1980 part.remove_flag( vehicle_part::carried_flag );
1981 } else {
1982 part.carry_names.pop();
1983 if( part.carry_names.empty() ) {
1984 part.remove_flag( vehicle_part::carried_flag );
1985 }
1986 }
1987 }
1988}
1989
1990void vehicle::remove_tracked_flag()
1991{
1992 for( vehicle_part &part : parts ) {
1993 if( part.carry_names.empty() ) {
1994 part.remove_flag( vehicle_part::tracked_flag );
1995 } else {
1996 part.carry_names.pop();
1997 if( part.carry_names.empty() ) {
1998 part.remove_flag( vehicle_part::tracked_flag );
1999 }
2000 }
2001 }
2002}
2003
2004bool vehicle::remove_carried_vehicle( const std::vector<int> &carried_parts )
2005{
2006 if( carried_parts.empty() ) {
2007 return false;
2008 }
2009 std::string veh_record;
2010 tripoint new_pos3;
2011 bool x_aligned = false;
2012 bool tracked_parts =
2013 false; // we will set this to true if any of the vehicle parts carry a tracked_flag
2014 for( int carried_part : carried_parts ) {
2015 //check if selected part carries tracking flag
2016 if( parts[carried_part].has_flag(
2017 vehicle_part::tracked_flag ) ) { //this should only need to run once
2018 tracked_parts = true;
2019 }
2020 const auto &carry_names = parts[carried_part].carry_names;
2021 if( !carry_names.empty() ) {
2022 std::string id_string = carry_names.top().substr( 0, 1 );
2023 if( id_string == "X" || id_string == "Y" ) {
2024 veh_record = carry_names.top();
2025 new_pos3 = global_part_pos3( carried_part );
2026 x_aligned = id_string == "X";
2027 break;
2028 }
2029 }
2030 }
2031 if( veh_record.empty() ) {
2032 return false;
2033 }
2034 units::angle new_dir =
2035 normalize( units::from_degrees( std::stoi( veh_record.substr( 4, 3 ) ) ) + face.dir() );
2036 units::angle host_dir = normalize( face.dir(), 180_degrees );
2037 // if the host is skewed N/S, and the carried vehicle is going to come at an angle,
2038 // force it to east/west instead
2039 if( host_dir >= 45_degrees && host_dir <= 135_degrees ) {
2040 if( new_dir <= 45_degrees || new_dir >= 315_degrees ) {
2041 new_dir = 0_degrees;
2042 } else if( new_dir >= 135_degrees && new_dir <= 225_degrees ) {
2043 new_dir = 180_degrees;
2044 }
2045 }
2046 vehicle *new_vehicle = g->m.add_vehicle( vproto_id( "none" ), new_pos3, new_dir );
2047 if( new_vehicle == nullptr ) {
2048 add_msg( m_debug, "Unable to unload bike rack, host face %d, new_dir %d!",
2049 to_degrees( face.dir() ), to_degrees( new_dir ) );
2050 return false;
2051 }
2052
2053 std::vector<point> new_mounts;
2054 new_vehicle->name = veh_record.substr( vehicle_part::name_offset );
2055 for( auto carried_part : carried_parts ) {
2056 point new_mount;
2057 std::string mount_str;
2058 if( !parts[carried_part].carry_names.empty() ) {
2059 // the mount string should be something like "X 0 0" for ex. We get the first number out of it.
2060 mount_str = parts[carried_part].carry_names.top().substr( 1, 3 );
2061 } else {
2062 // FIX #28712; if we get here it means that a part was added to the bike while the latter was a carried vehicle.
2063 // This part didn't get a carry_names because those are assigned when the carried vehicle is loaded.
2064 // We can't be sure to which vehicle it really belongs to, so it will be detached from the vehicle.
2065 // We can at least inform the player that there's something wrong.
2066 add_msg( m_warning,
2067 _( "A part of the vehicle ('%s') has no containing vehicle's name. It will be detached from the %s vehicle." ),
2068 parts[carried_part].name(), new_vehicle->name );
2069
2070 // check if any other parts at the same location have a valid carry name so we can still have a valid mount location.
2071 for( auto &local_part : parts_at_relative( parts[carried_part].mount, true ) ) {
2072 if( !parts[local_part].carry_names.empty() ) {
2073 mount_str = parts[local_part].carry_names.top().substr( 1, 3 );
2074 break;
2075 }
2076 }
2077 }
2078 if( mount_str.empty() ) {
2079 add_msg( m_bad,
2080 _( "There's not viable mount location on this vehicle: %s. It can't be unloaded from the rack." ),
2081 new_vehicle->name );
2082 return false;
2083 }
2084 if( x_aligned ) {
2085 new_mount.x = std::stoi( mount_str );
2086 } else {
2087 new_mount.y = std::stoi( mount_str );
2088 }
2089 new_mounts.push_back( new_mount );
2090 }
2091
2092 std::vector<vehicle *> new_vehicles;
2093 new_vehicles.push_back( new_vehicle );
2094 std::vector<std::vector<int>> carried_vehicles;
2095 carried_vehicles.push_back( carried_parts );
2096 std::vector<std::vector<point>> carried_mounts;
2097 carried_mounts.push_back( new_mounts );
2098 const bool success = split_vehicles( carried_vehicles, new_vehicles, carried_mounts );
2099 if( success ) {
2100 //~ %s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
2101 add_msg( _( "You unload the %s from the bike rack." ), new_vehicle->name );
2102 new_vehicle->remove_carried_flag();
2103 if( tracked_parts ) {
2104 new_vehicle->toggle_tracking(); //turn on tracking for our newly created vehicle
2105 new_vehicle->remove_tracked_flag(); //remove our tracking flags now that the vehicle isn't carried
2106 }
2107 g->m.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( this );
2108 part_removal_cleanup();
2109 } else {
2110 //~ %s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
2111 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You can't unload the %s from the bike rack." ), new_vehicle->name );
2112 }
2113 return success;
2114}
2115
2116// split the current vehicle into up to 3 new vehicles that do not connect to each other
2117bool vehicle::find_and_split_vehicles( int exclude )
2118{
2119 std::vector<int> valid_parts = all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
2120 std::set<int> checked_parts;
2121 checked_parts.insert( exclude );
2122
2123 std::vector<std::vector <int>> all_vehicles;
2124
2125 for( size_t cnt = 0 ; cnt < 4 ; cnt++ ) {
2126 int test_part = -1;
2127 for( auto p : valid_parts ) {
2128 if( parts[ p ].removed ) {
2129 continue;
2130 }
2131 if( checked_parts.find( p ) == checked_parts.end() ) {
2132 test_part = p;
2133 break;
2134 }
2135 }
2136 if( test_part == -1 || static_cast<size_t>( test_part ) > parts.size() ) {
2137 break;
2138 }
2139
2140 std::queue<std::pair<int, std::vector<int>>> search_queue;
2141
2142 const auto push_neighbor = [&]( int p, const std::vector<int> &with_p ) {
2143 std::pair<int, std::vector<int>> data( p, with_p );
2144 search_queue.push( data );
2145 };
2146 auto pop_neighbor = [&]() {
2147 std::pair<int, std::vector<int>> result = search_queue.front();
2148 search_queue.pop();
2149 return result;
2150 };
2151
2152 std::vector<int> veh_parts;
2153 push_neighbor( test_part, parts_at_relative( parts[ test_part ].mount, true ) );
2154 while( !search_queue.empty() ) {
2155 std::pair<int, std::vector<int>> test_set = pop_neighbor();
2156 test_part = test_set.first;
2157 if( checked_parts.find( test_part ) != checked_parts.end() ) {
2158 continue;
2159 }
2160 for( auto p : test_set.second ) {
2161 veh_parts.push_back( p );
2162 }
2163 checked_parts.insert( test_part );
2164 for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
2165 const point dp = parts[test_part].mount + offset;
2166 std::vector<int> all_neighbor_parts = parts_at_relative( dp, true );
2167 int neighbor_struct_part = -1;
2168 for( int p : all_neighbor_parts ) {
2169 if( parts[ p ].removed ) {
2170 continue;
2171 }
2172 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure ) {
2173 neighbor_struct_part = p;
2174 break;
2175 }
2176 }
2177 if( neighbor_struct_part != -1 ) {
2178 push_neighbor( neighbor_struct_part, all_neighbor_parts );
2179 }
2180 }
2181 }
2182 // don't include the first vehicle's worth of parts
2183 if( cnt > 0 ) {
2184 all_vehicles.push_back( veh_parts );
2185 }
2186 }
2187
2188 if( !all_vehicles.empty() ) {
2189 bool success = split_vehicles( all_vehicles );
2190 if( success ) {
2191 // update the active cache
2192 shift_parts( point_zero );
2193 return true;
2194 }
2195 }
2196 return false;
2197}
2198
2199void vehicle::relocate_passengers( const std::vector<player *> &passengers )
2200{
2201 const auto boardables = get_avail_parts( "BOARDABLE" );
2202 for( player *passenger : passengers ) {
2203 for( const vpart_reference &vp : boardables ) {
2204 if( vp.part().passenger_id == passenger->getID() ) {
2205 passenger->setpos( vp.pos() );
2206 }
2207 }
2208 }
2209}
2210
2211// Split a vehicle into an old vehicle and one or more new vehicles by moving vehicle_parts
2212// from one the old vehicle to the new vehicles.
2213// some of the logic borrowed from remove_part
2214// skipped the grab, curtain, player activity, and engine checks because they deal
2215// with pos, not a vehicle pointer
2216// @param new_vehs vector of vectors of part indexes to move to new vehicles
2217// @param new_vehicles vector of vehicle pointers containing the new vehicles; if empty, new
2218// vehicles will be created
2219// @param new_mounts vector of vector of mount points. must have one vector for every vehicle*
2220// in new_vehicles, and forces the part indices in new_vehs to be mounted on the new vehicle
2221// at those mount points
2222bool vehicle::split_vehicles( const std::vector<std::vector <int>> &new_vehs,
2223 const std::vector<vehicle *> &new_vehicles,
2224 const std::vector<std::vector <point>> &new_mounts )
2225{
2226 bool did_split = false;
2227 size_t i = 0;
2228 for( i = 0; i < new_vehs.size(); i ++ ) {
2229 std::vector<int> split_parts = new_vehs[ i ];
2230 if( split_parts.empty() ) {
2231 continue;
2232 }
2233 std::vector<point> split_mounts = new_mounts[ i ];
2234 did_split = true;
2235
2236 vehicle *new_vehicle = nullptr;
2237 if( i < new_vehicles.size() ) {
2238 new_vehicle = new_vehicles[ i ];
2239 }
2240 int split_part0 = split_parts.front();
2241 tripoint new_v_pos3;
2242 point mnt_offset;
2243
2244 decltype( labels ) new_labels;
2245 decltype( loot_zones ) new_zones;
2246 if( new_vehicle == nullptr ) {
2247 // make sure the split_part0 is a legal 0,0 part
2248 if( split_parts.size() > 1 ) {
2249 for( size_t sp = 0; sp < split_parts.size(); sp++ ) {
2250 int p = split_parts[ sp ];
2251 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure &&
2252 !part_info( p ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
2253 split_part0 = sp;
2254 break;
2255 }
2256 }
2257 }
2258 new_v_pos3 = global_part_pos3( parts[ split_part0 ] );
2259 mnt_offset = parts[ split_part0 ].mount;
2260 new_vehicle = g->m.add_vehicle( vproto_id( "none" ), new_v_pos3, face.dir() );
2261 if( new_vehicle == nullptr ) {
2262 // the split part was out of the map bounds.
2263 continue;
2264 }
2265 new_vehicle->name = name;
2266 new_vehicle->move = move;
2267 new_vehicle->turn_dir = turn_dir;
2268 new_vehicle->velocity = velocity;
2269 new_vehicle->vertical_velocity = vertical_velocity;
2270 new_vehicle->cruise_velocity = cruise_velocity;
2271 new_vehicle->cruise_on = cruise_on;
2272 new_vehicle->engine_on = engine_on;
2273 new_vehicle->tracking_on = tracking_on;
2274 new_vehicle->camera_on = camera_on;
2275 }
2276 new_vehicle->last_fluid_check = last_fluid_check;
2277
2278 std::vector<player *> passengers;
2279 for( size_t new_part = 0; new_part < split_parts.size(); new_part++ ) {
2280 int mov_part = split_parts[ new_part ];
2281 point cur_mount = parts[ mov_part ].mount;
2282 point new_mount = cur_mount;
2283 if( !split_mounts.empty() ) {
2284 new_mount = split_mounts[ new_part ];
2285 } else {
2286 new_mount -= mnt_offset;
2287 }
2288
2289 player *passenger = nullptr;
2290 // Unboard any entities standing on any transferred part
2291 if( part_flag( mov_part, "BOARDABLE" ) ) {
2292 passenger = get_passenger( mov_part );
2293 if( passenger ) {
2294 passengers.push_back( passenger );
2295 }
2296 }
2297 // if this part is a towing part, transfer the tow_data to the new vehicle.
2298 if( part_flag( mov_part, "TOW_CABLE" ) ) {
2299 if( is_towed() ) {
2300 tow_data.get_towed_by()->tow_data.set_towing( tow_data.get_towed_by(), new_vehicle );
2301 tow_data.clear_towing();
2302 } else if( is_towing() ) {
2303 tow_data.get_towed()->tow_data.set_towing( new_vehicle, tow_data.get_towed() );
2304 tow_data.clear_towing();
2305 }
2306 }
2307 // transfer the vehicle_part to the new vehicle
2308 new_vehicle->parts.emplace_back( parts[ mov_part ] );
2309 new_vehicle->parts.back().mount = new_mount;
2310
2311 // remove labels associated with the mov_part
2312 const auto iter = labels.find( label( cur_mount ) );
2313 if( iter != labels.end() ) {
2314 std::string label_str = iter->text;
2315 labels.erase( iter );
2316 new_labels.insert( label( new_mount, label_str ) );
2317 }
2318 // Prepare the zones to be moved to the new vehicle
2319 const std::pair<std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator, std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator>
2320 zones_on_point = loot_zones.equal_range( cur_mount );
2321 for( std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::const_iterator lz_iter = zones_on_point.first;
2322 lz_iter != zones_on_point.second; ++lz_iter ) {
2323 new_zones.emplace( new_mount, lz_iter->second );
2324 }
2325
2326 // Erasing on the key removes all the zones from the point at once
2327 loot_zones.erase( cur_mount );
2328
2329 // The zone manager will be updated when we next interact with it through get_vehicle_zones
2330 zones_dirty = true;
2331
2332 // remove the passenger from the old vehicle
