2333 if( passenger ) {
2334 parts[ mov_part ].remove_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag );
2335 parts[ mov_part ].passenger_id = character_id();
2336 }
2337 // indicate the part needs to be removed from the old vehicle
2338 parts[ mov_part].removed = true;
2339 removed_part_count++;
2340 }
2341
2342 // We want to create the vehicle zones after we've setup the parts
2343 // because we need only to move the zone once per mount, not per part. If we move per
2344 // part, we will end up with duplicates of the zone per part on the same mount
2345 for( std::pair<point, zone_data> zone : new_zones ) {
2346 zone_manager::get_manager().create_vehicle_loot_zone( *new_vehicle, zone.first, zone.second );
2347 }
2348
2349 // create_vehicle_loot_zone marks the vehicle as not dirty but since we got these zones
2350 // in an unknown state from the previous vehicle, we need to let the cache rebuild next
2351 // time we interact with them
2352 new_vehicle->zones_dirty = true;
2353
2354 map &here = get_map();
2355 here.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( new_vehicle );
2356 here.set_transparency_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z );
2357 here.set_seen_cache_dirty( tripoint_zero );
2358 if( !new_labels.empty() ) {
2359 new_vehicle->labels = new_labels;
2360 }
2361
2362 if( split_mounts.empty() ) {
2363 new_vehicle->refresh();
2364 } else {
2365 // include refresh
2366 new_vehicle->shift_parts( point_zero - mnt_offset );
2367 }
2368
2369 // update the precalc points
2370 new_vehicle->precalc_mounts( 1, new_vehicle->skidding ?
2371 new_vehicle->turn_dir : new_vehicle->face.dir(),
2372 new_vehicle->pivot_point() );
2373 if( !passengers.empty() ) {
2374 new_vehicle->relocate_passengers( passengers );
2375 }
2376 }
2377 return did_split;
2378}
2379
2380bool vehicle::split_vehicles( const std::vector<std::vector <int>> &new_vehs )
2381{
2382 std::vector<vehicle *> null_vehicles;
2383 std::vector<std::vector <point>> null_mounts;
2384 std::vector<point> nothing;
2385 null_vehicles.assign( new_vehs.size(), nullptr );
2386 null_mounts.assign( new_vehs.size(), nothing );
2387 return split_vehicles( new_vehs, null_vehicles, null_mounts );
2388}
2389
2390item_location vehicle::part_base( int p )
2391{
2392 return item_location( vehicle_cursor( *this, p ), &parts[ p ].base );
2393}
2394
2395int vehicle::find_part( const item &it ) const
2396{
2397 auto idx = std::find_if( parts.begin(), parts.end(), [&it]( const vehicle_part & e ) {
2398 return &e.base == &it;
2399 } );
2400 return idx != parts.end() ? std::distance( parts.begin(), idx ) : INT_MIN;
2401}
2402
2403item_group::ItemList vehicle_part::pieces_for_broken_part() const
2404{
2405 const item_group_id &group = info().breaks_into_group;
2406 // TODO: make it optional? Or use id of empty item group?
2407 if( !group ) {
2408 return {};
2409 }
2410
2411 return item_group::items_from( group, calendar::turn );
2412}
2413
2414std::vector<int> vehicle::parts_at_relative( const point &dp,
2415 const bool use_cache ) const
2416{
2417 if( !use_cache ) {
2418 std::vector<int> res;
2419 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
2420 if( vp.mount() == dp && !vp.part().removed ) {
2421 res.push_back( static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() ) );
2422 }
2423 }
2424 return res;
2425 } else {
2426 const auto &iter = relative_parts.find( dp );
2427 if( iter != relative_parts.end() ) {
2428 return iter->second;
2429 } else {
2430 std::vector<int> res;
2431 return res;
2432 }
2433 }
2434}
2435
2436cata::optional<vpart_reference> vpart_position::obstacle_at_part() const
2437{
2438 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> part = part_with_feature( VPFLAG_OBSTACLE, true );
2439 if( !part ) {
2440 return cata::nullopt; // No obstacle here
2441 }
2442
2443 if( part->has_feature( VPFLAG_OPENABLE ) && part->part().open ) {
2444 return cata::nullopt; // Open door here
2445 }
2446
2447 return part;
2448}
2449
2450cata::optional<vpart_reference> vpart_position::part_displayed() const
2451{
2452 int part_id = vehicle().part_displayed_at( mount() );
2453 if( part_id == -1 ) {
2454 return cata::nullopt;
2455 }
2456 return vpart_reference( vehicle(), part_id );
2457}
2458
2459cata::optional<vpart_reference> vpart_position::part_with_feature( const std::string &f,
2460 const bool unbroken ) const
2461{
2462 const int i = vehicle().part_with_feature( part_index(), f, unbroken );
2463 if( i < 0 ) {
2464 return cata::nullopt;
2465 }
2466 return vpart_reference( vehicle(), i );
2467}
2468
2469cata::optional<vpart_reference> vpart_position::part_with_feature( const vpart_bitflags f,
2470 const bool unbroken ) const
2471{
2472 const int i = vehicle().part_with_feature( part_index(), f, unbroken );
2473 if( i < 0 ) {
2474 return cata::nullopt;
2475 }
2476 return vpart_reference( vehicle(), i );
2477}
2478
2479cata::optional<vpart_reference> optional_vpart_position::part_with_feature( const std::string &f,
2480 const bool unbroken ) const
2481{
2482 return has_value() ? value().part_with_feature( f, unbroken ) : cata::nullopt;
2483}
2484
2485cata::optional<vpart_reference> optional_vpart_position::part_with_feature( const vpart_bitflags f,
2486 const bool unbroken ) const
2487{
2488 return has_value() ? value().part_with_feature( f, unbroken ) : cata::nullopt;
2489}
2490
2491cata::optional<vpart_reference> optional_vpart_position::obstacle_at_part() const
2492{
2493 return has_value() ? value().obstacle_at_part() : cata::nullopt;
2494}
2495
2496cata::optional<vpart_reference> optional_vpart_position::part_displayed() const
2497{
2498 return has_value() ? value().part_displayed() : cata::nullopt;
2499}
2500
2501int vehicle::part_with_feature( int part, vpart_bitflags const flag, bool unbroken ) const
2502{
2503 if( part_flag( part, flag ) && ( !unbroken || !parts[part].is_broken() ) ) {
2504 return part;
2505 }
2506 const auto it = relative_parts.find( parts[part].mount );
2507 if( it != relative_parts.end() ) {
2508 const std::vector<int> &parts_here = it->second;
2509 for( auto &i : parts_here ) {
2510 if( part_flag( i, flag ) && ( !unbroken || !parts[i].is_broken() ) ) {
2511 return i;
2512 }
2513 }
2514 }
2515 return -1;
2516}
2517
2518int vehicle::part_with_feature( int part, const std::string &flag, bool unbroken ) const
2519{
2520 return part_with_feature( parts[part].mount, flag, unbroken );
2521}
2522
2523int vehicle::part_with_feature( const point &pt, const std::string &flag, bool unbroken ) const
2524{
2525 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( pt, false );
2526 for( auto &elem : parts_here ) {
2527 if( part_flag( elem, flag ) && ( !unbroken || !parts[ elem ].is_broken() ) ) {
2528 return elem;
2529 }
2530 }
2531 return -1;
2532}
2533
2534int vehicle::avail_part_with_feature( int part, vpart_bitflags const flag, bool unbroken ) const
2535{
2536 int part_a = part_with_feature( part, flag, unbroken );
2537 if( ( part_a >= 0 ) && parts[ part_a ].is_available() ) {
2538 return part_a;
2539 }
2540 return -1;
2541}
2542
2543int vehicle::avail_part_with_feature( int part, const std::string &flag, bool unbroken ) const
2544{
2545 return avail_part_with_feature( parts[ part ].mount, flag, unbroken );
2546}
2547
2548int vehicle::avail_part_with_feature( const point &pt, const std::string &flag,
2549 bool unbroken ) const
2550{
2551 int part_a = part_with_feature( pt, flag, unbroken );
2552 if( ( part_a >= 0 ) && parts[ part_a ].is_available() ) {
2553 return part_a;
2554 }
2555 return -1;
2556}
2557
2558bool vehicle::has_part( const std::string &flag, bool enabled ) const
2559{
2560 return std::any_of( parts.begin(), parts.end(), [&flag, &enabled]( const vehicle_part & e ) {
2561 return !e.removed && ( !enabled || e.enabled ) && !e.is_broken() && e.info().has_flag( flag );
2562 } );
2563}
2564
2565bool vehicle::has_part( const tripoint &pos, const std::string &flag, bool enabled ) const
2566{
2567 const tripoint relative_pos = pos - global_pos3();
2568
2569 for( const auto &e : parts ) {
2570 if( e.precalc[0] != relative_pos ) {
2571 continue;
2572 }
2573 if( !e.removed && ( !enabled || e.enabled ) && !e.is_broken() && e.info().has_flag( flag ) ) {
2574 return true;
2575 }
2576 }
2577 return false;
2578}
2579
2580std::vector<vehicle_part *> vehicle::get_parts_at( const tripoint &pos, const std::string &flag,
2581 const part_status_flag condition )
2582{
2583 const tripoint relative_pos = pos - global_pos3();
2584 std::vector<vehicle_part *> res;
2585 for( auto &e : parts ) {
2586 if( e.precalc[ 0 ] != relative_pos ) {
2587 continue;
2588 }
2589 if( !e.removed &&
2590 ( flag.empty() || e.info().has_flag( flag ) ) &&
2591 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::enabled ) || e.enabled ) &&
2592 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::working ) || !e.is_broken() ) ) {
2593 res.push_back( &e );
2594 }
2595 }
2596 return res;
2597}
2598
2599std::vector<const vehicle_part *> vehicle::get_parts_at( const tripoint &pos,
2600 const std::string &flag,
2601 const part_status_flag condition ) const
2602{
2603 const tripoint relative_pos = pos - global_pos3();
2604 std::vector<const vehicle_part *> res;
2605 for( const auto &e : parts ) {
2606 if( e.precalc[ 0 ] != relative_pos ) {
2607 continue;
2608 }
2609 if( !e.removed &&
2610 ( flag.empty() || e.info().has_flag( flag ) ) &&
2611 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::enabled ) || e.enabled ) &&
2612 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::working ) || !e.is_broken() ) ) {
2613 res.push_back( &e );
2614 }
2615 }
2616 return res;
2617}
2618
2619cata::optional<std::string> vpart_position::get_label() const
2620{
2621 const auto it = vehicle().labels.find( label( mount() ) );
2622 if( it == vehicle().labels.end() ) {
2623 return cata::nullopt;
2624 }
2625 if( it->text.empty() ) {
2626 // legacy support TODO: change labels into a map and keep track of deleted labels
2627 return cata::nullopt;
2628 }
2629 return it->text;
2630}
2631
2632void vpart_position::set_label( const std::string &text ) const
2633{
2634 auto &labels = vehicle().labels;
2635 const auto it = labels.find( label( mount() ) );
2636 // TODO: empty text should remove the label instead of just storing an empty string, see get_label
2637 if( it == labels.end() ) {
2638 labels.insert( label( mount(), text ) );
2639 } else {
2640 // labels should really be a map
2641 labels.insert( labels.erase( it ), label( mount(), text ) );
2642 }
2643}
2644
2645int vehicle::next_part_to_close( int p, bool outside ) const
2646{
2647 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
2648
2649 // We want reverse, since we close the outermost thing first (curtains), and then the innermost thing (door)
2650 for( std::vector<int>::reverse_iterator part_it = parts_here.rbegin();
2651 part_it != parts_here.rend();
2652 ++part_it ) {
2653
2654 if( part_flag( *part_it, VPFLAG_OPENABLE )
2655 && parts[ *part_it ].is_available()
2656 && parts[*part_it].open == 1
2657 && ( !outside || !part_flag( *part_it, "OPENCLOSE_INSIDE" ) ) ) {
2658 return *part_it;
2659 }
2660 }
2661 return -1;
2662}
2663
2664int vehicle::next_part_to_open( int p, bool outside ) const
2665{
2666 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
2667
2668 // We want forwards, since we open the innermost thing first (curtains), and then the innermost thing (door)
2669 for( auto &elem : parts_here ) {
2670 if( part_flag( elem, VPFLAG_OPENABLE ) && parts[ elem ].is_available() && parts[elem].open == 0 &&
2671 ( !outside || !part_flag( elem, "OPENCLOSE_INSIDE" ) ) ) {
2672 return elem;
2673 }
2674 }
2675 return -1;
2676}
2677
2678vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string> vehicle::get_avail_parts( std::string feature ) const
2679{
2680 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ),
2681 std::move( feature ),
2682 static_cast<part_status_flag>( part_status_flag::working |
2683 part_status_flag::available ) );
2684}
2685
2686vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags> vehicle::get_avail_parts(
2687 const vpart_bitflags feature ) const
2688{
2689 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ), feature,
2690 static_cast<part_status_flag>( part_status_flag::working |
2691 part_status_flag::available ) );
2692}
2693
2694vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string> vehicle::get_parts_including_carried(
2695 std::string feature ) const
2696{
2697 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ),
2698 std::move( feature ), part_status_flag::working );
2699}
2700
2701vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags> vehicle::get_parts_including_carried(
2702 const vpart_bitflags feature ) const
2703{
2704 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ), feature,
2705 part_status_flag::working );
2706}
2707
2708vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string> vehicle::get_any_parts( std::string feature ) const
2709{
2710 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ),
2711 std::move( feature ), part_status_flag::any );
2712}
2713
2714vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags> vehicle::get_any_parts(
2715 const vpart_bitflags feature ) const
2716{
2717 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ), feature,
2718 part_status_flag::any );
2719}
2720
2721vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string> vehicle::get_enabled_parts( std::string feature ) const
2722{
2723 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ),
2724 std::move( feature ),
2725 static_cast<part_status_flag>( part_status_flag::enabled |
2726 part_status_flag::working |
2727 part_status_flag::available ) );
2728}
2729
2730vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags> vehicle::get_enabled_parts(
2731 const vpart_bitflags feature ) const
2732{
2733 return vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags>( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ), feature,
2734 static_cast<part_status_flag>( part_status_flag::enabled |
2735 part_status_flag::working |
2736 part_status_flag::available ) );
2737}
2738
2739/**
2740 * Returns all parts in the vehicle that exist in the given location slot. If
2741 * the empty string is passed in, returns all parts with no slot.
2742 * @param location The location slot to get parts for.
2743 * @return A list of indices to all parts with the specified location.
2744 */
2745std::vector<int> vehicle::all_parts_at_location( const std::string &location ) const
2746{
2747 std::vector<int> parts_found;
2748 for( size_t part_index = 0; part_index < parts.size(); ++part_index ) {
2749 if( part_info( part_index ).location == location && !parts[part_index].removed ) {
2750 parts_found.push_back( part_index );
2751 }
2752 }
2753 return parts_found;
2754}
2755
2756// another NPC probably removed a part in the time it took to walk here and start the activity.
2757// as the part index was first "chosen" before the NPC started traveling here.
2758// therefore the part index is now invalid shifted by one or two ( depending on how many other NPCs working on this vehicle )
2759// so loop over the part indexes in reverse order to get the next one down that matches the part type we wanted to remove
2760int vehicle::get_next_shifted_index( int original_index, player &p )
2761{
2762 int ret_index = original_index;
2763 bool found_shifted_index = false;
2764 for( std::vector<vehicle_part>::reverse_iterator it = parts.rbegin(); it != parts.rend(); ++it ) {
2765 if( p.get_value( "veh_index_type" ) == it->info().name() ) {
2766 ret_index = index_of_part( &*it );
2767 found_shifted_index = true;
2768 break;
2769 }
2770 }
2771 if( !found_shifted_index ) {
2772 // we are probably down to a few parts left, and things get messy here, so an alternative index maybe can't be found
2773 // if loads of npcs are all removing parts at the same time.
2774 // if that's the case, just bail out and give up, somebody else is probably doing the job right now anyway.
2775 return -1;
2776 } else {
2777 return ret_index;
2778 }
2779}
2780
2781/**
2782 * Returns all parts in the vehicle that have the specified flag in their vpinfo and
2783 * are on the same X-axis or Y-axis as the input part and are contiguous with each other.
2784 * @param part The part to find adjacent parts to
2785 * @param flag The flag to match
2786 * @return A list of lists of indices of all parts sharing the flag and contiguous with the part
2787 * on the X or Y axis. Returns 0, 1, or 2 lists of indices.
2788 */
2789std::vector<std::vector<int>> vehicle::find_lines_of_parts( int part, const std::string &flag )
2790{
2791 const auto possible_parts = get_avail_parts( flag );
2792 std::vector<std::vector<int>> ret_parts;
2793 if( empty( possible_parts ) ) {
2794 return ret_parts;
2795 }
2796
2797 std::vector<int> x_parts;
2798 std::vector<int> y_parts;
2799 vpart_id part_id = part_info( part ).get_id();
2800 // create vectors of parts on the same X or Y axis
2801 point target = parts[ part ].mount;
2802 for( const vpart_reference &vp : possible_parts ) {
2803 if( vp.part().is_unavailable() ||
2804 !vp.has_feature( "MULTISQUARE" ) ||
2805 vp.info().get_id() != part_id ) {
2806 continue;
2807 }
2808 if( vp.mount().x == target.x ) {
2809 x_parts.push_back( vp.part_index() );
2810 }
2811 if( vp.mount().y == target.y ) {
2812 y_parts.push_back( vp.part_index() );
2813 }
2814 }
2815
2816 if( x_parts.size() > 1 ) {
2817 std::vector<int> x_ret;
2818 // sort by Y-axis, since they're all on the same X-axis
2819 const auto x_sorter = [&]( const int lhs, const int rhs ) {
2820 return( parts[lhs].mount.y > parts[rhs].mount.y );
2821 };
2822 std::sort( x_parts.begin(), x_parts.end(), x_sorter );
2823 int first_part = 0;
2824 int prev_y = parts[ x_parts[ 0 ] ].mount.y;
2825 int i;
2826 bool found_part = x_parts[ 0 ] == part;
2827 for( i = 1; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < x_parts.size(); i++ ) {
2828 // if the Y difference is > 1, there's a break in the run
2829 if( std::abs( parts[ x_parts[ i ] ].mount.y - prev_y ) > 1 ) {
2830 // if we found the part, this is the run we wanted
2831 if( found_part ) {
2832 break;
2833 }
2834 first_part = i;
2835 }
2836 found_part |= x_parts[ i ] == part;
2837 prev_y = parts[ x_parts[ i ] ].mount.y;
2838 }
2839 for( size_t j = first_part; j < static_cast<size_t>( i ); j++ ) {
2840 x_ret.push_back( x_parts[ j ] );
2841 }
2842 ret_parts.push_back( x_ret );
2843 }
2844 if( y_parts.size() > 1 ) {
2845 std::vector<int> y_ret;
2846 const auto y_sorter = [&]( const int lhs, const int rhs ) {
2847 return( parts[lhs].mount.x > parts[rhs].mount.x );
2848 };
2849 std::sort( y_parts.begin(), y_parts.end(), y_sorter );
2850 int first_part = 0;
2851 int prev_x = parts[ y_parts[ 0 ] ].mount.x;
2852 int i;
2853 bool found_part = y_parts[ 0 ] == part;
2854 for( i = 1; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < y_parts.size(); i++ ) {
2855 if( std::abs( parts[ y_parts[ i ] ].mount.x - prev_x ) > 1 ) {
2856 if( found_part ) {
2857 break;
2858 }
2859 first_part = i;
2860 }
2861 found_part |= y_parts[ i ] == part;
2862 prev_x = parts[ y_parts[ i ] ].mount.x;
2863 }
2864 for( size_t j = first_part; j < static_cast<size_t>( i ); j++ ) {
2865 y_ret.push_back( y_parts[ j ] );
2866 }
2867 ret_parts.push_back( y_ret );
2868 }
2869 if( y_parts.size() == 1 && x_parts.size() == 1 ) {
2870 ret_parts.push_back( x_parts );
2871 }
2872 return ret_parts;
2873}
2874
2875bool vehicle::part_flag( int part, const std::string &flag ) const
2876{
2877 if( part < 0 || part >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) || parts[part].removed ) {
2878 return false;
2879 } else {
2880 return part_info( part ).has_flag( flag );
2881 }
2882}
2883
2884bool vehicle::part_flag( int part, const vpart_bitflags flag ) const
2885{
2886 if( part < 0 || part >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) || parts[part].removed ) {
2887 return false;
2888 } else {
2889 return part_info( part ).has_flag( flag );
2890 }
2891}
2892
2893int vehicle::part_at( const point &dp ) const
2894{
2895 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
2896 if( vp.part().precalc[0].xy() == dp && !vp.part().removed ) {
2897 return static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() );
2898 }
2899 }
2900 return -1;
2901}
2902
2903/**
2904 * Given a vehicle part which is inside of this vehicle, returns the index of
2905 * that part. This exists solely because activities relating to vehicle editing
2906 * require the index of the vehicle part to be passed around.
2907 * @param part The part to find.
2908 * @param check_removed Check whether this part can be removed
2909 * @return The part index, -1 if it is not part of this vehicle.
2910 */
2911int vehicle::index_of_part( const vehicle_part *const part, const bool check_removed ) const
2912{
2913 if( part != nullptr ) {
2914 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
2915 const vehicle_part &next_part = vp.part();
2916 if( !check_removed && next_part.removed ) {
2917 continue;
2918 }
2919 if( part->id == next_part.id && part->mount == vp.mount() ) {
2920 return vp.part_index();
2921 }
2922 }
2923 }
2924 return -1;
2925}
2926
2927/**
2928 * Returns which part (as an index into the parts list) is the one that will be
2929 * displayed for the given square. Returns -1 if there are no parts in that
2930 * square.
2931 * @param dp The local coordinate.
2932 * @return The index of the part that will be displayed.
2933 */
2934int vehicle::part_displayed_at( const point &dp ) const
2935{
2936 // Z-order is implicitly defined in game::load_vehiclepart, but as
2937 // numbers directly set on parts rather than constants that can be
2938 // used elsewhere. A future refactor might be nice but this way
2939 // it's clear where the magic number comes from.
2940 const int ON_ROOF_Z = 9;
2941
2942 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( dp, true );
2943
2944 if( parts_in_square.empty() ) {
2945 return -1;
2946 }
2947
2948 bool in_vehicle = g->u.in_vehicle;
2949 if( in_vehicle ) {
2950 // They're in a vehicle, but are they in /this/ vehicle?
2951 std::vector<int> psg_parts = boarded_parts();
2952 in_vehicle = false;
2953 for( auto &psg_part : psg_parts ) {
2954 if( get_passenger( psg_part ) == &g->u ) {
2955 in_vehicle = true;
2956 break;
2957 }
2958 }
2959 }
2960
2961 int hide_z_at_or_above = ( in_vehicle ) ? ( ON_ROOF_Z ) : INT_MAX;
2962
2963 int top_part = 0;
2964 for( size_t index = 1; index < parts_in_square.size(); index++ ) {
2965 if( ( part_info( parts_in_square[top_part] ).z_order <
2966 part_info( parts_in_square[index] ).z_order ) &&
2967 ( part_info( parts_in_square[index] ).z_order <
2968 hide_z_at_or_above ) ) {
2969 top_part = index;
2970 }
2971 }
2972
2973 return parts_in_square[top_part];
2974}
2975
2976int vehicle::roof_at_part( const int part ) const
2977{
2978 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( parts[part].mount, true );
2979 for( const int p : parts_in_square ) {
2980 if( part_info( p ).location == "on_roof" || part_flag( p, "ROOF" ) ) {
2981 return p;
2982 }
2983 }
2984
2985 return -1;
2986}
2987
2988point vehicle::coord_translate( const point &p ) const
2989{
2990 tripoint q;
2991 coord_translate( pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[0], p, q );
2992 return q.xy();
2993}
2994
2995void vehicle::coord_translate( units::angle dir, const point &pivot, const point &p,
2996 tripoint &q ) const
2997{
2998 tileray tdir( dir );
2999 tdir.advance( p.x - pivot.x );
3000 q.x = tdir.dx() + tdir.ortho_dx( p.y - pivot.y );
3001 q.y = tdir.dy() + tdir.ortho_dy( p.y - pivot.y );
3002}
3003
3004void vehicle::coord_translate( tileray tdir, const point &pivot, const point &p, tripoint &q ) const
3005{
3006 tdir.clear_advance();
3007 tdir.advance( p.x - pivot.x );
3008 q.x = tdir.dx() + tdir.ortho_dx( p.y - pivot.y );
3009 q.y = tdir.dy() + tdir.ortho_dy( p.y - pivot.y );
3010}
3011
3012tripoint vehicle::mount_to_tripoint( const point &mount ) const
3013{
3014 return mount_to_tripoint( mount, point_zero );
3015}
3016
3017tripoint vehicle::mount_to_tripoint( const point &mount, const point &offset ) const
3018{
3019 tripoint mnt_translated;
3020 coord_translate( pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[ 0 ], mount + offset, mnt_translated );
3021 return global_pos3() + mnt_translated;
3022}
3023
3024void vehicle::precalc_mounts( int idir, units::angle dir, const point &pivot )
3025{
3026 if( idir < 0 || idir > 1 ) {
3027 idir = 0;
3028 }
3029 tileray tdir( dir );
3030 std::unordered_map<point, tripoint> mount_to_precalc;
3031 for( auto &p : parts ) {
3032 if( p.removed ) {
3033 continue;
3034 }
3035 auto q = mount_to_precalc.find( p.mount );
3036 if( q == mount_to_precalc.end() ) {
3037 coord_translate( tdir, pivot, p.mount, p.precalc[idir] );
3038 mount_to_precalc.insert( { p.mount, p.precalc[idir] } );
3039 } else {
3040 p.precalc[idir] = q->second;
3041 }
3042 }
3043 pivot_anchor[idir] = pivot;
3044 pivot_rotation[idir] = dir;
3045}
3046
3047std::vector<int> vehicle::boarded_parts() const
3048{
3049 std::vector<int> res;
3050 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE ) ) {
3051 if( vp.part().has_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag ) ) {
3052 res.push_back( static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() ) );
3053 }
3054 }
3055 return res;
3056}
3057
3058std::vector<rider_data> vehicle::get_riders() const
3059{
3060 std::vector<rider_data> res;
3061 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE ) ) {
3062 Creature *rider = g->critter_at( vp.pos() );
3063 if( rider ) {
3064 rider_data r;
3065 r.prt = vp.part_index();
3066 r.psg = rider;
3067 res.emplace_back( r );
3068 }
3069 }
3070 return res;
3071}
3072
3073player *vehicle::get_passenger( int p ) const
3074{
3075 p = part_with_feature( p, VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, false );
3076 if( p >= 0 && parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag ) ) {
3077 return g->critter_by_id<player>( parts[p].passenger_id );
3078 }
3079 return nullptr;
3080}
3081
3082monster *vehicle::get_pet( int p ) const
3083{
3084 p = part_with_feature( p, VPFLAG_BOARDABLE, false );
3085 if( p >= 0 ) {
3086 return g->critter_at<monster>( global_part_pos3( p ), true );
3087 }
3088 return nullptr;
3089}
3090
3091tripoint_abs_ms vehicle::global_square_location() const
3092{
3093 return tripoint_abs_ms( get_map().getabs( global_pos3() ) );
3094}
3095
3096tripoint_abs_omt vehicle::global_omt_location() const
3097{
3098 return project_to<coords::omt>( global_square_location() );
3099}
3100
3101tripoint vehicle::global_pos3() const
3102{
3103 return sm_to_ms_copy( sm_pos ) + pos;
3104}
3105
3106tripoint vehicle::global_part_pos3( const int &index ) const
3107{
3108 return global_part_pos3( parts[ index ] );
3109}
3110
3111tripoint vehicle::global_part_pos3( const vehicle_part &pt ) const
3112{
3113 return global_pos3() + pt.precalc[ 0 ];
3114}
3115
3116void vehicle::set_submap_moved( const tripoint &p )
3117{
3118 const point_abs_ms old_msp = global_square_location().xy();
3119 sm_pos = p;
3120 if( !tracking_on ) {
3121 return;
3122 }
3123 overmap_buffer.move_vehicle( this, old_msp );
3124}
3125
3126units::mass vehicle::total_mass() const
3127{
3128 if( mass_dirty ) {
3129 refresh_mass();
3130 }
3131
3132 return mass_cache;
3133}
3134
3135units::volume vehicle::total_folded_volume() const
3136{
3137 units::volume m = 0_ml;
3138 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
3139 if( vp.part().removed ) {
3140 continue;
3141 }
3142 m += vp.info().folded_volume;
3143 }
3144 return m;
3145}
3146
3147const point &vehicle::rotated_center_of_mass() const
3148{
3149 // TODO: Bring back caching of this point
3150 calc_mass_center( true );
3151
3152 return mass_center_precalc;
3153}
3154
3155const point &vehicle::local_center_of_mass() const
3156{
3157 if( mass_center_no_precalc_dirty ) {
3158 calc_mass_center( false );
3159 }
3160
3161 return mass_center_no_precalc;
3162}
3163
3164point vehicle::pivot_displacement() const
3165{
3166 // precalc_mounts always produces a result that puts the pivot point at (0,0).
3167 // If the pivot point changes, this artificially moves the vehicle, as the position
3168 // of the old pivot point will appear to move from (posx+0, posy+0) to some other point
3169 // (posx+dx,posy+dy) even if there is no change in vehicle position or rotation.
3170 // This method finds that movement so it can be canceled out when actually moving
3171 // the vehicle.
3172
3173 // rotate the old pivot point around the new pivot point with the old rotation angle
3174 tripoint dp;
3175 coord_translate( pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[1], pivot_anchor[0], dp );
3176 return dp.xy();
3177}
3178
3179int vehicle::fuel_left( const itype_id &ftype, bool recurse ) const
3180{
3181 int fl = std::accumulate( parts.begin(), parts.end(), 0, [&ftype]( const int &lhs,
3182 const vehicle_part & rhs ) {
3183 return lhs + ( rhs.ammo_current() == ftype ? rhs.ammo_remaining() : 0 );
3184 } );
3185
3186 if( recurse && ftype == fuel_type_battery ) {
3187 using tvr = distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result;
3188 auto fuel_counting_visitor = [&fl, &ftype]( vehicle const & veh ) {
3189 fl += veh.fuel_left( ftype, false );
3190 return tvr::continue_further;
3191 };
3192 auto power_counting_visitor = [&fl]( distribution_grid const & grid ) {
3193 fl += grid.get_resource( false );
3194 return tvr::continue_further;
3195 };
3196
3197 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, fuel_counting_visitor, power_counting_visitor );
3198 }
3199
3200 //muscle engines have infinite fuel
3201 if( ftype == fuel_type_muscle ) {
3202 // TODO: Allow NPCs to power those
3203 const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( g->u.pos() );
3204 bool player_controlling = player_in_control( g->u );
3205
3206 //if the engine in the player tile is a muscle engine, and player is controlling vehicle
3207 if( vp && &vp->vehicle() == this && player_controlling ) {
3208 const int p = avail_part_with_feature( vp->part_index(), VPFLAG_ENGINE, true );
3209 if( p >= 0 && is_part_on( p ) && part_info( p ).fuel_type == fuel_type_muscle ) {
3210 //Broken limbs prevent muscle engines from working
3211 if( ( part_info( p ).has_flag( "MUSCLE_LEGS" ) && ( g->u.get_working_leg_count() >= 2 ) ) ||
3212 ( part_info( p ).has_flag( "MUSCLE_ARMS" ) &&
3213 ( g->u.get_working_arm_count() >= 2 ) ) ) {
3214 fl += 10;
3215 }
3216 }
3217 }
3218 // As do any other engine flagged as perpetual
3219 } else if( item( ftype ).has_flag( "PERPETUAL" ) ) {
3220 fl += 10;
3221 }
3222
3223 return fl;
3224}
3225int vehicle::fuel_left( const int p, bool recurse ) const
3226{
3227 return fuel_left( parts[ p ].fuel_current(), recurse );
3228}
3229
3230int vehicle::engine_fuel_left( const int e, bool recurse ) const
3231{
3232 if( static_cast<size_t>( e ) < engines.size() ) {
3233 return fuel_left( parts[ engines[ e ] ].fuel_current(), recurse );
3234 }
3235 return 0;
3236}
3237
3238int vehicle::fuel_capacity( const itype_id &ftype ) const
3239{
3240 return std::accumulate( parts.begin(), parts.end(), 0, [&ftype]( const int &lhs,
3241 const vehicle_part & rhs ) {
3242 return lhs + ( rhs.ammo_current() == ftype ? rhs.ammo_capacity() : 0 );
3243 } );
3244}
3245
3246int vehicle::drain( const itype_id &ftype, int amount )
3247{
3248 if( ftype == fuel_type_battery ) {
3249 // Batteries get special handling to take advantage of jumper
3250 // cables -- discharge_battery knows how to recurse properly
3251 // (including taking cable power loss into account).
3252 int remnant = discharge_battery( amount, true );
3253
3254 // discharge_battery returns amount of charges that were not
3255 // found anywhere in the power network, whereas this function
3256 // returns amount of charges consumed; simple subtraction.
3257 return amount - remnant;
3258 }
3259
3260 int drained = 0;
3261 for( auto &p : parts ) {
3262 if( amount <= 0 ) {
3263 break;
3264 }
3265 if( p.ammo_current() == ftype ) {
3266 int qty = p.ammo_consume( amount, global_part_pos3( p ) );
3267 drained += qty;
3268 amount -= qty;
3269 }
3270 }
3271
3272 invalidate_mass();
3273 return drained;
3274}
3275
3276int vehicle::drain( const int index, int amount )
3277{
3278 if( index < 0 || index >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
3279 debugmsg( "Tried to drain an invalid part index: %d", index );
3280 return 0;
3281 }
3282 vehicle_part &pt = parts[index];
3283 if( pt.ammo_current() == fuel_type_battery ) {
3284 return drain( fuel_type_battery, amount );
3285 }
3286 if( !pt.is_tank() || !pt.ammo_remaining() ) {
3287 debugmsg( "Tried to drain something without any liquid: %s amount: %d ammo: %d",
3288 pt.name(), amount, pt.ammo_remaining() );
3289 return 0;
3290 }
3291
3292 const int drained = pt.ammo_consume( amount, global_part_pos3( pt ) );
3293 invalidate_mass();
3294 return drained;
3295}
3296
3297int vehicle::basic_consumption( const itype_id &ftype ) const
3298{
3299 int fcon = 0;
3300 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
3301 if( is_engine_type_on( e, ftype ) ) {
3302 if( parts[ engines[e] ].ammo_current() == fuel_type_battery &&
3303 part_epower_w( engines[e] ) >= 0 ) {
3304 // Electric engine - use epower instead
3305 fcon -= part_epower_w( engines[e] );
3306
3307 } else if( !is_perpetual_type( e ) ) {
3308 fcon += part_vpower_w( engines[e] );
3309 if( parts[ e ].faults().count( fault_filter_air ) ) {
3310 fcon *= 2;
3311 }
3312 }
3313 }
3314 }
3315 return fcon;
3316}
3317
3318int vehicle::consumption_per_hour( const itype_id &ftype, int fuel_rate_w ) const
3319{
3320 item fuel = item( ftype );
3321 if( fuel_rate_w == 0 || fuel.has_flag( "PERPETUAL" ) || !engine_on ) {
3322 return 0;
3323 }
3324
3325 float j_per_turn = fuel_rate_w;
3326 float j_per_second = j_per_turn / to_seconds<float>( time_duration::from_turns( 1 ) );
3327 float kj_per_hour = j_per_second * 3.6f;
3328 float kj_per_mL = fuel.fuel_energy();
3329
3330 return kj_per_hour / kj_per_mL;
3331}
3332
3333int vehicle::total_power_w( const bool fueled, const bool safe ) const
3334{
3335 int pwr = 0;
3336 int cnt = 0;
3337
3338 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); e++ ) {
3339 int p = engines[e];
3340 if( is_engine_on( e ) && ( !fueled || engine_fuel_left( e ) ) ) {
3341 int m2c = safe ? part_info( engines[e] ).engine_m2c() : 100;
3342 if( parts[ engines[e] ].faults().count( fault_filter_fuel ) ) {
3343 m2c *= 0.6;
3344 }
3345 pwr += part_vpower_w( p ) * m2c / 100;
3346 cnt++;
3347 }
3348 }
3349
3350 for( size_t a = 0; a < alternators.size(); a++ ) {
3351 int p = alternators[a];
3352 if( is_alternator_on( a ) ) {
3353 pwr += part_vpower_w( p ); // alternators have negative power
3354 }
3355 }
3356 pwr = std::max( 0, pwr );
3357
3358 if( cnt > 1 ) {
3359 pwr = pwr * 4 / ( 4 + cnt - 1 );
3360 }
3361 return pwr;
3362}
3363
3364bool vehicle::is_moving() const
3365{
3366 return velocity != 0;
3367}
3368
3369bool vehicle::can_use_rails() const
3370{
3371 // Do not allow vehicles without rail wheels or with mixed wheels
3372 return !rail_wheelcache.empty() && wheelcache.size() == rail_wheelcache.size();
3373}
3374
3375int vehicle::ground_acceleration( const bool fueled, int at_vel_in_vmi ) const
3376{
3377 if( !( engine_on || skidding ) ) {
3378 return 0;
3379 }
3380 int target_vmiph = std::max( at_vel_in_vmi, std::max( 1000, max_velocity( fueled ) / 4 ) );
3381 int cmps = vmiph_to_cmps( target_vmiph );
3382 double weight = to_kilogram( total_mass() );
3383 if( is_towing() ) {
3384 vehicle *other_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
3385 if( other_veh ) {
3386 weight = weight + to_kilogram( other_veh->total_mass() );
3387 }
3388 }
3389 int engine_power_ratio = total_power_w( fueled ) / weight;
3390 int accel_at_vel = 100 * 100 * engine_power_ratio / cmps;
3391 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: accel at %d vimph is %d", name, target_vmiph,
3392 cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel ) );
3393 return cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel );
3394}
3395
3396int vehicle::rotor_acceleration( const bool fueled, int at_vel_in_vmi ) const
3397{
3398 ( void )at_vel_in_vmi;
3399 if( !( engine_on || is_flying ) ) {
3400 return 0;
3401 }
3402 const int accel_at_vel = 100 * lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( fueled ) / to_kilogram( total_mass() );
3403 return cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel );
3404}
3405
3406int vehicle::water_acceleration( const bool fueled, int at_vel_in_vmi ) const
3407{
3408 if( !( engine_on || skidding ) ) {
3409 return 0;
3410 }
3411 int target_vmiph = std::max( at_vel_in_vmi, std::max( 1000,
3412 max_water_velocity( fueled ) / 4 ) );
3413 int cmps = vmiph_to_cmps( target_vmiph );
3414 double weight = to_kilogram( total_mass() );
3415 if( is_towing() ) {
3416 vehicle *other_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
3417 if( other_veh ) {
3418 weight = weight + to_kilogram( other_veh->total_mass() );
3419 }
3420 }
3421 int engine_power_ratio = total_power_w( fueled ) / weight;
3422 int accel_at_vel = 100 * 100 * engine_power_ratio / cmps;
3423 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: water accel at %d vimph is %d", name, target_vmiph,
3424 cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel ) );
3425 return cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel );
3426}
3427
3428// cubic equation solution
3429// don't use complex numbers unless necessary and it's usually not
3430// see https://math.vanderbilt.edu/schectex/courses/cubic/ for the gory details
3431static double simple_cubic_solution( double a, double b, double c, double d )
3432{
3433 double p = -b / ( 3 * a );
3434 double q = p * p * p + ( b * c - 3 * a * d ) / ( 6 * a * a );
3435 double r = c / ( 3 * a );
3436 double t = r - p * p;
3437 double tricky_bit = q * q + t * t * t;
3438 if( tricky_bit < 0 ) {
3439 double cr = 1.0 / 3.0; // approximate the cube root of a complex number
3440 std::complex<double> q_complex( q );
3441 std::complex<double> tricky_complex( std::sqrt( std::complex<double>( tricky_bit ) ) );
3442 std::complex<double> term1( std::pow( q_complex + tricky_complex, cr ) );
3443 std::complex<double> term2( std::pow( q_complex - tricky_complex, cr ) );
3444 std::complex<double> term_sum( term1 + term2 );
3445
3446 if( imag( term_sum ) < 2 ) {
3447 return p + real( term_sum );
3448 } else {
3449 debugmsg( "cubic solution returned imaginary values" );
3450 return 0;
3451 }
3452 } else {
3453 double tricky_final = std::sqrt( tricky_bit );
3454 double term1_part = q + tricky_final;
3455 double term2_part = q - tricky_final;
3456 double term1 = std::cbrt( term1_part );
3457 double term2 = std::cbrt( term2_part );
3458 return p + term1 + term2;
3459 }
3460}
3461
3462int vehicle::acceleration( const bool fueled, int at_vel_in_vmi ) const
3463{
3464 if( is_watercraft() ) {
3465 return water_acceleration( fueled, at_vel_in_vmi );
3466 } else if( is_rotorcraft() && is_flying ) {
3467 return rotor_acceleration( fueled, at_vel_in_vmi );
3468 }
3469 return ground_acceleration( fueled, at_vel_in_vmi );
3470}
3471
3472int vehicle::current_acceleration( const bool fueled ) const
3473{
3474 return acceleration( fueled, std::abs( velocity ) );
3475}
3476
3477// Ugly physics below:
3478// maximum speed occurs when all available thrust is used to overcome air/rolling resistance
3479// sigma F = 0 as we were taught in Engineering Mechanics 301
3480// engine power is torque * rotation rate (in rads for simplicity)
3481// torque / wheel radius = drive force at where the wheel meets the road
3482// velocity is wheel radius * rotation rate (in rads for simplicity)
3483// air resistance is -1/2 * air density * drag coeff * cross area * v^2
3484// and c_air_drag is -1/2 * air density * drag coeff * cross area
3485// rolling resistance is mass * GRAVITY_OF_EARTH * rolling coeff * 0.000225 * ( 33.3 + v )
3486// and c_rolling_drag is mass * GRAVITY_OF_EARTH * rolling coeff * 0.000225
3487// and rolling_constant_to_variable is 33.3
3488// or by formula:
3489// max velocity occurs when F_drag = F_wheel
3490// F_wheel = engine_power / rotation_rate / wheel_radius
3491// velocity = rotation_rate * wheel_radius
3492// F_wheel * velocity = engine_power * rotation_rate * wheel_radius / rotation_rate / wheel_radius
3493// F_wheel * velocity = engine_power
3494// F_wheel = engine_power / velocity
3495// F_drag = F_air_drag + F_rolling_drag
3496// F_air_drag = c_air_drag * velocity^2
3497// F_rolling_drag = c_rolling_drag * velocity + rolling_constant_to_variable * c_rolling_drag
3498// engine_power / v = c_air_drag * v^2 + c_rolling_drag * v + 33 * c_rolling_drag
3499// c_air_drag * v^3 + c_rolling_drag * v^2 + c_rolling_drag * 33.3 * v - engine power = 0
3500// solve for v with the simplified cubic equation solver
3501// got it? quiz on Wednesday.
3502int vehicle::max_ground_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3503{
3504 int total_engine_w = total_power_w( fueled );
3505 double c_rolling_drag = coeff_rolling_drag();
3506 double max_in_mps = simple_cubic_solution( coeff_air_drag(), c_rolling_drag,
3507 c_rolling_drag * vehicles::rolling_constant_to_variable,
3508 -total_engine_w );
3509 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: power %d, c_air %3.2f, c_rolling %3.2f, max_in_mps %3.2f",
3510 name, total_engine_w, coeff_air_drag(), c_rolling_drag, max_in_mps );
3511 return mps_to_vmiph( max_in_mps );
3512}
3513
3514// the same physics as ground velocity, but there's no rolling resistance so the math is easy
3515// F_drag = F_water_drag + F_air_drag
3516// F_drag = c_water_drag * velocity^2 + c_air_drag * velocity^2
3517// F_drag = ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag ) * velocity^2
3518// F_prop = engine_power / velocity
3519// F_prop = F_drag
3520// engine_power / velocity = ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag ) * velocity^2
3521// engine_power = ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag ) * velocity^3
3522// velocity^3 = engine_power / ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag )
3523// velocity = cube root( engine_power / ( c_water_drag + c_air_drag ) )
3524int vehicle::max_water_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3525{
3526 int total_engine_w = total_power_w( fueled );
3527 double total_drag = coeff_water_drag() + coeff_air_drag();
3528 double max_in_mps = std::cbrt( total_engine_w / total_drag );
3529 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: power %d, c_air %3.2f, c_water %3.2f, water max_in_mps %3.2f",
3530 name, total_engine_w, coeff_air_drag(), coeff_water_drag(), max_in_mps );
3531 return mps_to_vmiph( max_in_mps );
3532}
3533
3534int vehicle::max_rotor_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3535{
3536 const double max_air_mps = std::sqrt( lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( fueled ) / coeff_air_drag() );
3537 // helicopters just cannot go over 250mph at very maximum
3538 // weird things start happening to their rotors if they do.
3539 // due to the rotor tips going supersonic.
3540 return std::min( 25501, mps_to_vmiph( max_air_mps ) );
3541}
3542
3543int vehicle::max_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3544{
3545 if( is_flying && is_rotorcraft() ) {
3546 return max_rotor_velocity( fueled );
3547 } else if( is_watercraft() ) {
3548 return max_water_velocity( fueled );
3549 } else {
3550 return max_ground_velocity( fueled );
3551 }
3552}
3553
3554int vehicle::max_reverse_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3555{
3556 int max_vel = max_velocity( fueled );
3557 if( has_engine_type( fuel_type_battery, true ) ) {
3558 // Electric motors can go in reverse as well as forward
3559 return -max_vel;
3560 } else {
3561 // All other motive powers do poorly in reverse
3562 return -max_vel / 4;
3563 }
3564}
3565
3566// the same physics as max_ground_velocity, but with a smaller engine power
3567int vehicle::safe_ground_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3568{
3569 int effective_engine_w = total_power_w( fueled, true );
3570 double c_rolling_drag = coeff_rolling_drag();
3571 double safe_in_mps = simple_cubic_solution( coeff_air_drag(), c_rolling_drag,
3572 c_rolling_drag * vehicles::rolling_constant_to_variable,
3573 -effective_engine_w );
3574 return mps_to_vmiph( safe_in_mps );
3575}
3576
3577int vehicle::safe_rotor_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3578{
3579 const double max_air_mps = std::sqrt( lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( fueled,
3580 true ) / coeff_air_drag() );
3581 return std::min( 22501, mps_to_vmiph( max_air_mps ) );
3582}
3583
3584// the same physics as max_water_velocity, but with a smaller engine power
3585int vehicle::safe_water_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3586{
3587 int total_engine_w = total_power_w( fueled, true );
3588 double total_drag = coeff_water_drag() + coeff_air_drag();
3589 double safe_in_mps = std::cbrt( total_engine_w / total_drag );
3590 return mps_to_vmiph( safe_in_mps );
3591}
3592
3593int vehicle::safe_velocity( const bool fueled ) const
3594{
3595 if( is_flying && is_rotorcraft() ) {
3596 return safe_rotor_velocity( fueled );
3597 } else if( is_watercraft() ) {
3598 return safe_water_velocity( fueled );
3599 } else {
3600 return safe_ground_velocity( fueled );
3601 }
3602}
3603
3604bool vehicle::do_environmental_effects()
3605{
3606 bool needed = false;
3607 // check for smoking parts
3608 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
3609 /* Only lower blood level if:
3610 * - The part is outside.
3611 * - The weather is any effect that would cause the player to be wet. */
3612 if( vp.part().blood > 0 && g->m.is_outside( vp.pos() ) ) {
3613 needed = true;
3614 if( get_weather().weather_id->rains &&
3615 get_weather().weather_id->precip != precip_class::very_light ) {
3616 vp.part().blood--;
3617 }
3618 }
3619 }
3620 return needed;
3621}
3622
3623void vehicle::spew_field( double joules, int part, field_type_id type, int intensity )
3624{
3625 if( rng( 1, 10000 ) > joules ) {
3626 return;
3627 }
3628 point p = parts[part].mount;
3629 intensity = std::max( joules / 10000, static_cast<double>( intensity ) );
3630 // Move back from engine/muffler until we find an open space
3631 while( relative_parts.find( p ) != relative_parts.end() ) {
3632 p.x += ( velocity < 0 ? 1 : -1 );
3633 }
3634 point q = coord_translate( p );
3635 const tripoint dest = global_pos3() + tripoint( q, 0 );
3636 g->m.mod_field_intensity( dest, type, intensity );
3637}
3638
3639/**
3640 * Generate noise or smoke from a vehicle with engines turned on
3641 * load = how hard the engines are working, from 0.0 until 1.0
3642 * time = how many seconds to generated smoke for
3643 */
3644void vehicle::noise_and_smoke( int load, time_duration time )
3645{
3646 static const std::array<std::pair<std::string, int>, 8> sounds = { {
3647 { translate_marker( "hmm" ), 0 }, { translate_marker( "hummm!" ), 15 },
3648 { translate_marker( "whirrr!" ), 30 }, { translate_marker( "vroom!" ), 60 },
3649 { translate_marker( "roarrr!" ), 100 }, { translate_marker( "ROARRR!" ), 140 },
3650 { translate_marker( "BRRROARRR!" ), 180 }, { translate_marker( "BRUMBRUMBRUMBRUM!" ), INT_MAX }
3651 }
3652 };
3653 const std::string heli_noise = translate_marker( "WUMPWUMPWUMP!" );
3654 double noise = 0.0;
3655 double mufflesmoke = 0.0;
3656 double muffle = 1.0;
3657 double m = 0.0;
3658 int exhaust_part = -1;
3659 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( "MUFFLER" ) ) {
3660 m = 1.0 - ( 1.0 - vp.info().bonus / 100.0 ) * vp.part().health_percent();
3661 if( m < muffle ) {
3662 muffle = m;
3663 exhaust_part = static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() );
3664 }
3665 }
3666
3667 bool bad_filter = false;
3668 bool combustion = false;
3669
3670 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); e++ ) {
3671 int p = engines[e];
3672 if( is_engine_on( e ) && engine_fuel_left( e ) ) {
3673 // convert current engine load to units of watts/40K
3674 // then spew more smoke and make more noise as the engine load increases
3675 int part_watts = part_vpower_w( p, true );
3676 double max_stress = static_cast<double>( part_watts / 40000.0 );
3677 double cur_stress = load / 1000.0 * max_stress;
3678 // idle stress = 1.0 resulting in nominal working engine noise = engine_noise_factor()
3679 // and preventing noise = 0
3680 cur_stress = std::max( cur_stress, 1.0 );
3681 double part_noise = cur_stress * part_info( p ).engine_noise_factor();
3682
3683 if( part_info( p ).has_flag( "E_COMBUSTION" ) ) {
3684 combustion = true;
3685 double health = parts[p].health_percent();
3686 if( parts[ p ].base.faults.count( fault_filter_fuel ) ) {
3687 health = 0.0;
3688 }
3689 if( health < part_info( p ).engine_backfire_threshold() && one_in( 50 + 150 * health ) ) {
3690 backfire( e );
3691 }
3692 double j = cur_stress * to_turns<int>( time ) * muffle * 1000;
3693
3694 if( parts[ p ].base.faults.count( fault_filter_air ) ) {
3695 bad_filter = true;
3696 j *= j;
3697 }
3698
3699 if( ( exhaust_part == -1 ) && engine_on ) {
3700 spew_field( j, p, fd_smoke, bad_filter ? fd_smoke.obj().get_max_intensity() : 1 );
3701 } else {
3702 mufflesmoke += j;
3703 }
3704 part_noise = ( part_noise + max_stress * 3 + 5 ) * muffle;
3705 }
3706 noise = std::max( noise, part_noise ); // Only the loudest engine counts.
3707 }
3708 }
3709 if( !combustion ) {
3710 return;
3711 }
3712 /// TODO: handle other engine types: muscle / animal / wind / coal / ...
3713
3714 if( exhaust_part != -1 && engine_on ) {
3715 spew_field( mufflesmoke, exhaust_part, fd_smoke,
3716 bad_filter ? fd_smoke.obj().get_max_intensity() : 1 );
3717 }
3718 if( is_rotorcraft() ) {
3719 noise *= 2;
3720 }
3721 // Cap engine noise to avoid deafening.
3722 noise = std::min( noise, 100.0 );
3723 // Even a vehicle with engines off will make noise traveling at high speeds
3724 noise = std::max( noise, static_cast<double>( std::fabs( velocity / 500.0 ) ) );
3725 int lvl = 0;
3726 if( one_in( 4 ) && rng( 0, 30 ) < noise ) {
3727 while( noise > sounds[lvl].second ) {
3728 lvl++;
3729 }
3730 }
3731 add_msg( m_debug, "VEH NOISE final: %d", static_cast<int>( noise ) );
3732 vehicle_noise = static_cast<unsigned char>( noise );
3733 sounds::sound( global_pos3(), noise, sounds::sound_t::movement,
3734 _( is_rotorcraft() ? heli_noise : sounds[lvl].first ), true );
3735}
3736
3737int vehicle::wheel_area() const
3738{
3739 int total_area = 0;
3740 for( const int &wheel_index : wheelcache ) {
3741 total_area += parts[ wheel_index ].wheel_area();
3742 }
3743
3744 return total_area;
3745}
3746
3747float vehicle::average_or_rating() const
3748{
3749 if( wheelcache.empty() ) {
3750 return 0.0f;
3751 }
3752 float total_rating = 0;
3753 for( const int &wheel_index : wheelcache ) {
3754 total_rating += part_info( wheel_index ).wheel_or_rating();
3755 }
3756 return total_rating / wheelcache.size();
3757}
3758
3759static double tile_to_width( int tiles )
3760{
3761 if( tiles < 1 ) {
3762 return 0.1;
3763 } else if( tiles < 6 ) {
3764 return 0.5 + 0.4 * tiles;
3765 } else {
3766 return 2.5 + 0.15 * ( tiles - 5 );
3767 }
3768}
3769
3770static constexpr int minrow = -122;
3771static constexpr int maxrow = 122;
3772struct drag_column {
3773 int pro = minrow;
3774 int hboard = minrow;
3775 int fboard = minrow;
3776 int aisle = minrow;
3777 int seat = minrow;
3778 int exposed = minrow;
3779 int roof = minrow;
3780 int shield = minrow;
3781 int turret = minrow;
3782 int panel = minrow;
3783 int windmill = minrow;
3784 int sail = minrow;
3785 int rotor = minrow;
3786 int last = maxrow;
3787};
3788
3789double vehicle::coeff_air_drag() const
3790{
3791 if( !coeff_air_dirty ) {
3792 return coefficient_air_resistance;
3793 }
3794 constexpr double c_air_base = 0.25;
3795 constexpr double c_air_mod = 0.1;
3796 constexpr double base_height = 1.4;
3797 constexpr double aisle_height = 0.6;
3798 constexpr double fullboard_height = 0.5;
3799 constexpr double roof_height = 0.1;
3800 constexpr double windmill_height = 0.7;
3801 constexpr double sail_height = 0.8;
3802 constexpr double rotor_height = 0.6;
3803
3804 std::vector<int> structure_indices = all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
3805 int width = mount_max.y - mount_min.y + 1;
3806
3807 // a mess of lambdas to make the next bit slightly easier to read
3808 const auto d_exposed = [&]( const vehicle_part & p ) {
3809 // if it's not inside, it's a center location, and it doesn't need a roof, it's exposed
3810 if( p.info().location != part_location_center ) {
3811 return false;
3812 }
3813 return !( p.inside || p.info().has_flag( "NO_ROOF_NEEDED" ) ||
3814 p.info().has_flag( "WINDSHIELD" ) ||
3815 p.info().has_flag( "OPENABLE" ) );
3816 };
3817
3818 const auto d_protrusion = [&]( std::vector<int> parts_at ) {
3819 if( parts_at.size() > 1 ) {
3820 return false;
3821 } else {
3822 return parts[ parts_at.front() ].info().has_flag( "PROTRUSION" );
3823 }
3824 };
3825 const auto d_check_min = [&]( int &value, const vehicle_part & p, bool test ) {
3826 value = std::min( value, test ? p.mount.x - mount_min.x : maxrow );
3827 };
3828 const auto d_check_max = [&]( int &value, const vehicle_part & p, bool test ) {
3829 value = std::max( value, test ? p.mount.x - mount_min.x : minrow );
3830 };
3831
3832 // raycast down each column. the least drag vehicle has halfboard, windshield, seat with roof,
3833 // windshield, halfboard and is twice as long as it is wide.
3834 // find the first instance of each item and compare against the ideal configuration.
3835 std::vector<drag_column> drag( width );
3836 for( int p : structure_indices ) {
3837 if( parts[ p ].removed ) {
3838 continue;
3839 }
3840 int col = parts[ p ].mount.y - mount_min.y;
3841 std::vector<int> parts_at = parts_at_relative( parts[ p ].mount, true );
3842 d_check_min( drag[ col ].pro, parts[ p ], d_protrusion( parts_at ) );
3843 for( int pa_index : parts_at ) {
3844 const vehicle_part &pa = parts[ pa_index ];
3845 d_check_max( drag[ col ].hboard, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "HALF_BOARD" ) );
3846 d_check_max( drag[ col ].fboard, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "FULL_BOARD" ) );
3847 d_check_max( drag[ col ].aisle, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "AISLE" ) );
3848 d_check_max( drag[ col ].shield, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "WINDSHIELD" ) &&
3849 pa.is_available() );
3850 d_check_max( drag[ col ].seat, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "SEAT" ) ||
3851 pa.info().has_flag( "BED" ) );
3852 d_check_max( drag[ col ].turret, pa, pa.info().location == part_location_onroof &&
3853 !pa.info().has_flag( "SOLAR_PANEL" ) );
3854 d_check_max( drag[ col ].roof, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "ROOF" ) );
3855 d_check_max( drag[ col ].panel, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "SOLAR_PANEL" ) );
3856 d_check_max( drag[ col ].windmill, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "WIND_TURBINE" ) );
3857 d_check_max( drag[ col ].rotor, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "ROTOR" ) );
3858 d_check_max( drag[ col ].sail, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "WIND_POWERED" ) );
3859 d_check_max( drag[ col ].exposed, pa, d_exposed( pa ) );
3860 d_check_min( drag[ col ].last, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "LOW_FINAL_AIR_DRAG" ) ||
3861 pa.info().has_flag( "HALF_BOARD" ) );
3862 }
3863 }
3864 double height = 0;
3865 double c_air_drag = 0;
3866 // tally the results of each row and prorate them relative to vehicle width
3867 for( drag_column &dc : drag ) {
3868 // even as m_debug you rarely want to see this
3869 // add_msg( m_debug, "veh %: pro %d, hboard %d, fboard %d, shield %d, seat %d, roof %d, aisle %d, turret %d, panel %d, exposed %d, last %d\n", name, dc.pro, dc.hboard, dc.fboard, dc.shield, dc.seat, dc.roof, dc.aisle, dc.turret, dc.panel, dc.exposed, dc.last );
3870
3871 double c_air_drag_c = c_air_base;
3872 // rams in front of the vehicle mildly worsens air drag
3873 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.pro > dc.hboard ) ? c_air_mod : 0;
3874 // not having halfboards in front of any windshields or fullboards moderately worsens
3875 // air drag
3876 c_air_drag_c += ( std::max( std::max( dc.hboard, dc.fboard ),
3877 dc.shield ) != dc.hboard ) ? 2 * c_air_mod : 0;
3878 // not having windshields in front of seats severely worsens air drag
3879 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.shield < dc.seat ) ? 3 * c_air_mod : 0;
3880 // missing roofs and open doors severely worsen air drag
3881 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.exposed > minrow ) ? 3 * c_air_mod : 0;
3882 // being twice as long as wide mildly reduces air drag
3883 c_air_drag_c -= ( 2 * ( mount_max.x - mount_min.x ) > width ) ? c_air_mod : 0;
3884 // trunk doors and halfboards at the tail mildly reduce air drag
3885 c_air_drag_c -= ( dc.last == mount_min.x ) ? c_air_mod : 0;
3886 // turrets severely worsen air drag
3887 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.turret > minrow ) ? 3 * c_air_mod : 0;
3888 // having a windmill is terrible for your drag
3889 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.windmill > minrow ) ? 5 * c_air_mod : 0;
3890 // rotors are not great for drag!
3891 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.rotor > minrow ) ? 6 * c_air_mod : 0;
3892 // having a sail is terrible for your drag
3893 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.sail > minrow ) ? 7 * c_air_mod : 0;
3894 c_air_drag += c_air_drag_c;
3895 // vehicles are 1.4m tall
3896 double c_height = base_height;
3897 // plus a bit for a roof
3898 c_height += ( dc.roof > minrow ) ? roof_height : 0;
3899 // plus a lot for an aisle
3900 c_height += ( dc.aisle > minrow ) ? aisle_height : 0;
3901 // or fullboards
3902 c_height += ( dc.fboard > minrow ) ? fullboard_height : 0;
3903 // and a little for anything on the roof
3904 c_height += ( dc.turret > minrow ) ? 2 * roof_height : 0;
3905 // solar panels are better than turrets or floodlights, though
3906 c_height += ( dc.panel > minrow ) ? roof_height : 0;
3907 // windmills are tall, too
3908 c_height += ( dc.windmill > minrow ) ? windmill_height : 0;
3909 c_height += ( dc.rotor > minrow ) ? rotor_height : 0;
3910 // sails are tall, too
3911 c_height += ( dc.sail > minrow ) ? sail_height : 0;
3912 height += c_height;
3913 }
3914 constexpr double air_density = 1.29; // kg/m^3
3915 // prorate per row height and c_air_drag
3916 height /= width;
3917 c_air_drag /= width;
3918 double cross_area = height * tile_to_width( width );
3919 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: height %3.2fm, width %3.2fm (%d tiles), c_air %3.2f\n", name, height,
3920 tile_to_width( width ), width, c_air_drag );
3921 // F_air_drag = c_air_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * air_density * v^2
3922 // coeff_air_resistance = c_air_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * air_density
3923 coefficient_air_resistance = std::max( 0.1, c_air_drag * cross_area * 0.5 * air_density );
3924 coeff_air_dirty = false;
3925 return coefficient_air_resistance;
3926}
3927
3928double vehicle::coeff_rolling_drag() const
3929{
3930 if( !coeff_rolling_dirty ) {
3931 return coefficient_rolling_resistance;
3932 }
3933 constexpr double wheel_ratio = 1.25;
3934 constexpr double base_wheels = 4.0;
3935 // SAE J2452 measurements are in F_rr = N * C_rr * 0.000225 * ( v + 33.33 )
3936 // Don't ask me why, but it's the numbers we have. We want N * C_rr * 0.000225 here,
3937 // and N is mass * accel from gravity (aka weight)
3938 constexpr double sae_ratio = 0.000225;
3939 constexpr double newton_ratio = GRAVITY_OF_EARTH * sae_ratio;
3940 double wheel_factor = 0;
3941 if( wheelcache.empty() ) {
3942 wheel_factor = 50;
3943 } else {
3944 // should really sum the each wheel's c_rolling_resistance * it's share of vehicle mass
3945 for( auto wheel : wheelcache ) {
3946 wheel_factor += parts[ wheel ].info().wheel_rolling_resistance();
3947 }
3948 // mildly increasing rolling resistance for vehicles with more than 4 wheels and mildly
3949 // decrease it for vehicles with less
3950 wheel_factor *= wheel_ratio /
3951 ( base_wheels * wheel_ratio - base_wheels + wheelcache.size() );
3952 }
3953 coefficient_rolling_resistance = newton_ratio * wheel_factor * to_kilogram( total_mass() );
3954 coeff_rolling_dirty = false;
3955 return coefficient_rolling_resistance;
3956}
3957
3958double vehicle::water_hull_height() const
3959{
3960 if( coeff_water_dirty ) {
3961 coeff_water_drag();
3962 }
3963 return hull_height;
3964}
3965
3966double vehicle::water_draft() const
3967{
3968 if( coeff_water_dirty ) {
3969 coeff_water_drag();
3970 }
3971 return draft_m;
3972}
3973
3974bool vehicle::can_float() const
3975{
3976 if( coeff_water_dirty ) {
3977 coeff_water_drag();
3978 }
3979 // Someday I'll deal with submarines, but now, you can only float if you have freeboard
3980 return draft_m < hull_height;
3981}
3982
3983
3984double vehicle::total_rotor_area() const
3985{
3986 return std::accumulate( rotors.begin(), rotors.end(), double{0},
3987 [&]( double acc, int rotor ) {
3988 const double radius{ parts[ rotor ].info().rotor_diameter() / 2.0 };
3989 return acc + M_PI * std::pow( radius, 2 );
3990 } );
3991}
3992
3993// constants were converted from imperial to SI goodness
3994// returns as newton
3995double vehicle::lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( const bool fuelled, const bool safe ) const
3996{
3997 constexpr double coeffiicient {0.8642};
3998 constexpr double exponentiation {-0.3107};
3999
4000 const double rotor_area {total_rotor_area()};
4001 // take off 15 % due to the imaginary tail rotor power?
4002 const int engine_power {total_power_w( fuelled, safe )};
4003
4004 const double power_load {engine_power / rotor_area};
4005 const double lift_thrust = coeffiicient * engine_power * std::pow( power_load, exponentiation );
4006 add_msg( m_debug, "lift thrust(N) of %s: %f, rotor area (m^2): %f, engine power (w): %f",
4007 name, lift_thrust, rotor_area, engine_power );
4008 return lift_thrust;
4009}
4010
4011bool vehicle::has_sufficient_rotorlift() const
4012{
4013 return lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( true ) > to_newton( total_mass() );
4014}
4015
4016// requires vehicle to have sufficient rotor lift, not suitable for checking if it has rotor.
4017bool vehicle::is_rotorcraft() const
4018{
4019 return has_part( "ROTOR" ) && has_sufficient_rotorlift() && player_in_control( g->u );
4020}
4021
4022int vehicle::get_z_change() const
4023{
4024 return requested_z_change;
4025}
4026
4027bool vehicle::is_flying_in_air() const
4028{
4029 return is_flying;
4030}
4031
4032void vehicle::set_flying( bool new_flying_value )
4033{
4034 is_flying = new_flying_value;
4035}
4036
4037bool vehicle::is_watercraft() const
4038{
4039 return is_floating || ( in_water && wheelcache.empty() );
4040}
4041
4042bool vehicle::is_in_water( bool deep_water ) const
4043{
4044 return deep_water ? is_floating : in_water;
4045}
4046
4047double vehicle::coeff_water_drag() const
4048{
4049 if( !coeff_water_dirty ) {
4050 return coefficient_water_resistance;
4051 }
4052 std::vector<int> structure_indices = all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
4053 if( structure_indices.empty() ) {
4054 // huh?
4055 coeff_water_dirty = false;
4056 hull_height = 0.3;
4057 draft_m = 1.0;
4058 return 1250.0;
4059 }
4060 double hull_coverage = static_cast<double>( floating.size() ) / structure_indices.size();
4061
4062 int tile_width = mount_max.y - mount_min.y + 1;
4063 double width_m = tile_to_width( tile_width );
4064
4065 // actual area of the hull in m^2 (handles non-rectangular shapes)
4066 // footprint area in tiles = tile width * tile length
4067 // effective footprint percent = # of structure tiles / footprint area in tiles
4068 // actual hull area in m^2 = footprint percent * length in meters * width in meters
4069 // length in meters = length in tiles
4070 // actual area in m = # of structure tiles * length in tiles * width in meters /
4071 // ( length in tiles * width in tiles )
4072 // actual area in m = # of structure tiles * width in meters / width in tiles
4073 double actual_area_m = width_m * structure_indices.size() / tile_width;
4074
4075 // effective hull area is actual hull area * hull coverage
4076 double hull_area_m = actual_area_m * std::max( 0.1, hull_coverage );
4077 // Treat the hullform as a simple cuboid to calculate displaced depth of
4078 // water.
4079 // Apply Archimedes' principle (mass of water displaced is mass of vehicle).
4080 // area * depth = hull_volume = water_mass / water density
4081 // water_mass = vehicle_mass
4082 // area * depth = vehicle_mass / water_density
4083 // depth = vehicle_mass / water_density / area
4084 constexpr double water_density = 1000.0; // kg/m^3
4085 draft_m = to_kilogram( total_mass() ) / water_density / hull_area_m;
4086 // increase the streamlining as more of the boat is covered in boat boards
4087 double c_water_drag = 1.25 - hull_coverage;
4088 // hull height starts at 0.3m and goes up as you add more boat boards
4089 hull_height = 0.3 + 0.5 * hull_coverage;
4090 // F_water_drag = c_water_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * water_density * v^2
4091 // coeff_water_resistance = c_water_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * water_density
4092 coefficient_water_resistance = c_water_drag * width_m * draft_m * 0.5 * water_density;
4093 coeff_water_dirty = false;
4094 return coefficient_water_resistance;
4095}
4096
4097float vehicle::k_traction( float wheel_traction_area ) const
4098{
4099 if( is_floating ) {
4100 return can_float() ? 1.0f : -1.0f;
4101 }
4102 if( is_flying ) {
4103 return is_rotorcraft() ? 1.0f : -1.0f;
4104 }
4105 if( is_watercraft() && can_float() ) {
4106 return 1.0f;
4107 }
4108
4109 const float fraction_without_traction = 1.0f - wheel_traction_area / wheel_area();
4110 if( fraction_without_traction == 0 ) {
4111 return 1.0f;
4112 }
4113 const float mass_penalty = fraction_without_traction * to_kilogram( total_mass() );
4114 float traction = std::min( 1.0f, wheel_traction_area / mass_penalty );
4115 add_msg( m_debug, "%s has traction %.2f", name, traction );
4116
4117 // For now make it easy until it gets properly balanced: add a low cap of 0.1
4118 return std::max( 0.1f, traction );
4119}
4120
4121int vehicle::static_drag( bool actual ) const
4122{
4123 return extra_drag + ( actual && !engine_on && !is_towed() ? -1500 : 0 );
4124}
4125
4126float vehicle::strain() const
4127{
4128 int mv = max_velocity();
4129 int sv = safe_velocity();
4130 if( mv <= sv ) {
4131 mv = sv + 1;
4132 }
4133 if( velocity < sv && velocity > -sv ) {
4134 return 0;
4135 } else {
4136 return static_cast<float>( std::abs( velocity ) - sv ) / static_cast<float>( mv - sv );
4137 }
4138}
4139
4140bool vehicle::sufficient_wheel_config() const
4141{
4142 if( wheelcache.empty() ) {
4143 // No wheels!
4144 return false;
4145 } else if( wheelcache.size() == 1 ) {
4146 //Has to be a stable wheel, and one wheel can only support a 1-3 tile vehicle
4147 if( !part_info( wheelcache.front() ).has_flag( "STABLE" ) ||
4148 all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure ).size() > 3 ) {
4149 return false;
4150 }
4151 }
4152 return true;
4153}
4154
4155bool vehicle::is_owned_by( const Character &c, bool available_to_take ) const
4156{
4157 if( owner.is_null() ) {
4158 return available_to_take;
4159 }
4160 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
4161 debugmsg( "vehicle::is_owned_by() player %s has no faction", c.disp_name() );
4162 return false;
4163 }
4164 return c.get_faction()->id == get_owner();
4165}
4166
4167bool vehicle::is_old_owner( const Character &c, bool available_to_take ) const
4168{
4169 if( old_owner.is_null() ) {
4170 return available_to_take;
4171 }
4172 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
4173 debugmsg( "vehicle::is_old_owner() player %s has no faction", c.disp_name() );
4174 return false;
4175 }
4176 return c.get_faction()->id == get_old_owner();
4177}
4178
4179std::string vehicle::get_owner_name() const
4180{
4181 if( !g->faction_manager_ptr->get( owner ) ) {
4182 debugmsg( "vehicle::get_owner_name() vehicle %s has no valid nor null faction id ", disp_name() );
4183 return _( "no owner" );
4184 }
4185 return _( g->faction_manager_ptr->get( owner )->name );
4186}
4187
4188void vehicle::set_owner( const Character &c )
4189{
4190 if( !c.get_faction() ) {
4191 debugmsg( "vehicle::set_owner() player %s has no valid faction", c.disp_name() );
4192 return;
4193 }
4194 owner = c.get_faction()->id;
4195}
4196
4197bool vehicle::handle_potential_theft( player &p, bool check_only, bool prompt )
4198{
4199 const bool is_owned_by_player = is_owned_by( p );
4200 std::vector<npc *> witnesses;
4201 for( npc &elem : g->all_npcs() ) {
4202 if( rl_dist( elem.pos(), p.pos() ) < MAX_VIEW_DISTANCE && has_owner() &&
4203 !is_owned_by_player && elem.sees( p.pos() ) ) {
4204 witnesses.push_back( &elem );
4205 }
4206 }
4207 // the vehicle is yours, that's fine.
4208 if( is_owned_by_player ) {
4209 return true;
4210 // if There is no owner
4211 // handle transfer of ownership
4212 } else if( !has_owner() ) {
4213 set_owner( p.get_faction()->id );
4214 remove_old_owner();
4215 return true;
4216 // if there is a marker for having been stolen, but 15 minutes have passed, then officially transfer ownership
4217 } else if( witnesses.empty() && has_old_owner() && !is_old_owner( p ) && theft_time &&
4218 calendar::turn - *theft_time > 15_minutes ) {
4219 set_owner( p.get_faction()->id );
4220 remove_old_owner();
4221 return true;
4222 // No witnesses? then don't need to prompt, we assume the player is in process of stealing it.
4223 // Ownership transfer checking is handled above, and warnings handled below.
4224 // This is just to perform interaction with the vehicle without a prompt.
4225 // It will prompt first-time, even with no witnesses, to inform player it is owned by someone else
4226 // subsequently, no further prompts, the player should know by then.
4227 } else if( witnesses.empty() && old_owner ) {
4228 return true;
4229 }
4230 // if we are just checking if we could continue without problems, then the rest is assumed false
4231 if( check_only ) {
4232 return false;
4233 }
4234 // if we got here, there's some theft occurring
4235 if( prompt ) {
4236 if( !query_yn(
4237 _( "This vehicle belongs to: %s, there may be consequences if you are observed interacting with it, continue?" ),
4238 _( get_owner_name() ) ) ) {
4239 return false;
4240 }
4241 }
4242 // set old owner so that we can restore ownership if there are witnesses.
4243 set_old_owner( get_owner() );
4244 for( npc *elem : witnesses ) {
4245 elem->say( "<witnessed_thievery>", 7 );
4246 }
4247 if( !witnesses.empty() ) {
4248 if( p.add_faction_warning( get_owner() ) ) {
4249 for( npc *elem : witnesses ) {
4250 elem->make_angry();
4251 }
4252 }
4253 // remove the temporary marker for a successful theft, as it was witnessed.
4254 remove_old_owner();
4255 }
4256 // if we got here, then the action will proceed after the previous warning
4257 return true;
4258}
4259
4260bool vehicle::balanced_wheel_config() const
4261{
4262 point min = point_max;
4263 point max = point_min;
4264 // find the bounding box of the wheels
4265 for( auto &w : wheelcache ) {
4266 const auto &pt = parts[ w ].mount;
4267 min.x = std::min( min.x, pt.x );
4268 min.y = std::min( min.y, pt.y );
4269 max.x = std::max( max.x, pt.x );
4270 max.y = std::max( max.y, pt.y );
4271 }
4272
4273 // Check center of mass inside support of wheels (roughly)
4274 const point &com = local_center_of_mass();
4275 const inclusive_rectangle<point> support( min, max );
4276 return support.contains( com );
4277}
4278
4279bool vehicle::valid_wheel_config() const
4280{
4281 return sufficient_wheel_config() && balanced_wheel_config();
4282}
4283
4284float vehicle::steering_effectiveness() const
4285{
4286 if( is_floating ) {
4287 // I'M ON A BOAT
4288 return can_float() ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
4289 }
4290 if( is_flying ) {
4291 // I'M IN THE AIR
4292 return is_rotorcraft() ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
4293 }
4294 // irksome special case for boats in shallow water
4295 if( is_watercraft() && can_float() ) {
4296 return 1.0f;
4297 }
4298
4299 if( steering.empty() ) {
4300 return -1.0f; // No steering installed
4301 }
4302 // If the only steering part is an animal harness, with no animal in, it
4303 // is not steerable.
4304 const vehicle_part &vp = parts[ steering[0] ];
4305 if( steering.size() == 1 && vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal ) {
4306 monster *mon = get_pet( steering[0] );
4307 if( mon == nullptr || !mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
4308 return -2.0f;
4309 }
4310 }
4311 // For now, you just need one wheel working for 100% effective steering.
4312 // TODO: return something less than 1.0 if the steering isn't so good
4313 // (unbalanced, long wheelbase, back-heavy vehicle with front wheel steering,
4314 // etc)
4315 for( int p : steering ) {
4316 if( parts[ p ].is_available() ) {
4317 return 1.0f;
4318 }
4319 }
4320
4321 // We have steering, but it's all broken.
4322 return 0.0f;
4323}
4324
4325float vehicle::handling_difficulty() const
4326{
4327 const float steer = std::max( 0.0f, steering_effectiveness() );
4328 const float ktraction = k_traction( g->m.vehicle_wheel_traction( *this ) );
4329 const float aligned = std::max( 0.0f, 1.0f - ( face_vec() - dir_vec() ).magnitude() );
4330
4331 // TestVehicle: perfect steering, moving on road at 100 mph (25 tiles per turn) = 0.0
4332 // TestVehicle but on grass (0.75 friction) = 2.5
4333 // TestVehicle but with bad steering (0.5 steer) = 5
4334 // TestVehicle but on fungal bed (0.5 friction) and bad steering = 10
4335 // TestVehicle but turned 90 degrees during this turn (0 align) = 10
4336 const float diff_mod = ( ( 1.0f - steer ) + ( 1.0f - ktraction ) + ( 1.0f - aligned ) );
4337 return velocity * diff_mod / vehicles::vmiph_per_tile;
4338}
4339
4340std::map<itype_id, int> vehicle::fuel_usage() const
4341{
4342 std::map<itype_id, int> ret;
4343 for( size_t i = 0; i < engines.size(); i++ ) {
4344 // Note: functions with "engine" in name do NOT take part indices
4345 // TODO: Use part indices and not engine vector indices
4346 if( !is_engine_on( i ) ) {
4347 continue;
4348 }
4349
4350 const size_t e = engines[ i ];
4351 const auto &info = part_info( e );
4352 static const itype_id null_fuel_type( "null" );
4353 const itype_id &cur_fuel = parts[ e ].fuel_current();
4354 if( cur_fuel == null_fuel_type ) {
4355 continue;
4356 }
4357
4358 if( !is_perpetual_type( i ) ) {
4359 int usage = info.energy_consumption;
4360 if( parts[ e ].faults().count( fault_filter_air ) ) {
4361 usage *= 2;
4362 }
4363
4364 ret[ cur_fuel ] += usage;
4365 }
4366 }
4367
4368 return ret;
4369}
4370
4371double vehicle::drain_energy( const itype_id &ftype, double energy_j )
4372{
4373 // Consumption of battery power is done differently.
4374 // From all batteries at once and doesn't change mass.
4375 if( ftype == fuel_type_battery ) {
4376 // Batteries stored in kilojoules
4377 const int total_kj_to_drain = static_cast<int>( energy_j / 1000.0 );
4378 if( total_kj_to_drain <= 0 ) {
4379 return 0.0;
4380 }
4381 const int not_fulfilled = discharge_battery( total_kj_to_drain );
4382 return static_cast<double>( total_kj_to_drain - not_fulfilled ) * 1000.0;
4383 }
4384
4385 double drained = 0.0f;
4386 for( auto &p : parts ) {
4387 if( energy_j <= 0.0f ) {
4388 break;
4389 }
4390
4391 const double consumed = p.consume_energy( ftype, energy_j );
4392 drained += consumed;
4393 energy_j -= consumed;
4394 }
4395
4396 invalidate_mass();
4397 return drained;
4398}
4399
4400void vehicle::consume_fuel( int load, const int t_seconds, bool skip_electric )
4401{
4402 double st = strain();
4403 for( auto &fuel_pr : fuel_usage() ) {
4404 auto &ft = fuel_pr.first;
4405 if( skip_electric && ft == fuel_type_battery ) {
4406 continue;
4407 }
4408
4409 double amnt_precise_j = static_cast<double>( fuel_pr.second ) * t_seconds;
4410 amnt_precise_j *= load / 1000.0 * ( 1.0 + st * st * 100.0 );
4411 auto inserted = fuel_used_last_turn.insert( { ft, 0.0f } );
4412 inserted.first->second += amnt_precise_j;
4413 double remainder = fuel_remainder[ ft ];
4414 amnt_precise_j -= remainder;
4415
4416 if( amnt_precise_j > 0.0f ) {
4417 fuel_remainder[ ft ] = drain_energy( ft, amnt_precise_j ) - amnt_precise_j;
4418 } else {
4419 fuel_remainder[ ft ] = -amnt_precise_j;
4420 }
4421 }
4422 // we want this to update the activity level whenever the engine is running
4423 if( load > 0 && fuel_left( fuel_type_muscle ) > 0 ) {
4424 //do this as a function of current load
4425 // But only if the player is actually there!
4426 int eff_load = load / 10;
4427 int mod = 4 * st; // strain
4428 int base_burn = static_cast<int>( get_option<float>( "PLAYER_BASE_STAMINA_REGEN_RATE" ) ) -
4429 3;
4430 base_burn = std::max( eff_load / 3, base_burn );
4431 //charge bionics when using muscle engine
4432 const item muscle( "muscle" );
4433 for( const bionic_id &bid : g->u.get_bionic_fueled_with( muscle ) ) {
4434 if( g->u.has_active_bionic( bid ) ) { // active power gen
4435 // more pedaling = more power
4436 g->u.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( muscle.fuel_energy() ) * bid->fuel_efficiency *
4437 ( load / 1000 ) );
4438 mod += eff_load / 5;
4439 } else { // passive power gen
4440 g->u.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( muscle.fuel_energy() ) * bid->passive_fuel_efficiency *
4441 ( load / 1000 ) );
4442 mod += eff_load / 10;
4443 }
4444 }
4445 // decreased stamina burn scalable with load
4446 if( g->u.has_active_bionic( bio_jointservo ) ) {
4447 g->u.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( -std::max( eff_load / 20, 1 ) ) );
4448 mod -= std::max( eff_load / 5, 5 );
4449 }
4450 if( one_in( 1000 / load ) && one_in( 10 ) ) {
4451 g->u.mod_stored_kcal( -10 );
4452 g->u.mod_thirst( 1 );
4453 g->u.mod_fatigue( 1 );
4454 }
4455 g->u.mod_stamina( -( base_burn + mod ) );
4456 add_msg( m_debug, "Load: %d", load );
4457 add_msg( m_debug, "Mod: %d", mod );
4458 add_msg( m_debug, "Burn: %d", -( base_burn + mod ) );
4459 }
4460}
4461
4462std::vector<vehicle_part *> vehicle::lights( bool active )
4463{
4464 std::vector<vehicle_part *> res;
4465 for( auto &e : parts ) {
4466 if( ( !active || e.enabled ) && e.is_available() && e.is_light() ) {
4467 res.push_back( &e );
4468 }
4469 }
4470 return res;
4471}
4472
4473int vehicle::total_accessory_epower_w() const
4474{
4475 int epower = 0;
4476 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( VPFLAG_ENABLED_DRAINS_EPOWER ) ) {
4477 epower += vp.info().epower;
4478 }
4479 return epower;
4480}
4481
4482int vehicle::total_alternator_epower_w() const
4483{
4484 int epower = 0;
4485 if( engine_on ) {
4486 // If the engine is on, the alternators are working.
4487 for( size_t p = 0; p < alternators.size(); ++p ) {
4488 if( is_alternator_on( p ) ) {
4489 epower += part_epower_w( alternators[p] );
4490 }
4491 }
4492 }
4493 return epower;
4494}
4495
4496int vehicle::total_engine_epower_w() const
4497{
4498 int epower = 0;
4499
4500 // Engines: can both produce (plasma) or consume (gas, diesel) epower.
4501 // Gas engines require epower to run for ignition system, ECU, etc.
4502 // Electric motor consumption not included, see @ref vpart_info::energy_consumption
4503 if( engine_on ) {
4504 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
4505 if( is_engine_on( e ) ) {
4506 epower += part_epower_w( engines[e] );
4507 }
4508 }
4509 }
4510
4511 return epower;
4512}
4513
4514int vehicle::total_solar_epower_w() const
4515{
4516 int epower_w = 0;
4517 for( int part : solar_panels ) {
4518 if( parts[ part ].is_unavailable() ) {
4519 continue;
4520 }
4521
4522 if( !is_sm_tile_outside( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( part ) ) ) ) {
4523 continue;
4524 }
4525
4526 epower_w += part_epower_w( part );
4527 }
4528 // Weather doesn't change much across the area of the vehicle, so just
4529 // sample it once.
4530 const weather_type_id &wtype = current_weather( global_pos3() );
4531 const float tick_sunlight = incident_sunlight( wtype, calendar::turn );
4532 double intensity = tick_sunlight / default_daylight_level();
4533 return epower_w * intensity;
4534}
4535
4536int vehicle::total_wind_epower_w() const
4537{
4538 map &here = get_map();
4539 const oter_id &cur_om_ter = overmap_buffer.ter( global_omt_location() );
4540 const weather_manager &weather = get_weather();
4541 int epower_w = 0;
4542 for( int part : wind_turbines ) {
4543 if( parts[ part ].is_unavailable() ) {
4544 continue;
4545 }
4546
4547 if( !is_sm_tile_outside( here.getabs( global_part_pos3( part ) ) ) ) {
4548 continue;
4549 }
4550
4551 double windpower = get_local_windpower( weather.windspeed, cur_om_ter, global_part_pos3( part ),
4552 weather.winddirection, false );
4553 if( windpower <= ( weather.windspeed / 10.0 ) ) {
4554 continue;
4555 }
4556 epower_w += part_epower_w( part ) * windpower;
4557 }
4558 return epower_w;
4559}
4560
4561int vehicle::total_water_wheel_epower_w() const
4562{
4563 int epower_w = 0;
4564 for( int part : water_wheels ) {
4565 if( parts[ part ].is_unavailable() ) {
4566 continue;
4567 }
4568
4569 if( !is_sm_tile_over_water( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( part ) ) ) ) {
4570 continue;
4571 }
4572
4573 epower_w += part_epower_w( part );
4574 }
4575 // TODO: river current intensity changes power - flat for now.
4576 return epower_w;
4577}
4578
4579int vehicle::net_battery_charge_rate_w() const
4580{
4581 return total_engine_epower_w() + total_alternator_epower_w() + total_accessory_epower_w() +
4582 total_solar_epower_w() + total_wind_epower_w() + total_water_wheel_epower_w();
