4583}
4584
4585int vehicle::max_reactor_epower_w() const
4586{
4587 int epower_w = 0;
4588 for( int elem : reactors ) {
4589 epower_w += is_part_on( elem ) ? part_epower_w( elem ) : 0;
4590 }
4591 return epower_w;
4592}
4593
4594void vehicle::update_alternator_load()
4595{
4596 // Update alternator load
4597 if( engine_on ) {
4598 int engine_vpower = 0;
4599 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
4600 if( is_engine_on( e ) && parts[engines[e]].info().has_flag( "E_ALTERNATOR" ) ) {
4601 engine_vpower += part_vpower_w( engines[e] );
4602 }
4603 }
4604 int alternators_power = 0;
4605 for( size_t p = 0; p < alternators.size(); ++p ) {
4606 if( is_alternator_on( p ) ) {
4607 alternators_power += part_vpower_w( alternators[p] );
4608 }
4609 }
4610 alternator_load =
4611 engine_vpower
4612 ? 1000 * ( std::abs( alternators_power ) + std::abs( extra_drag ) ) / engine_vpower
4613 : 0;
4614 } else {
4615 alternator_load = 0;
4616 }
4617}
4618
4619void vehicle::power_parts()
4620{
4621 update_alternator_load();
4622 // Things that drain energy: engines and accessories.
4623 int engine_epower = total_engine_epower_w();
4624 int epower = engine_epower + total_accessory_epower_w() + total_alternator_epower_w();
4625
4626 int delta_energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower, 1_turns );
4627 int storage_deficit_bat = std::max( 0, fuel_capacity( fuel_type_battery ) -
4628 fuel_left( fuel_type_battery ) - delta_energy_bat );
4629 // Reactors trigger only on demand. If we'd otherwise run out of power, see
4630 // if we can spin up the reactors.
4631 if( !reactors.empty() && storage_deficit_bat > 0 ) {
4632 // Still not enough surplus epower to fully charge battery
4633 // Produce additional epower from any reactors
4634 bool reactor_working = false;
4635 bool reactor_online = false;
4636 for( auto &elem : reactors ) {
4637 // Check whether the reactor is on. If not, move on.
4638 if( !is_part_on( elem ) ) {
4639 continue;
4640 }
4641 // Keep track whether or not the vehicle has any reactors activated
4642 reactor_online = true;
4643 // the amount of energy the reactor generates each turn
4644 const int gen_energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( part_epower_w( elem ), 1_turns );
4645 if( parts[ elem ].is_unavailable() ) {
4646 continue;
4647 } else if( parts[ elem ].info().has_flag( flag_PERPETUAL ) ) {
4648 reactor_working = true;
4649 delta_energy_bat += std::min( storage_deficit_bat, gen_energy_bat );
4650 } else if( parts[elem].ammo_remaining() > 0 ) {
4651 // Efficiency: one unit of fuel is this many units of battery
4652 // Note: One battery is 1 kJ
4653 const int efficiency = part_info( elem ).power;
4654 const int avail_fuel = parts[elem].ammo_remaining() * efficiency;
4655 const int elem_energy_bat = std::min( gen_energy_bat, avail_fuel );
4656 // Cap output at what we can achieve and utilize
4657 const int reactors_output_bat = std::min( elem_energy_bat, storage_deficit_bat );
4658 // Fuel consumed in actual units of the resource
4659 int fuel_consumed = reactors_output_bat / efficiency;
4660 // Remainder has a chance of resulting in more fuel consumption
4661 fuel_consumed += x_in_y( reactors_output_bat % efficiency, efficiency ) ? 1 : 0;
4662 parts[ elem ].ammo_consume( fuel_consumed, global_part_pos3( elem ) );
4663 reactor_working = true;
4664 delta_energy_bat += reactors_output_bat;
4665 }
4666 }
4667
4668 if( !reactor_working && reactor_online ) {
4669 // All reactors out of fuel or destroyed
4670 for( auto &elem : reactors ) {
4671 parts[ elem ].enabled = false;
4672 }
4673 if( player_in_control( g->u ) || g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
4674 add_msg( _( "The %s's reactor dies!" ), name );
4675 }
4676 }
4677 }
4678
4679 int battery_deficit = 0;
4680 if( delta_energy_bat > 0 ) {
4681 // store epower surplus in battery
4682 charge_battery( delta_energy_bat );
4683 } else if( epower < 0 ) {
4684 // draw epower deficit from battery
4685 battery_deficit = discharge_battery( std::abs( delta_energy_bat ) );
4686 }
4687
4688 if( battery_deficit != 0 ) {
4689 // Scoops need a special case since they consume power during actual use
4690 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "SCOOP" ) ) {
4691 vp.part().enabled = false;
4692 }
4693 // Rechargers need special case since they consume power on demand
4694 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "RECHARGE" ) ) {
4695 vp.part().enabled = false;
4696 }
4697
4698 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( VPFLAG_ENABLED_DRAINS_EPOWER ) ) {
4699 vehicle_part &pt = vp.part();
4700 if( pt.info().epower < 0 ) {
4701 pt.enabled = false;
4702 }
4703 }
4704
4705 is_alarm_on = false;
4706 camera_on = false;
4707 if( player_in_control( g->u ) || g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
4708 add_msg( _( "The %s's battery dies!" ), name );
4709 }
4710 if( engine_epower < 0 ) {
4711 // Not enough epower to run gas engine ignition system
4712 engine_on = false;
4713 if( player_in_control( g->u ) || g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
4714 add_msg( _( "The %s's engine dies!" ), name );
4715 }
4716 }
4717 }
4718}
4719
4720vehicle *vehicle::find_vehicle( const tripoint &where )
4721{
4722 // Is it in the reality bubble?
4723 tripoint veh_local = g->m.getlocal( where );
4724 if( const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( veh_local ) ) {
4725 return &vp->vehicle();
4726 }
4727
4728 // Nope. Load up its submap...
4729 tripoint veh_in_sm = where;
4730 tripoint veh_sm = ms_to_sm_remain( veh_in_sm );
4731
4732 auto sm = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( veh_sm );
4733 if( sm == nullptr ) {
4734 return nullptr;
4735 }
4736
4737 for( auto &elem : sm->vehicles ) {
4738 vehicle *found_veh = elem.get();
4739 if( veh_in_sm.xy() == found_veh->pos ) {
4740 return found_veh;
4741 }
4742 }
4743
4744 return nullptr;
4745}
4746
4747void vehicle::enumerate_vehicles( std::map<vehicle *, bool> &connected_vehicles,
4748 const std::set<vehicle *> &vehicle_list )
4749{
4750 auto enumerate_visitor = [&connected_vehicles]( vehicle & veh ) {
4751 // Only emplaces if element is not present already.
4752 connected_vehicles.emplace( &veh, false );
4753 return distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result::continue_further;
4754 };
4755 for( vehicle *veh : vehicle_list ) {
4756 // This autovivifies, and also overwrites the value if already present.
4757 connected_vehicles[veh] = true;
4758 distribution_graph::traverse( *veh, enumerate_visitor, distribution_graph::noop_visitor_grid );
4759 }
4760}
4761
4762// TODO: It looks out of place in vehicle.cpp
4763namespace distribution_graph
4764{
4765
4766template <bool IsConst,
4767 typename Vehicle = typename std::conditional<IsConst, const vehicle, vehicle>::type,
4768 typename Grid = typename std::conditional<IsConst, const distribution_grid, distribution_grid>::type>
4769struct vehicle_or_grid {
4770 enum class type_t : char {
4771 vehicle,
4772 grid
4773 } type;
4774
4775 Vehicle *veh = nullptr;
4776 Grid *grid = nullptr;
4777
4778 vehicle_or_grid( Vehicle *veh )
4779 : type( type_t::vehicle )
4780 , veh( veh )
4781 {}
4782
4783 vehicle_or_grid( Grid *grid )
4784 : type( type_t::grid )
4785 , grid( grid )
4786 {}
4787
4788 bool operator==( const vehicle_or_grid &other ) const {
4789 return veh == other.veh && grid == other.grid;
4790 }
4791
4792 bool operator==( const vehicle *veh ) const {
4793 return this->veh == veh;
4794 }
4795
4796 bool operator==( const distribution_grid *grid ) const {
4797 return this->grid == grid;
4798 }
4799};
4800
4801template <typename VehFunc, typename GridFunc, typename StartPoint>
4802void traverse( StartPoint &start,
4803 VehFunc veh_action, GridFunc grid_action )
4804{
4805 using tvr = traverse_visitor_result;
4806 constexpr bool IsConst = std::is_const<StartPoint>::value;
4807 struct hash {
4808 const std::hash<char> char_hash = std::hash<char>();
4809 const std::hash<size_t> ptr_hash = std::hash<size_t>();
4810 auto operator()( const vehicle_or_grid<IsConst> &elem ) const {
4811 return char_hash( static_cast<char>( elem.type ) ) ^
4812 ptr_hash(
4813 // Because only one of pointers is not nullptr, binary OR would get value of set pointer.
4814 reinterpret_cast<size_t>( elem.veh ) | reinterpret_cast<size_t>( elem.grid )
4815 );
4816 }
4817 };
4818
4819 // Actually, they are visited elements with unvisited neighbours.
4820 // Not all connected elements are here.
4821 std::queue<vehicle_or_grid<IsConst>> connected_elements;
4822 // For fast checking if we should visit some neighbour.
4823 std::unordered_set<vehicle_or_grid<IsConst>, hash> visited_elements;
4824 connected_elements.emplace( &start );
4825 visited_elements.insert( &start );
4826 auto &grid_tracker = get_distribution_grid_tracker();
4827
4828 auto enqueue = [&connected_elements, &visited_elements]( vehicle_or_grid<IsConst> newly_visited ) {
4829 connected_elements.push( newly_visited );
4830 visited_elements.insert( newly_visited );
4831 };
4832 auto was_already_visited = [&visited_elements]( vehicle_or_grid<IsConst> to_visit ) {
4833 return visited_elements.count( to_visit ) != 0;
4834 };
4835
4836 auto process_vehicle = [&]( const tripoint_abs_ms & target_pos ) {
4837 auto *veh = vehicle::find_vehicle( target_pos );
4838 if( veh == nullptr ) {
4839 debugmsg( "lost vehicle at %s", target_pos.to_string() );
4840 return tvr::continue_further;
4841 }
4842
4843 if( was_already_visited( veh ) ) {
4844 return tvr::continue_further;
4845 }
4846
4847 const tvr result = veh_action( *veh );
4848 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "After remote veh %p",
4849 static_cast<void *>( veh ) );
4850
4851 // We do not need to check neighbours if we stop.
4852 if( result == tvr::continue_further ) {
4853 enqueue( veh );
4854 }
4855
4856 return result;
4857 };
4858
4859 auto process_grid = [&]( const tripoint_abs_ms & target_pos ) {
4860 auto &grid = grid_tracker.grid_at( target_pos );
4861 if( !grid ) {
4862 debugmsg( "lost grid at %s", target_pos.to_string() );
4863 return tvr::continue_further;
4864 }
4865
4866 if( was_already_visited( &grid ) ) {
4867 return tvr::continue_further;
4868 }
4869
4870 const tvr result = grid_action( grid );
4871 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "After remote grid %p",
4872 static_cast<void *>( &grid ) );
4873
4874 // We do not need to check neighbours if we stop.
4875 if( result == tvr::continue_further ) {
4876 enqueue( &grid );
4877 }
4878
4879 return result;
4880 };
4881
4882 while( !connected_elements.empty() ) {
4883 auto current = connected_elements.front();
4884 connected_elements.pop();
4885
4886 if( current.type == vehicle_or_grid<IsConst>::type_t::vehicle ) {
4887 const vehicle &current_veh = *current.veh;
4888 for( auto &p : current_veh.loose_parts ) {
4889 if( !current_veh.part_info( p ).has_flag( "POWER_TRANSFER" ) ) {
4890 // Ignore loose parts that aren't power transfer cables
4891 continue;
4892 }
4893
4894 const tripoint_abs_ms target_pos( current_veh.cpart( p ).target.second );
4895 if( current_veh.cpart( p ).has_flag( vehicle_part::targets_grid ) ) {
4896 if( process_grid( target_pos ) == tvr::stop ) {
4897 return;
4898 }
4899 } else {
4900 if( process_vehicle( target_pos ) == tvr::stop ) {
4901 return;
4902 }
4903 }
4904 }
4905 } else {
4906 // Grids can only be connected to vehicles at the moment
4907 auto &current_grid = *current.grid;
4908 for( auto &p : current_grid.get_contents() ) {
4909 const vehicle_connector_tile *connector = active_tiles::furn_at<vehicle_connector_tile>( p );
4910 if( connector == nullptr ) {
4911 continue;
4912 }
4913
4914 for( const tripoint_abs_ms &target_pos : connector->connected_vehicles ) {
4915 if( process_vehicle( target_pos ) == tvr::stop ) {
4916 return;
4917 }
4918 }
4919 }
4920 }
4921 }
4922}
4923
4924} // namespace distribution_graph
4925
4926int vehicle::charge_battery( int amount, bool include_other_vehicles )
4927{
4928 // Key parts by percentage charge level.
4929 std::multimap<int, vehicle_part *> chargeable_parts;
4930 for( vehicle_part &p : parts ) {
4931 if( p.is_available() && p.is_battery() && p.ammo_capacity() > p.ammo_remaining() ) {
4932 chargeable_parts.insert( { ( p.ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p.ammo_capacity(), &p } );
4933 }
4934 }
4935 while( amount > 0 && !chargeable_parts.empty() ) {
4936 // Grab first part, charge until it reaches the next %, then re-insert with new % key.
4937 auto iter = chargeable_parts.begin();
4938 int charge_level = iter->first;
4939 vehicle_part *p = iter->second;
4940 chargeable_parts.erase( iter );
4941 // Calculate number of charges to reach the next %, but insure it's at least
4942 // one more than current charge.
4943 int next_charge_level = ( ( charge_level + 1 ) * p->ammo_capacity() ) / 100;
4944 next_charge_level = std::max( next_charge_level, p->ammo_remaining() + 1 );
4945 int qty = std::min( amount, next_charge_level - p->ammo_remaining() );
4946 p->ammo_set( fuel_type_battery, p->ammo_remaining() + qty );
4947 amount -= qty;
4948 if( p->ammo_capacity() > p->ammo_remaining() ) {
4949 chargeable_parts.insert( { ( p->ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p->ammo_capacity(), p } );
4950 }
4951 }
4952
4953 if( amount > 0 && include_other_vehicles ) {
4954 // still a bit of charge we could send out...
4955 using tvr = distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result;
4956 auto charge_veh = [&amount]( vehicle & veh ) {
4957 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHv: %d", amount );
4958 amount = veh.charge_battery( amount, false );
4959 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
4960 };
4961 auto charge_grid = [&amount]( distribution_grid & grid ) {
4962 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHg: %d", amount );
4963 amount = grid.mod_resource( amount, false );
4964 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
4965 };
4966 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, charge_veh, charge_grid );
4967 }
4968
4969
4970 return amount;
4971}
4972
4973int vehicle::discharge_battery( int amount, bool recurse )
4974{
4975 // Key parts by percentage charge level.
4976 std::multimap<int, vehicle_part *> dischargeable_parts;
4977 for( vehicle_part &p : parts ) {
4978 if( p.is_available() && p.is_battery() && p.ammo_remaining() > 0 ) {
4979 dischargeable_parts.insert( { ( p.ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p.ammo_capacity(), &p } );
4980 }
4981 }
4982 while( amount > 0 && !dischargeable_parts.empty() ) {
4983 // Grab first part, discharge until it reaches the next %, then re-insert with new % key.
4984 auto iter = std::prev( dischargeable_parts.end() );
4985 int charge_level = iter->first;
4986 vehicle_part *p = iter->second;
4987 dischargeable_parts.erase( iter );
4988 // Calculate number of charges to reach the previous %.
4989 int prev_charge_level = ( ( charge_level - 1 ) * p->ammo_capacity() ) / 100;
4990 prev_charge_level = std::max( 0, prev_charge_level );
4991 int amount_to_discharge = std::min( p->ammo_remaining() - prev_charge_level, amount );
4992 p->ammo_consume( amount_to_discharge, global_part_pos3( *p ) );
4993 amount -= amount_to_discharge;
4994 if( p->ammo_remaining() > 0 ) {
4995 dischargeable_parts.insert( { ( p->ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p->ammo_capacity(), p } );
4996 }
4997 }
4998
4999 if( amount > 0 && recurse ) {
5000 // need more power!
5001 using tvr = distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result;
5002 auto discharge_vehicle = [&amount]( vehicle & veh ) {
5003 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHv: %d", amount );
5004 amount = veh.discharge_battery( amount, false );
5005 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5006 };
5007 auto discharge_grid = [&amount]( distribution_grid & grid ) {
5008 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHg: %d", amount );
5009 amount = -grid.mod_resource( -amount, false );
5010 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5011 };
5012 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, discharge_vehicle, discharge_grid );
5013 }
5014
5015 return amount; // non-zero if we weren't able to fulfill demand.
5016}
5017
5018void vehicle::do_engine_damage( size_t e, int strain )
5019{
5020 strain = std::min( 25, strain );
5021 if( is_engine_on( e ) && !is_perpetual_type( e ) &&
5022 engine_fuel_left( e ) && rng( 1, 100 ) < strain ) {
5023 int dmg = rng( 0, strain * 4 );
5024 damage_direct( engines[e], dmg );
5025 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
5026 add_msg( _( "Your engine emits a high pitched whine." ) );
5027 } else {
5028 add_msg( _( "Your engine emits a loud grinding sound." ) );
5029 }
5030 }
5031}
5032
5033void vehicle::idle( bool on_map )
5034{
5035 power_parts();
5036 if( engine_on && total_power_w() > 0 ) {
5037 int idle_rate = alternator_load;
5038 if( idle_rate < 10 ) {
5039 idle_rate = 10; // minimum idle is 1% of full throttle
5040 }
5041 // Helicopters use extra power just to stay in the air
5042 // 100 means 10% of power
5043 if( is_rotorcraft() && is_flying_in_air() ) {
5044 idle_rate = 100;
5045 }
5046 if( has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) ) {
5047 consume_fuel( idle_rate, to_turns<int>( 1_turns ), true );
5048 }
5049
5050 if( on_map ) {
5051 noise_and_smoke( idle_rate, 1_turns );
5052 }
5053 } else {
5054 if( engine_on && g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) &&
5055 ( has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) && has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_animal, true ) &&
5056 has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_wind, true ) && has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_mana, true ) ) ) {
5057 add_msg( _( "The %s's engine dies!" ), name );
5058 }
5059 engine_on = false;
5060 }
5061
5062 if( !warm_enough_to_plant( g->u.pos() ) ) {
5063 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "PLANTER" ) ) {
5064 if( g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
5065 add_msg( _( "The %s's planter turns off due to low temperature." ), name );
5066 }
5067 vp.part().enabled = false;
5068 }
5069 }
5070
5071 if( !on_map ) {
5072 return;
5073 } else {
5074 update_time( calendar::turn );
5075 }
5076
5077 process_emitters();
5078
5079 if( has_part( "STEREO", true ) ) {
5080 play_music();
5081 }
5082
5083 if( has_part( "CHIMES", true ) ) {
5084 play_chimes();
5085 }
5086
5087 if( has_part( "CRASH_TERRAIN_AROUND", true ) ) {
5088 crash_terrain_around();
5089 }
5090
5091 if( is_alarm_on ) {
5092 alarm();
5093 }
5094}
5095
5096void vehicle::on_move()
5097{
5098 if( has_part( "TRANSFORM_TERRAIN", true ) ) {
5099 transform_terrain();
5100 }
5101 if( has_part( "SCOOP", true ) ) {
5102 operate_scoop();
5103 }
5104 if( has_part( "PLANTER", true ) ) {
5105 operate_planter();
5106 }
5107 if( has_part( "REAPER", true ) ) {
5108 operate_reaper();
5109 }
5110
5111 occupied_cache_time = calendar::before_time_starts;
5112}
5113
5114void vehicle::slow_leak()
5115{
5116 // for each badly damaged tanks (lower than 50% health), leak a small amount
5117 for( auto &p : parts ) {
5118 auto health = p.health_percent();
5119 if( !p.is_leaking() || p.ammo_remaining() <= 0 ) {
5120 continue;
5121 }
5122
5123 auto fuel = p.ammo_current();
5124 int qty = std::max( ( 0.5 - health ) * ( 0.5 - health ) * p.ammo_remaining() / 10, 1.0 );
5125 point q = coord_translate( p.mount );
5126 const tripoint dest = global_pos3() + tripoint( q, 0 );
5127
5128 if( fuel != fuel_type_battery && !g->m.inbounds( dest ) ) {
5129 // Don't try to leak off the edge of the world
5130 continue;
5131 }
5132
5133 // damaged batteries self-discharge without leaking, plutonium leaks slurry
5134 if( fuel != fuel_type_battery && fuel != fuel_type_plutonium_cell ) {
5135 item leak( fuel, calendar::turn, qty );
5136 g->m.add_item_or_charges( dest, leak );
5137 p.ammo_consume( qty, global_part_pos3( p ) );
5138 } else if( fuel == fuel_type_plutonium_cell ) {
5139 if( p.ammo_remaining() >= PLUTONIUM_CHARGES / 10 ) {
5140 item leak( "plut_slurry_dense", calendar::turn, qty );
5141 g->m.add_item_or_charges( dest, leak );
5142 p.ammo_consume( qty * PLUTONIUM_CHARGES / 10, global_part_pos3( p ) );
5143 } else {
5144 p.ammo_consume( p.ammo_remaining(), global_part_pos3( p ) );
5145 }
5146 } else {
5147 p.ammo_consume( qty, global_part_pos3( p ) );
5148 }
5149 }
5150}
5151
5152// total volume of all the things
5153units::volume vehicle::stored_volume( const int part ) const
5154{
5155 return get_items( part ).stored_volume();
5156}
5157
5158units::volume vehicle::max_volume( const int part ) const
5159{
5160 return get_items( part ).max_volume();
5161}
5162
5163units::volume vehicle::free_volume( const int part ) const
5164{
5165 return get_items( part ).free_volume();
5166}
5167
5168void vehicle::make_active( item_location &loc )
5169{
5170 item &target = *loc;
5171 if( !target.needs_processing() ) {
5172 return;
5173 }
5174 auto cargo_parts = get_parts_at( loc.position(), "CARGO", part_status_flag::any );
5175 if( cargo_parts.empty() ) {
5176 return;
5177 }
5178 // System insures that there is only one part in this vector.
5179 vehicle_part *cargo_part = cargo_parts.front();
5180 active_items.add( target, cargo_part->mount );
5181}
5182
5183int vehicle::add_charges( int part, const item &itm )
5184{
5185 if( !itm.count_by_charges() ) {
5186 debugmsg( "Add charges was called for an item not counted by charges!" );
5187 return 0;
5188 }
5189 const int ret = get_items( part ).amount_can_fit( itm );
5190 if( ret == 0 ) {
5191 return 0;
5192 }
5193
5194 item itm_copy = itm;
5195 itm_copy.charges = ret;
5196 return add_item( part, itm_copy ) ? ret : 0;
5197}
5198
5199cata::optional<vehicle_stack::iterator> vehicle::add_item( vehicle_part &pt, const item &obj )
5200{
5201 int idx = index_of_part( &pt );
5202 if( idx < 0 ) {
5203 debugmsg( "Tried to add item to invalid part" );
5204 return cata::nullopt;
5205 }
5206 return add_item( idx, obj );
5207}
5208
5209cata::optional<vehicle_stack::iterator> vehicle::add_item( int part, const item &itm )
5210{
5211 if( part < 0 || part >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
5212 debugmsg( "int part (%d) is out of range", part );
5213 return cata::nullopt;
5214 }
5215 // const int max_weight = ?! // TODO: weight limit, calculation per vpart & vehicle stats, not a hard user limit.
5216 // add creaking sounds and damage to overloaded vpart, outright break it past a certain point, or when hitting bumps etc
5217 vehicle_part &p = parts[ part ];
5218 if( p.is_broken() ) {
5219 return cata::nullopt;
5220 }
5221
5222 if( p.base.is_gun() ) {
5223 if( !itm.is_ammo() || !p.base.ammo_types().count( itm.ammo_type() ) ) {
5224 return cata::nullopt;
5225 }
5226 }
5227 bool charge = itm.count_by_charges();
5228 vehicle_stack istack = get_items( part );
5229 const int to_move = istack.amount_can_fit( itm );
5230 if( to_move == 0 || ( charge && to_move < itm.charges ) ) {
5231 return cata::nullopt; // @add_charges should be used in the latter case
5232 }
5233 if( charge ) {
5234 item *here = istack.stacks_with( itm );
5235 if( here ) {
5236 invalidate_mass();
5237 if( !here->merge_charges( itm ) ) {
5238 return cata::nullopt;
5239 } else {
5240 return cata::optional<vehicle_stack::iterator>( istack.get_iterator_from_pointer( here ) );
5241 }
5242 }
5243 }
5244
5245 item itm_copy = itm;
5246
5247 if( itm_copy.is_bucket_nonempty() ) {
5248 itm_copy.contents.spill_contents( global_part_pos3( part ) );
5249 }
5250
5251 const vehicle_stack::iterator new_pos = p.items.insert( itm_copy );
5252 if( itm_copy.needs_processing() ) {
5253 active_items.add( *new_pos, p.mount );
5254 }
5255
5256 invalidate_mass();
5257 return cata::optional<vehicle_stack::iterator>( new_pos );
5258}
5259
5260bool vehicle::remove_item( int part, item *it )
5261{
5262 const cata::colony<item> &veh_items = parts[part].items;
5263 const cata::colony<item>::const_iterator iter = veh_items.get_iterator_from_pointer( it );
5264 if( iter == veh_items.end() ) {
5265 return false;
5266 }
5267 remove_item( part, iter );
5268 return true;
5269}
5270
5271vehicle_stack::iterator vehicle::remove_item( int part, vehicle_stack::const_iterator it )
5272{
5273 cata::colony<item> &veh_items = parts[part].items;
5274
5275 // remove from the active items cache (if it isn't there does nothing)
5276 active_items.remove( &*it );
5277
5278 invalidate_mass();
5279 return veh_items.erase( it );
5280}
5281
5282vehicle_stack vehicle::get_items( const int part )
5283{
5284 const tripoint pos = global_part_pos3( part );
5285 return vehicle_stack( &parts[part].items, pos.xy(), this, part );
5286}
5287
5288vehicle_stack vehicle::get_items( const int part ) const
5289{
5290 // HACK: callers could modify items through this
5291 // TODO: a const version of vehicle_stack is needed
5292 return const_cast<vehicle *>( this )->get_items( part );
5293}
5294
5295void vehicle::place_spawn_items()
5296{
5297 if( !type.is_valid() ) {
5298 return;
5299 }
5300
5301 for( const auto &pt : type->parts ) {
5302 if( pt.with_ammo ) {
5303 int turret = part_with_feature( pt.pos, "TURRET", true );
5304 if( turret >= 0 && x_in_y( pt.with_ammo, 100 ) ) {
5305 parts[ turret ].ammo_set( random_entry( pt.ammo_types ), rng( pt.ammo_qty.first,
5306 pt.ammo_qty.second ) );
5307 }
5308 }
5309 }
5310
5311 for( const auto &spawn : type.obj().item_spawns ) {
5312 if( rng( 1, 100 ) <= spawn.chance ) {
5313 int part = part_with_feature( spawn.pos, "CARGO", false );
5314 if( part < 0 ) {
5315 debugmsg( "No CARGO parts at (%d, %d) of %s!", spawn.pos.x, spawn.pos.y, name );
5316
5317 } else {
5318 // if vehicle part is broken only 50% of items spawn and they will be variably damaged
5319 bool broken = parts[ part ].is_broken();
5320 if( broken && one_in( 2 ) ) {
5321 continue;
5322 }
5323
5324 std::vector<item> created;
5325 for( const itype_id &e : spawn.item_ids ) {
5326 created.emplace_back( item( e ).in_its_container() );
5327 }
5328 for( const item_group_id &e : spawn.item_groups ) {
5329 item_group::ItemList group_items = item_group::items_from( e, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
5330 for( auto spawn_item : group_items ) {
5331 created.emplace_back( spawn_item );
5332 }
5333 }
5334
5335 for( item &e : created ) {
5336 if( e.is_null() ) {
5337 continue;
5338 }
5339 if( broken && e.mod_damage( rng( 1, e.max_damage() ) ) ) {
5340 continue; // we destroyed the item
5341 }
5342 if( e.is_tool() || e.is_gun() || e.is_magazine() ) {
5343 bool spawn_ammo = rng( 0, 99 ) < spawn.with_ammo && e.ammo_remaining() == 0;
5344 bool spawn_mag = rng( 0, 99 ) < spawn.with_magazine && !e.magazine_integral() &&
5345 !e.magazine_current();
5346
5347 if( spawn_mag ) {
5348 e.put_in( item( e.magazine_default(), e.birthday() ) );
5349 }
5350 if( spawn_ammo ) {
5351 e.ammo_set( e.ammo_default() );
5352 }
5353 }
5354 add_item( part, e );
5355 }
5356 }
5357 }
5358 }
5359}
5360
5361void vehicle::gain_moves()
5362{
5363 fuel_used_last_turn.clear();
5364 check_falling_or_floating();
5365 const bool pl_control = player_in_control( g->u );
5366 if( is_moving() || is_falling ) {
5367 if( !loose_parts.empty() ) {
5368 shed_loose_parts();
5369 }
5370 of_turn = 1 + of_turn_carry;
5371 const int vslowdown = slowdown( velocity );
5372 if( vslowdown > std::abs( velocity ) ) {
5373 if( cruise_on && cruise_velocity && pl_control ) {
5374 velocity = velocity > 0 ? 1 : -1;
5375 } else {
5376 stop();
5377 }
5378 } else if( velocity < 0 ) {
5379 velocity += vslowdown;
5380 } else {
5381 velocity -= vslowdown;
5382 }
5383 is_on_ramp = false;
5384 } else {
5385 of_turn = .001;
5386 }
5387 of_turn_carry = 0;
5388 // cruise control TODO: enable for NPC?
5389 if( ( pl_control || is_following || is_patrolling ) && cruise_on && cruise_velocity != velocity ) {
5390 thrust( ( cruise_velocity ) > velocity ? 1 : -1 );
5391 }
5392
5393 // Force off-map vehicles to load by visiting them every time we gain moves.
5394 // Shouldn't be too expensive if there aren't fifty trillion vehicles in the graph...
5395 // ...and if there are, it's the player's fault for putting them there.
5396 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, distribution_graph::noop_visitor_veh,
5397 distribution_graph::noop_visitor_grid );
5398
5399 if( check_environmental_effects ) {
5400 check_environmental_effects = do_environmental_effects();
5401 }
5402
5403 // turrets which are enabled will try to reload and then automatically fire
5404 // Turrets which are disabled but have targets set are a special case
5405 for( auto e : turrets() ) {
5406 if( e->enabled || e->target.second != e->target.first ) {
5407 automatic_fire_turret( *e );
5408 }
5409 }
5410
5411 if( velocity < 0 ) {
5412 beeper_sound();
5413 }
5414}
5415
5416void vehicle::dump_items_from_part( const size_t index )
5417{
5418 vehicle_part &vp = parts[ index ];
5419 for( item &e : vp.items ) {
5420 g->m.add_item_or_charges( global_part_pos3( vp ), e );
5421 }
5422 vp.items.clear();
5423}
5424
5425bool vehicle::decrement_summon_timer()
5426{
5427 if( !summon_time_limit ) {
5428 return false;
5429 }
5430 if( *summon_time_limit <= 0_turns ) {
5431 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
5432 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
5433 dump_items_from_part( p );
5434 }
5435 if( g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
5436 add_msg( m_info, _( "Your %s winks out of existence." ), name );
5437 }
5438 g->m.destroy_vehicle( this );
5439 return true;
5440 } else {
5441 *summon_time_limit -= 1_turns;
5442 }
5443 return false;
5444}
5445
5446void vehicle::suspend_refresh()
5447{
5448 // disable refresh and cache recalculation
5449 no_refresh = true;
5450 mass_dirty = false;
5451 mass_center_precalc_dirty = false;
5452 mass_center_no_precalc_dirty = false;
5453 coeff_rolling_dirty = false;
5454 coeff_air_dirty = false;
5455 coeff_water_dirty = false;
5456 coeff_air_changed = false;
5457}
5458
5459void vehicle::enable_refresh()
5460{
5461 // force all caches to recalculate
5462 no_refresh = false;
5463 mass_dirty = true;
5464 mass_center_precalc_dirty = true;
5465 mass_center_no_precalc_dirty = true;
5466 coeff_rolling_dirty = true;
5467 coeff_air_dirty = true;
5468 coeff_water_dirty = true;
5469 coeff_air_changed = true;
5470 refresh();
5471}
5472
5473/**
5474 * Refreshes all caches and refinds all parts. Used after the vehicle has had a part added or removed.
5475 * Makes indices of different part types so they're easy to find. Also calculates power drain.
5476 */
5477void vehicle::refresh()
5478{
5479 if( no_refresh ) {
5480 return;
5481 }
5482
5483 alternators.clear();
5484 engines.clear();
5485 reactors.clear();
5486 solar_panels.clear();
5487 wind_turbines.clear();
5488 sails.clear();
5489 water_wheels.clear();
5490 funnels.clear();
5491 emitters.clear();
5492 relative_parts.clear();
5493 loose_parts.clear();
5494 wheelcache.clear();
5495 rail_wheelcache.clear();
5496 rotors.clear();
5497 steering.clear();
5498 speciality.clear();
5499 floating.clear();
5500 alternator_load = 0;
5501 extra_drag = 0;
5502 rail_profile.clear();
5503
5504 // Used to sort part list so it displays properly when examining
5505 struct sort_veh_part_vector {
5506 vehicle *veh;
5507 inline bool operator()( const int p1, const int p2 ) {
5508 return veh->part_info( p1 ).list_order < veh->part_info( p2 ).list_order;
5509 }
5510 } svpv = { this };
5511
5512 mount_min.x = 123;
5513 mount_min.y = 123;
5514 mount_max.x = -123;
5515 mount_max.y = -123;
5516
5517 bool refresh_done = false;
5518
5519 // Main loop over all vehicle parts.
5520 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
5521 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
5522 const vpart_info &vpi = vp.info();
5523 if( vp.part().removed ) {
5524 continue;
5525 }
5526 refresh_done = true;
5527
5528 // Build map of point -> all parts in that point
5529 const point pt = vp.mount();
5530 mount_min.x = std::min( mount_min.x, pt.x );
5531 mount_min.y = std::min( mount_min.y, pt.y );
5532 mount_max.x = std::max( mount_max.x, pt.x );
5533 mount_max.y = std::max( mount_max.y, pt.y );
5534
5535 // This will keep the parts at point pt sorted
5536 std::vector<int>::iterator vii = std::lower_bound( relative_parts[pt].begin(),
5537 relative_parts[pt].end(),
5538 static_cast<int>( p ), svpv );
5539 relative_parts[pt].insert( vii, p );
5540
5541 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_FLOATS ) ) {
5542 floating.push_back( p );
5543 }
5544
5545 if( vp.part().is_unavailable() ) {
5546 continue;
5547 }
5548 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_ALTERNATOR ) ) {
5549 alternators.push_back( p );
5550 }
5551 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_ENGINE ) ) {
5552 engines.push_back( p );
5553 }
5554 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_REACTOR ) ) {
5555 reactors.push_back( p );
5556 }
5557 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_SOLAR_PANEL ) ) {
5558 solar_panels.push_back( p );
5559 }
5560 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_ROTOR ) ) {
5561 rotors.push_back( p );
5562 }
5563 if( vpi.has_flag( "WIND_TURBINE" ) ) {
5564 wind_turbines.push_back( p );
5565 }
5566 if( vpi.has_flag( "WIND_POWERED" ) ) {
5567 sails.push_back( p );
5568 }
5569 if( vpi.has_flag( "WATER_WHEEL" ) ) {
5570 water_wheels.push_back( p );
5571 }
5572 if( vpi.has_flag( "FUNNEL" ) ) {
5573 funnels.push_back( p );
5574 }
5575 if( vpi.has_flag( "UNMOUNT_ON_MOVE" ) ) {
5576 loose_parts.push_back( p );
5577 }
5578 if( vpi.has_flag( "EMITTER" ) ) {
5579 emitters.push_back( p );
5580 }
5581 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_WHEEL ) ) {
5582 wheelcache.push_back( p );
5583 }
5584 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_RAIL ) ) {
5585 rail_wheelcache.push_back( p );
5586
5587 const int rail_pos = vp.mount().y;
5588 const auto it = std::find( rail_profile.cbegin(), rail_profile.cend(), rail_pos );
5589 if( it == rail_profile.cend() ) {
5590 rail_profile.push_back( rail_pos );
5591 }
5592 }
5593 if( ( vpi.has_flag( "STEERABLE" ) && part_with_feature( pt, "STEERABLE", true ) != -1 ) ||
5594 vpi.has_flag( "TRACKED" ) ) {
5595 // TRACKED contributes to steering effectiveness but
5596 // (a) doesn't count as a steering axle for install difficulty
5597 // (b) still contributes to drag for the center of steering calculation
5598 steering.push_back( p );
5599 }
5600 if( vpi.has_flag( "SECURITY" ) ) {
5601 speciality.push_back( p );
5602 }
5603 if( vp.part().enabled && vpi.has_flag( "EXTRA_DRAG" ) ) {
5604 extra_drag += vpi.power;
5605 }
5606 if( vpi.has_flag( "EXTRA_DRAG" ) && ( vpi.has_flag( "WIND_TURBINE" ) ||
5607 vpi.has_flag( "WATER_WHEEL" ) ) ) {
5608 extra_drag += vpi.power;
5609 }
5610 if( camera_on && vpi.has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
5611 vp.part().enabled = true;
5612 } else if( !camera_on && vpi.has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
5613 vp.part().enabled = false;
5614 }
5615 if( vpi.has_flag( "TURRET" ) && !has_part( global_part_pos3( vp.part() ), "TURRET_CONTROLS" ) ) {
5616 vp.part().enabled = false;
5617 }
5618 }
5619
5620 front_left.x = mount_max.x;
5621 front_left.y = mount_min.y;
5622 front_right = mount_max;
5623
5624 if( !refresh_done ) {
5625 mount_min = mount_max = point_zero;
5626 }
5627
5628 // NB: using the _old_ pivot point, don't recalc here, we only do that when moving!
5629 precalc_mounts( 0, pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[0] );
5630 check_environmental_effects = true;
5631 insides_dirty = true;
5632 zones_dirty = true;
5633 invalidate_mass();
5634}
5635
5636const point &vehicle::pivot_point() const
5637{
5638 if( pivot_dirty ) {
5639 refresh_pivot();
5640 }
5641
5642 return pivot_cache;
5643}
5644
5645void vehicle::refresh_pivot() const
5646{
5647 // Const method, but messes with mutable fields
5648 pivot_dirty = false;
5649
5650 if( wheelcache.empty() || !valid_wheel_config() ) {
5651 // No usable wheels, use CoM (dragging)
5652 pivot_cache = local_center_of_mass();
5653 return;
5654 }
5655
5656 // The model here is:
5657 //
5658 // We are trying to rotate around some point (xc,yc)
5659 // This produces a friction force / moment from each wheel resisting the
5660 // rotation. We want to find the point that minimizes that resistance.
5661 //
5662 // For a given wheel w at (xw,yw), find:
5663 // weight(w): a scaling factor for the friction force based on wheel
5664 // size, brokenness, steerability/orientation
5665 // center_dist: the distance from (xw,yw) to (xc,yc)
5666 // centerline_angle: the angle between the X axis and a line through
5667 // (xw,yw) and (xc,yc)
5668 //
5669 // Decompose the force into two components, assuming that the wheel is
5670 // aligned along the X axis and we want to apply different weightings to
5671 // the in-line vs perpendicular parts of the force:
5672 //
5673 // Resistance force in line with the wheel (X axis)
5674 // Fi = weightI(w) * center_dist * sin(centerline_angle)
5675 // Resistance force perpendicular to the wheel (Y axis):
5676 // Fp = weightP(w) * center_dist * cos(centerline_angle);
5677 //
5678 // Then find the moment that these two forces would apply around (xc,yc)
5679 // moment(w) = center_dist * cos(centerline_angle) * Fi +
5680 // center_dist * sin(centerline_angle) * Fp
5681 //
5682 // Note that:
5683 // cos(centerline_angle) = (xw-xc) / center_dist
5684 // sin(centerline_angle) = (yw-yc) / center_dist
5685 // -> moment(w) = weightP(w)*(xw-xc)^2 + weightI(w)*(yw-yc)^2
5686 // = weightP(w)*xc^2 - 2*weightP(w)*xc*xw + weightP(w)*xw^2 +
5687 // weightI(w)*yc^2 - 2*weightI(w)*yc*yw + weightI(w)*yw^2
5688 //
5689 // which happily means that the X and Y axes can be handled independently.
5690 // We want to minimize sum(moment(w)) due to wheels w=0,1,..., which
5691 // occurs when:
5692 //
5693 // sum( 2*xc*weightP(w) - 2*weightP(w)*xw ) = 0
5694 // -> xc = (weightP(0)*x0 + weightP(1)*x1 + ...) /
5695 // (weightP(0) + weightP(1) + ...)
5696 // sum( 2*yc*weightI(w) - 2*weightI(w)*yw ) = 0
5697 // -> yc = (weightI(0)*y0 + weightI(1)*y1 + ...) /
5698 // (weightI(0) + weightI(1) + ...)
5699 //
5700 // so it turns into a fairly simple weighted average of the wheel positions.
5701
5702 float xc_numerator = 0;
5703 float xc_denominator = 0;
5704 float yc_numerator = 0;
5705 float yc_denominator = 0;
5706
5707 for( int p : wheelcache ) {
5708 const auto &wheel = parts[p];
5709
5710 // TODO: load on tire?
5711 int contact_area = wheel.wheel_area();
5712 float weight_i; // weighting for the in-line part
5713 float weight_p; // weighting for the perpendicular part
5714 if( wheel.is_broken() ) {
5715 // broken wheels don't roll on either axis
5716 weight_i = contact_area * 2.0;
5717 weight_p = contact_area * 2.0;
5718 } else if( part_with_feature( wheel.mount, "STEERABLE", true ) != -1 ) {
5719 // Unbroken steerable wheels can handle motion on both axes
5720 // (but roll a little more easily inline)
5721 weight_i = contact_area * 0.1;
5722 weight_p = contact_area * 0.2;
5723 } else {
5724 // Regular wheels resist perpendicular motion
5725 weight_i = contact_area * 0.1;
5726 weight_p = contact_area;
5727 }
5728
5729 xc_numerator += weight_p * wheel.mount.x;
5730 yc_numerator += weight_i * wheel.mount.y;
5731 xc_denominator += weight_p;
5732 yc_denominator += weight_i;
5733 }
5734
5735 if( xc_denominator < 0.1 || yc_denominator < 0.1 ) {
5736 debugmsg( "vehicle::refresh_pivot had a bad weight: xc=%.3f/%.3f yc=%.3f/%.3f",
5737 xc_numerator, xc_denominator, yc_numerator, yc_denominator );
5738 pivot_cache = local_center_of_mass();
5739 } else {
5740 pivot_cache.x = std::round( xc_numerator / xc_denominator );
5741 pivot_cache.y = std::round( yc_numerator / yc_denominator );
5742 }
5743}
5744
5745void vehicle::do_towing_move()
5746{
5747 if( !no_towing_slack() || velocity <= 0 ) {
5748 return;
5749 }
5750 bool invalidate = false;
5751 if( !tow_data.get_towed() ) {
5752 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move, but no towed vehicle!" );
5753 invalidate = true;
5754 }
5755 const int tow_index = get_tow_part();
5756 if( tow_index == -1 ) {
5757 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move, but no tow part" );
5758 invalidate = true;
5759 }
5760 vehicle *towed_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
5761 if( !towed_veh ) {
5762 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move, but towed vehicle dosnt exist." );
5763 invalidate_towing();
5764 return;
5765 }
5766 const int other_tow_index = towed_veh->get_tow_part();
5767 if( other_tow_index == -1 ) {
5768 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move but towed vehicle has no towing part" );
5769 invalidate = true;
5770 }
5771 if( towed_veh->global_pos3().z != global_pos3().z ) {
5772 // how the hellicopter did this happen?
5773 // yes, this can happen when towing over a bridge (see #47293)
5774 invalidate = true;
5775 add_msg( m_info, _( "A towing cable snaps off of %s." ), tow_data.get_towed()->disp_name() );
5776 }
5777 if( invalidate ) {
5778 invalidate_towing( true );
5779 return;
5780 }
5781 const tripoint tower_tow_point = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( tow_index ) );
5782 const tripoint towed_tow_point = g->m.getabs( towed_veh->global_part_pos3( other_tow_index ) );
5783 // same as above, but where the pulling vehicle is pulling from
5784 units::angle towing_veh_angle = towed_veh->get_angle_from_targ( tower_tow_point );
5785 const bool reverse = towed_veh->tow_data.tow_direction == TOW_BACK;
5786 int accel_y = 0;
5787 tripoint vehpos = global_square_location().raw();
5788 int turn_x = get_turn_from_angle( towing_veh_angle, vehpos, tower_tow_point, reverse );
5789 if( rl_dist( towed_tow_point, tower_tow_point ) < 6 ) {
5790 accel_y = reverse ? -1 : 1;
5791 }
5792 if( towed_veh->velocity <= velocity && rl_dist( towed_tow_point, tower_tow_point ) >= 7 ) {
5793 accel_y = reverse ? 1 : -1;
5794 }
5795 if( rl_dist( towed_tow_point, tower_tow_point ) >= 12 ) {
5796 towed_veh->velocity = velocity * 1.8;
5797 if( reverse ) {
5798 towed_veh->velocity = -towed_veh->velocity;
5799 }
5800 } else {
5801 towed_veh->velocity = reverse ? -velocity : velocity;
5802 }
5803 if( towed_veh->tow_data.tow_direction == TOW_FRONT ) {
5804 towed_veh->selfdrive( point( turn_x, accel_y ) );
5805 } else if( towed_veh->tow_data.tow_direction == TOW_BACK ) {
5806 accel_y = 10;
5807 towed_veh->selfdrive( point( turn_x, accel_y ) );
5808 } else {
5809 towed_veh->skidding = true;
5810 std::vector<tripoint> lineto = line_to( g->m.getlocal( towed_tow_point ),
5811 g->m.getlocal( tower_tow_point ) );
5812 tripoint nearby_destination;
5813 if( lineto.size() >= 2 ) {
5814 nearby_destination = lineto[1];
5815 } else {
5816 nearby_destination = tower_tow_point;
5817 }
5818 const int destination_delta_x = g->m.getlocal( tower_tow_point ).x - nearby_destination.x;
5819 const int destination_delta_y = g->m.getlocal( tower_tow_point ).y - nearby_destination.y;
5820 const int destination_delta_z = towed_veh->global_pos3().z;
5821 const tripoint move_destination( clamp( destination_delta_x, -1, 1 ),
5822 clamp( destination_delta_y, -1, 1 ),
5823 clamp( destination_delta_z, -1, 1 ) );
5824 g->m.move_vehicle( *towed_veh, move_destination, towed_veh->face );
5825 towed_veh->move = tileray( point( destination_delta_x, destination_delta_y ) );
5826 }
5827
5828}
5829
5830bool vehicle::is_external_part( const tripoint &part_pt ) const
5831{
5832 for( const tripoint &elem : g->m.points_in_radius( part_pt, 1 ) ) {
5833 const optional_vpart_position vp = g->m.veh_at( elem );
5834 if( !vp ) {
5835 return true;
5836 }
5837 if( vp && &vp->vehicle() != this ) {
5838 return true;
5839 }
5840 }
5841 return false;
5842}
5843
5844bool vehicle::is_towing() const
5845{
5846 bool ret = false;
5847 if( !tow_data.get_towed() ) {
5848 return ret;
5849 } else {
5850 if( !tow_data.get_towed()->tow_data.get_towed_by() ) {
5851 debugmsg( "vehicle %s is towing, but the towed vehicle has no tower defined", name );
5852 return ret;
5853 }
5854 ret = true;
5855 }
5856 return ret;
5857}
5858
5859bool vehicle::is_towed() const
5860{
5861 bool ret = false;
5862 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by() ) {
5863 return ret;
5864 } else {
5865 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by()->tow_data.get_towed() ) {
5866 debugmsg( "vehicle %s is marked as towed, but the tower vehicle has no towed defined", name );
5867 return ret;
5868 }
5869 ret = true;
5870 }
5871 return ret;
5872}
5873
5874int vehicle::get_tow_part() const
5875{
5876 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
5877 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
5878 if( vp.part().removed ) {
5879 continue;
5880 }
5881
5882 if( part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true ) >= 0 && vp.part().is_available() ) {
5883 return p;
5884 }
5885 }
5886 return -1;
5887}
5888
5889bool vehicle::has_tow_attached() const
5890{
5891 bool ret = false;
5892 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
5893 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
5894 if( vp.part().removed ) {
5895 continue;
5896 }
5897
5898 if( part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true ) >= 0 && vp.part().is_available() ) {
5899 ret = true;
5900 break;
5901 }
5902 }
5903 return ret;
5904}
5905
5906void vehicle::set_tow_directions()
5907{
5908 const int length = mount_max.x - mount_min.x + 1;
5909 const point mount_of_tow = parts[get_tow_part()].mount;
5910 const point normalized_tow_mount = point( std::abs( mount_of_tow.x - mount_min.x ),
5911 std::abs( mount_of_tow.y - mount_min.y ) );
5912 if( length >= 3 ) {
5913 const int trisect = length / 3;
5914 if( normalized_tow_mount.x <= trisect ) {
5915 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_BACK;
5916 } else if( normalized_tow_mount.x > trisect && normalized_tow_mount.x <= trisect * 2 ) {
5917 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_SIDE;
5918 } else {
5919 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_FRONT;
5920 }
5921 } else {
5922 // its a small vehicle, no danger if it flips around.
5923 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_FRONT;
5924 }
5925}
5926
5927bool towing_data::set_towing( vehicle *tower_veh, vehicle *towed_veh )
5928{
5929 if( !towed_veh || !tower_veh ) {
5930 return false;
5931 }
5932 towed_veh->tow_data.towed_by = tower_veh;
5933 tower_veh->tow_data.towing = towed_veh;
5934 tower_veh->set_tow_directions();
5935 towed_veh->set_tow_directions();
5936 return true;
5937}
5938
5939void vehicle::invalidate_towing( bool first_vehicle )
5940{
5941 if( !is_towing() && !is_towed() ) {
5942 return;
5943 }
5944 vehicle *other_veh = nullptr;
5945 if( is_towing() ) {
5946 other_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
5947 } else if( is_towed() ) {
5948 other_veh = tow_data.get_towed_by();
5949 }
5950 if( other_veh && first_vehicle ) {
5951 other_veh->invalidate_towing();
5952 }
5953 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
5954 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
5955 if( vp.part().removed ) {
5956 continue;
5957 }
5958
5959 if( part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true ) >= 0 ) {
5960 if( first_vehicle ) {
5961 vehicle_part *part = &parts[part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true )];
5962 item drop = part->properties_to_item();
5963 g->m.add_item_or_charges( global_part_pos3( *part ), drop );
5964 }
5965 remove_part( part_with_feature( p, "TOW_CABLE", true ) );
5966 break;
5967 }
5968 }
5969 tow_data.clear_towing();
5970}
5971
5972// to be called on the towed vehicle
5973bool vehicle::tow_cable_too_far() const
5974{
5975 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by() ) {
5976 debugmsg( "checking tow cable length on a vehicle that has no towing vehicle" );
5977 return false;
5978 }
5979 int index = get_tow_part();
5980 if( index == -1 ) {
5981 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
5982 return false;
5983 }
5984 tripoint towing_point = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( index ) );
5985 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by()->tow_data.get_towed() ) {
5986 debugmsg( "vehicle %s has data for a towing vehicle, but that towing vehicle does not have %s listed as towed",
5987 disp_name(), disp_name() );
5988 return false;
5989 }
5990 int other_index = tow_data.get_towed_by()->get_tow_part();
5991 if( other_index == -1 ) {
5992 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
5993 return false;
5994 }
5995 tripoint towed_point = g->m.getabs( tow_data.get_towed_by()->global_part_pos3( other_index ) );
5996 if( towing_point == tripoint_zero || towed_point == tripoint_zero ) {
5997 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
5998 return false;
5999 }
6000 return rl_dist( towing_point, towed_point ) >= 25;
6001}
6002
6003// the towing cable only starts pulling at a certain distance between the vehicles
6004// to be called on the towing vehicle
6005bool vehicle::no_towing_slack() const
6006{
6007 if( !tow_data.get_towed() ) {
6008 return false;
6009 }
6010 int index = get_tow_part();
6011 if( index == -1 ) {
6012 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6013 return false;
6014 }
6015 tripoint towing_point = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( index ) );
6016 if( !tow_data.get_towed()->tow_data.get_towed_by() ) {
6017 debugmsg( "vehicle %s has data for a towed vehicle, but that towed vehicle does not have %s listed as tower",
6018 disp_name(), disp_name() );
6019 return false;
6020 }
6021 int other_index = tow_data.get_towed()->get_tow_part();
6022 if( other_index == -1 ) {
6023 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6024 return false;
6025 }
6026 tripoint towed_point = g->m.getabs( tow_data.get_towed()->global_part_pos3( other_index ) );
6027 if( towing_point == tripoint_zero || towed_point == tripoint_zero ) {
6028 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6029 return false;
6030 }
6031 return rl_dist( towing_point, towed_point ) >= 8;
6032
6033}
6034
6035void vehicle::remove_remote_part( int part_num )
6036{
6037 if( parts[part_num].has_flag( vehicle_part::targets_grid ) ) {
6038 vehicle_connector_tile *connector =
6039 active_tiles::furn_at<vehicle_connector_tile>( tripoint_abs_ms( parts[part_num].target.second ) );
6040 if( connector != nullptr ) {
6041 auto &vehs = connector->connected_vehicles;
6042 auto iter = std::find( vehs.begin(), vehs.end(), tripoint_abs_ms( g->m.getabs( global_pos3() ) ) );
6043 if( iter != vehs.end() ) {
6044 vehs.erase( iter );
6045 }
6046 }
6047 return;
6048 }
6049 auto veh = find_vehicle( parts[part_num].target.second );
6050
6051 // If the target vehicle is still there, ask it to remove its part
6052 if( veh != nullptr ) {
6053 const tripoint local_abs = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( part_num ) );
6054
6055 for( size_t j = 0; j < veh->loose_parts.size(); j++ ) {
6056 int remote_partnum = veh->loose_parts[j];
6057 auto remote_part = &veh->parts[remote_partnum];
6058
6059 if( veh->part_flag( remote_partnum, "POWER_TRANSFER" ) && remote_part->target.first == local_abs ) {
6060 veh->remove_part( remote_partnum );
6061 return;
6062 }
6063 }
6064 }
6065}
6066
6067void vehicle::shed_loose_parts()
6068{
6069 // remove_part rebuilds the loose_parts vector, when all of those parts have been removed,
6070 // it will stay empty.
6071 while( !loose_parts.empty() ) {
6072 const int elem = loose_parts.front();
6073 if( part_flag( elem, "POWER_TRANSFER" ) ) {
6074 remove_remote_part( elem );
6075 }
6076 if( is_towing() || is_towed() ) {
6077 vehicle *other_veh = is_towing() ? tow_data.get_towed() : tow_data.get_towed_by();
6078 if( other_veh ) {
6079 other_veh->remove_part( other_veh->part_with_feature( other_veh->get_tow_part(), "TOW_CABLE",
6080 true ) );
6081 other_veh->tow_data.clear_towing();
6082 }
6083 tow_data.clear_towing();
6084 }
6085 auto part = &parts[elem];
6086 item drop = part->properties_to_item();
6087 if( !magic ) {
6088 g->m.add_item_or_charges( global_part_pos3( *part ), drop );
6089 }
6090
6091 remove_part( elem );
6092 }
6093}
6094
6095bool vehicle::enclosed_at( const tripoint &pos )
6096{
6097 refresh_insides();
6098 std::vector<vehicle_part *> parts_here = get_parts_at( pos, "BOARDABLE",
6099 part_status_flag::working );
6100 if( !parts_here.empty() ) {
6101 return parts_here.front()->inside;
6102 }
6103 return false;
6104}
6105
6106void vehicle::refresh_insides()
6107{
6108 if( !insides_dirty ) {
6109 return;
6110 }
6111 insides_dirty = false;
6112 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6113 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
6114 if( vp.part().removed ) {
6115 continue;
6116 }
6117 /* If there's no roof, or there is a roof but it's broken, it's outside.
6118 * (Use short-circuiting && so broken frames don't screw this up) */
6119 if( !( part_with_feature( p, "ROOF", true ) >= 0 && vp.part().is_available() ) ) {
6120 vp.part().inside = false;
6121 continue;
6122 }
6123
6124 // inside if not otherwise
6125 parts[p].inside = true;
6126 // let's check four neighbor parts
6127 for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
6128 point near_mount = parts[ p ].mount + offset;
6129 std::vector<int> parts_n3ar = parts_at_relative( near_mount, true );
6130 // if we aren't covered from sides, the roof at p won't save us
6131 bool cover = false;
6132 for( auto &j : parts_n3ar ) {
6133 // another roof -- cover
6134 if( part_flag( j, "ROOF" ) && parts[ j ].is_available() ) {
6135 cover = true;
6136 break;
6137 } else if( part_flag( j, "OBSTACLE" ) && parts[ j ].is_available() ) {
6138 // found an obstacle, like board or windshield or door
6139 if( parts[j].inside || ( part_flag( j, "OPENABLE" ) && parts[j].open ) ) {
6140 // door and it's open -- can't cover
6141 continue;
6142 }
6143 cover = true;
6144 break;
6145 }
6146 //Otherwise keep looking, there might be another part in that square
6147 }
6148 if( !cover ) {
6149 vp.part().inside = false;
6150 break;
6151 }
6152 }
6153 }
6154}
6155
6156bool vpart_position::is_inside() const
6157{
6158 // TODO: this is a bit of a hack as refresh_insides has side effects
6159 // this should be called elsewhere and not in a function that intends to just query
6160 // it's also a no-op if the insides are up to date.
6161 vehicle().refresh_insides();
6162 return vehicle().part( part_index() ).inside;
6163}
6164
6165void vehicle::unboard_all()
6166{
6167 std::vector<int> bp = boarded_parts();
6168 for( auto &i : bp ) {
6169 g->m.unboard_vehicle( global_part_pos3( i ) );
6170 }
6171}
6172
6173int vehicle::damage( int p, int dmg, damage_type type, bool aimed )
6174{
6175 if( dmg < 1 ) {
6176 return dmg;
6177 }
6178
6179 std::vector<int> pl = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
6180 if( pl.empty() ) {
6181 // We ran out of non removed parts at this location already.
6182 return dmg;
6183 }
6184
6185 if( !aimed ) {
6186 bool found_obs = false;
6187 for( auto &i : pl ) {
6188 if( part_flag( i, "OBSTACLE" ) &&
6189 ( !part_flag( i, "OPENABLE" ) || !parts[i].open ) ) {
6190 found_obs = true;
6191 break;
6192 }
6193 }
6194
6195 if( !found_obs ) { // not aimed at this tile and no obstacle here -- fly through
6196 return dmg;
6197 }
6198 }
6199
6200 int target_part = part_info( p ).rotor_diameter() ? p : random_entry( pl );
6201
6202 // door motor mechanism is protected by closed doors
6203 if( part_flag( target_part, "DOOR_MOTOR" ) ) {
6204 // find the most strong openable that is not open
6205 int strongest_door_part = -1;
6206 int strongest_door_durability = INT_MIN;
6207 for( int part : pl ) {
6208 if( part_flag( part, "OPENABLE" ) && !parts[part].open ) {
6209 int door_durability = part_info( part ).durability;
6210 if( door_durability > strongest_door_durability ) {
6211 strongest_door_part = part;
6212 strongest_door_durability = door_durability;
6213 }
6214 }
6215 }
6216
6217 // if we found a closed door, target it instead of the door_motor
6218 if( strongest_door_part != -1 ) {
6219 target_part = strongest_door_part;
6220 }
6221 }
6222
6223 int damage_dealt;
6224
6225 int armor_part = part_with_feature( p, "ARMOR", true );
6226 if( armor_part < 0 ) {
6227 // Not covered by armor -- damage part
6228 damage_dealt = damage_direct( target_part, dmg, type );
6229 } else {
6230 // Covered by armor -- hit both armor and part, but reduce damage by armor's reduction
6231 int protection = part_info( armor_part ).damage_reduction[ type ];
6232 // Parts on roof aren't protected
6233 bool overhead = part_flag( target_part, "ROOF" ) || part_info( target_part ).location == "on_roof";
6234 // Calling damage_direct may remove the damaged part
6235 // completely, therefore the other index (target_part) becomes
6236 // wrong if target_part > armor_part.
6237 // Damaging the part with the higher index first is save,
6238 // as removing a part only changes indices after the
6239 // removed part.
6240 if( armor_part < target_part ) {
6241 damage_direct( target_part, overhead ? dmg : dmg - protection, type );
6242 damage_dealt = damage_direct( armor_part, dmg, type );
6243 } else {
6244 damage_dealt = damage_direct( armor_part, dmg, type );
6245 damage_direct( target_part, overhead ? dmg : dmg - protection, type );
6246 }
6247 }
6248
6249 return damage_dealt;
6250}
6251
6252void vehicle::damage_all( int dmg1, int dmg2, damage_type type, const point &impact )
6253{
6254 if( dmg2 < dmg1 ) {
6255 std::swap( dmg1, dmg2 );
6256 }
6257
6258 if( dmg1 < 1 ) {
6259 return;
6260 }
6261
6262 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6263 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
6264 int distance = 1 + square_dist( vp.mount(), impact );
6265 if( distance > 1 && part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure &&
6266 !part_info( p ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
6267 damage_direct( p, rng( dmg1, dmg2 ) / ( distance * distance ), type );
6268 }
6269 }
6270}
6271
6272/**
6273 * Shifts all parts of the vehicle by the given amounts, and then shifts the
6274 * vehicle itself in the opposite direction. The end result is that the vehicle
6275 * appears to have not moved. Useful for re-zeroing a vehicle to ensure that a
6276 * (0, 0) part is always present.
6277 * @param delta How much to shift along each axis
6278 */
6279void vehicle::shift_parts( const point &delta )
6280{
6281 // Don't invalidate the active item cache's location!
6282 active_items.subtract_locations( delta );
6283 for( auto &elem : parts ) {
6284 elem.mount -= delta;
6285 }
6286
6287 decltype( labels ) new_labels;
6288 for( auto &l : labels ) {
6289 new_labels.insert( label( l - delta, l.text ) );
6290 }
6291 labels = new_labels;
6292
6293 decltype( loot_zones ) new_zones;
6294 for( auto const &z : loot_zones ) {
6295 new_zones.emplace( z.first - delta, z.second );
6296 }
6297 loot_zones = new_zones;
6298
6299 pivot_anchor[0] -= delta;
6300 refresh();
6301 //Need to also update the map after this
6302 g->m.reset_vehicle_cache( sm_pos.z );
6303}
6304
6305/**
6306 * Detect if the vehicle is currently missing a 0,0 part, and
6307 * adjust if necessary.
6308 * @return bool true if the shift was needed.
6309 */
6310bool vehicle::shift_if_needed()
6311{
6312 std::vector<int> vehicle_origin = parts_at_relative( point_zero, true );
6313 if( !vehicle_origin.empty() && !parts[ vehicle_origin[ 0 ] ].removed ) {
6314 // Shifting is not needed.
6315 return false;
6316 }
6317 //Find a frame, any frame, to shift to
6318 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6319 if( vp.info().location == "structure"
6320 && !vp.has_feature( "PROTRUSION" )
6321 && !vp.part().removed ) {
6322 shift_parts( vp.mount() );
6323 refresh();
6324 return true;
6325 }
6326 }
6327 // There are only parts with PROTRUSION left, choose one of them.
6328 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6329 if( !vp.part().removed ) {
6330 shift_parts( vp.mount() );
6331 refresh();
6332 return true;
6333 }
6334 }
6335 return false;
6336}
6337
6338int vehicle::break_off( int p, int dmg )
6339{
6340 /* Already-destroyed part - chance it could be torn off into pieces.
6341 * Chance increases with damage, and decreases with part max durability
6342 * (so lights, etc are easily removed; frames and plating not so much) */
6343 if( rng( 0, part_info( p ).durability / 10 ) >= dmg ) {
6344 return dmg;
6345 }
6346 const tripoint pos = global_part_pos3( p );
6347 const auto scatter_parts = [&]( const vehicle_part & pt ) {
6348 for( const item &piece : pt.pieces_for_broken_part() ) {
6349 // inside the loop, so each piece goes to a different place
6350 // TODO: this may spawn items behind a wall
6351 const tripoint where = random_entry( g->m.points_in_radius( pos, SCATTER_DISTANCE ) );
6352 // TODO: balance audit, ensure that less pieces are generated than one would need
6353 // to build the component (smash a vehicle box that took 10 lumps of steel,
6354 // find 12 steel lumps scattered after atom-smashing it with a tree trunk)
6355 if( !magic ) {
6356 g->m.add_item_or_charges( where, piece );
6357 }
6358 }
6359 };
6360 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure ) {
6361 // For structural parts, remove other parts first
6362 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
6363 for( int index = parts_in_square.size() - 1; index >= 0; index-- ) {
6364 // Ignore the frame being destroyed
6365 if( parts_in_square[index] == p ) {
6366 continue;
6367 }
6368
6369 if( parts[ parts_in_square[ index ] ].is_broken() ) {
6370 // Tearing off a broken part - break it up
6371 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6372 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %s's %s breaks into pieces!" ), name,
6373 parts[ parts_in_square[ index ] ].name() );
6374 }
6375 scatter_parts( parts[parts_in_square[index]] );
6376 } else {
6377 // Intact (but possibly damaged) part - remove it in one piece
6378 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6379 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s is torn off!" ), name,
6380 parts[ parts_in_square[ index ] ].name() );
6381 }
6382 item part_as_item = parts[parts_in_square[index]].properties_to_item();
6383 if( !magic ) {
6384 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos, part_as_item );
6385 }
6386 }
6387 remove_part( parts_in_square[index] );
6388 }
6389 // After clearing the frame, remove it.
6390 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6391 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s is destroyed!" ), name, parts[ p ].name() );
6392 }
6393 scatter_parts( parts[p] );
6394 remove_part( p );
6395 find_and_split_vehicles( p );
6396 } else {
6397 //Just break it off
6398 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6399 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s is destroyed!" ), name, parts[ p ].name() );
6400 }
6401
6402 scatter_parts( parts[p] );
6403 remove_part( p );
6404 }
6405
6406 return dmg;
6407}
6408
6409bool vehicle::explode_fuel( int p, damage_type type )
6410{
6411 const itype_id &ft = part_info( p ).fuel_type;
6412 item fuel = item( ft );
6413 if( !fuel.has_explosion_data() ) {
6414 return false;
6415 }
6416 fuel_explosion data = fuel.get_explosion_data();
6417
6418 if( parts[ p ].is_broken() ) {
6419 leak_fuel( parts[ p ] );
6420 }
6421
6422 int explosion_chance = type == DT_HEAT ? data.explosion_chance_hot : data.explosion_chance_cold;
6423 if( one_in( explosion_chance ) ) {
6424 g->events().send<event_type::fuel_tank_explodes>( name );
6425 const int pow = 120 * ( 1 - std::exp( data.explosion_factor / -5000 *
6426 ( parts[p].ammo_remaining() * data.fuel_size_factor ) ) );
6427 //debugmsg( "damage check dmg=%d pow=%d amount=%d", dmg, pow, parts[p].amount );
6428
6429 explosion_handler::explosion( global_part_pos3( p ), pow, 0.7, data.fiery_explosion );
6430 mod_hp( parts[p], 0 - parts[ p ].hp(), DT_HEAT );
6431 parts[p].ammo_unset();
6432 }
6433
6434 return true;
6435}
6436
6437int vehicle::damage_direct( int p, int dmg, damage_type type )
6438{
6439 // Make sure p is within range and hasn't been removed already
6440 if( ( static_cast<size_t>( p ) >= parts.size() ) || parts[p].removed ) {
6441 return dmg;
6442 }
6443 // If auto-driving and damage happens, bail out
6444 if( is_autodriving ) {
6445 stop_autodriving();
6446 }
6447 g->m.set_memory_seen_cache_dirty( global_part_pos3( p ) );
6448 if( parts[p].is_broken() ) {
6449 return break_off( p, dmg );
6450 }
6451
6452 int tsh = std::min( 20, part_info( p ).durability / 10 );
6453 if( dmg < tsh && type != DT_TRUE ) {
6454 if( type == DT_HEAT && parts[p].is_fuel_store() ) {
6455 explode_fuel( p, type );
6456 }
6457
6458 return 0;
6459 }
6460
6461 dmg -= std::min<int>( dmg, part_info( p ).damage_reduction[ type ] );
6462 int dres = dmg - parts[p].hp();
6463 if( mod_hp( parts[ p ], 0 - dmg, type ) ) {
6464 insides_dirty = true;
6465 pivot_dirty = true;
6466
6467 // destroyed parts lose any contained fuels, battery charges or ammo
6468 leak_fuel( parts [ p ] );
6469
6470 for( const auto &e : parts[p].items ) {
6471 g->m.add_item_or_charges( global_part_pos3( p ), e );
6472 }
6473 parts[p].items.clear();
6474
6475 invalidate_mass();
6476 coeff_air_changed = true;
6477
6478 // refresh cache in case the broken part has changed the status
6479 refresh();
6480 }
6481
6482 if( parts[p].is_fuel_store() ) {
6483 explode_fuel( p, type );
6484 } else if( parts[ p ].is_broken() && part_flag( p, "UNMOUNT_ON_DAMAGE" ) ) {
6485 g->m.spawn_item( global_part_pos3( p ), part_info( p ).item, 1, 0, calendar::turn );
6486 monster *mon = get_pet( p );
6487 if( mon != nullptr && mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
6488 mon->remove_effect( effect_harnessed );
6489 }
6490 if( part_flag( p, "TOW_CABLE" ) ) {
6491 invalidate_towing( true );
6492 } else {
6493 remove_part( p );
6494 }
6495 }
6496
6497 return std::max( dres, 0 );
6498}
6499
6500void vehicle::leak_fuel( vehicle_part &pt )
6501{
6502 // only liquid fuels from non-empty tanks can leak out onto map tiles
6503 if( !pt.is_tank() || pt.ammo_remaining() <= 0 ) {
6504 return;
6505 }
6506
6507 // leak in random directions but prefer closest tiles and avoid walls or other obstacles
6508 std::vector<tripoint> tiles = closest_points_first( global_part_pos3( pt ), 1 );
6509 tiles.erase( std::remove_if( tiles.begin(), tiles.end(), []( const tripoint & e ) {
6510 return !g->m.passable( e );
6511 } ), tiles.end() );
6512
6513 // leak up to 1/3 of remaining fuel per iteration and continue until the part is empty
6514 const itype *fuel = &*pt.ammo_current();
6515 while( !tiles.empty() && pt.ammo_remaining() ) {
6516 int qty = pt.ammo_consume( rng( 0, std::max( pt.ammo_remaining() / 3, 1 ) ),
6517 global_part_pos3( pt ) );
6518 if( qty > 0 ) {
6519 g->m.add_item_or_charges( random_entry( tiles ), item( fuel, calendar::turn, qty ) );
6520 }
6521 }
6522
6523 pt.ammo_unset();
6524}
6525
6526std::map<itype_id, int> vehicle::fuels_left() const
6527{
6528 std::map<itype_id, int> result;
6529 for( const auto &p : parts ) {
6530 if( p.is_fuel_store() && !p.ammo_current().is_null() ) {
6531 result[ p.ammo_current() ] += p.ammo_remaining();
6532 }
6533 }
6534 return result;
6535}
6536
6537bool vehicle::is_foldable() const
6538{
6539 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6540 if( !vp.has_feature( "FOLDABLE" ) ) {
6541 return false;
6542 }
6543 }
6544 return true;
6545}
6546
6547bool vehicle::restore( const std::string &data )
6548{
6549 std::istringstream veh_data( data );
6550 try {
6551 JsonIn json( veh_data );
6552 parts.clear();
6553 json.read( parts );
6554 } catch( const JsonError &e ) {
6555 debugmsg( "Error restoring vehicle: %s", e.c_str() );
6556 return false;
6557 }
6558 refresh();
6559 face.init( 0_degrees );
6560 turn_dir = 0_degrees;
6561 turn( 0_degrees );
6562 precalc_mounts( 0, pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[0] );
6563 precalc_mounts( 1, pivot_rotation[1], pivot_anchor[1] );
6564 last_update = calendar::turn;
6565 return true;
6566}
6567
6568std::set<tripoint> &vehicle::get_points( const bool force_refresh )
6569{
6570 if( force_refresh || occupied_cache_time != calendar::turn ) {
6571 occupied_cache_time = calendar::turn;
6572 occupied_points.clear();
6573 for( const auto &p : parts ) {
6574 occupied_points.insert( global_part_pos3( p ) );
6575 }
6576 }
6577
6578 return occupied_points;
6579}
6580
6581vehicle_part &vpart_reference::part() const
6582{
6583 assert( part_index() < static_cast<size_t>( vehicle().part_count() ) );
6584 return vehicle().part( part_index() );
6585}
6586
6587const vpart_info &vpart_reference::info() const
6588{
6589 return part().info();
6590}
6591
6592player *vpart_reference::get_passenger() const
6593{
6594 return vehicle().get_passenger( part_index() );
6595}
6596
6597point vpart_position::mount() const
6598{
6599 return vehicle().part( part_index() ).mount;
6600}
6601
6602tripoint vpart_position::pos() const
6603{
6604 return vehicle().global_part_pos3( part_index() );
6605}
6606
6607bool vpart_reference::has_feature( const std::string &f ) const
6608{
6609 return info().has_flag( f );
6610}
6611
6612bool vpart_reference::has_feature( const vpart_bitflags f ) const
6613{
6614 return info().has_flag( f );
6615}
6616
6617static bool is_sm_tile_over_water( const tripoint &real_global_pos )
6618{
6619
6620 const tripoint smp = ms_to_sm_copy( real_global_pos );
6621 const point p( modulo( real_global_pos.x, SEEX ), modulo( real_global_pos.y, SEEY ) );
6622 auto sm = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( smp );
6623 if( sm == nullptr ) {
6624 debugmsg( "is_sm_tile_outside(): couldn't find submap %d,%d,%d", smp.x, smp.y, smp.z );
6625 return false;
6626 }
6627
6628 if( p.x < 0 || p.x >= SEEX || p.y < 0 || p.y >= SEEY ) {
6629 debugmsg( "err %d,%d", p.x, p.y );
6630 return false;
6631 }
6632
6633 return ( sm->get_ter( p ).obj().has_flag( TFLAG_CURRENT ) ||
6634 sm->get_furn( p ).obj().has_flag( TFLAG_CURRENT ) );
6635}
6636
6637static bool is_sm_tile_outside( const tripoint &real_global_pos )
6638{
6639
6640 const tripoint smp = ms_to_sm_copy( real_global_pos );
6641 const point p( modulo( real_global_pos.x, SEEX ), modulo( real_global_pos.y, SEEY ) );
6642 auto sm = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( smp );
6643 if( sm == nullptr ) {
6644 debugmsg( "is_sm_tile_outside(): couldn't find submap %d,%d,%d", smp.x, smp.y, smp.z );
6645 return false;
6646 }
6647
6648 if( p.x < 0 || p.x >= SEEX || p.y < 0 || p.y >= SEEY ) {
6649 debugmsg( "err %d,%d", p.x, p.y );
6650 return false;
6651 }
6652
6653 return !( sm->get_ter( p ).obj().has_flag( TFLAG_INDOORS ) ||
6654 sm->get_furn( p ).obj().has_flag( TFLAG_INDOORS ) );
6655}
6656
6657void vehicle::update_time( const time_point &update_to )
6658{
6659 const time_point update_from = last_update;
6660 if( update_to < update_from ) {
6661 // Special case going backwards in time - that happens
6662 last_update = update_to;
6663 return;
6664 }
6665
6666 if( update_to >= update_from && update_to - update_from < 1_minutes ) {
6667 // We don't need to check every turn
6668 return;
6669 }
6670 time_duration elapsed = update_to - last_update;
6671 last_update = update_to;
6672
6673 if( sm_pos.z < 0 ) {
6674 return;
6675 }
6676
6677 // Weather stuff, only for z-levels >= 0
6678 // TODO: Have it wash cars from blood?
6679 if( funnels.empty() && solar_panels.empty() && wind_turbines.empty() && water_wheels.empty() ) {
6680 return;
6681 }
6682 // Get one weather data set per vehicle, they don't differ much across vehicle area
6683 const weather_sum accum_weather = sum_conditions( update_from, update_to,
6684 global_square_location().raw() );
6685 // make some reference objects to use to check for reload
6686 const item water( "water" );
6687 const item water_clean( "water_clean" );
6688
6689 for( int idx : funnels ) {
6690 const auto &pt = parts[idx];
6691
6692 // we need an unbroken funnel mounted on the exterior of the vehicle
6693 if( pt.is_unavailable() || !is_sm_tile_outside( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( pt ) ) ) ) {
6694 continue;
6695 }
6696
6697 // we need an empty tank (or one already containing water) below the funnel
6698 auto tank = std::find_if( parts.begin(), parts.end(), [&]( const vehicle_part & e ) {
6699 return pt.mount == e.mount && e.is_tank() &&
6700 ( e.can_reload( water ) || e.can_reload( water_clean ) );
6701 } );
6702
6703 if( tank == parts.end() ) {
6704 continue;
6705 }
6706
6707 double area = std::pow( pt.info().size / units::legacy_volume_factor, 2 ) * M_PI;
6708 int qty = roll_remainder( funnel_charges_per_turn( area, accum_weather.rain_amount ) );
6709 int c_qty = qty + ( tank->can_reload( water_clean ) ? tank->ammo_remaining() : 0 );
6710 int cost_to_purify = c_qty * itype_water_purifier->charges_to_use();
6711
6712 if( qty > 0 ) {
6713 if( has_part( global_part_pos3( pt ), "WATER_PURIFIER", true ) &&
6714 ( fuel_left( itype_battery, true ) > cost_to_purify ) ) {
6715 tank->ammo_set( itype_water_clean, c_qty );
6716 discharge_battery( cost_to_purify );
6717 } else {
6718 tank->ammo_set( itype_water, tank->ammo_remaining() + qty );
6719 }
6720 invalidate_mass();
6721 }
6722 }
6723
6724 if( !solar_panels.empty() ) {
6725 int epower_w = 0;
6726 for( int part : solar_panels ) {
6727 if( parts[ part ].is_unavailable() ) {
6728 continue;
6729 }
6730
6731 if( !is_sm_tile_outside( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( part ) ) ) ) {
6732 continue;
6733 }
6734
6735 epower_w += part_epower_w( part );
6736 }
6737 double intensity = accum_weather.sunlight / default_daylight_level() / to_turns<double>( elapsed );
6738 int energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower_w * intensity, elapsed );
6739 if( energy_bat > 0 ) {
6740 add_msg( m_debug, "%s got %d kJ energy from solar panels", name, energy_bat );
6741 charge_battery( energy_bat );
6742 }
6743 }
6744 if( !wind_turbines.empty() ) {
6745 // TODO: use accum_weather wind data to backfill wind turbine
6746 // generation capacity.
6747 int epower_w = total_wind_epower_w();
6748 int energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower_w, elapsed );
6749 if( energy_bat > 0 ) {
6750 add_msg( m_debug, "%s got %d kJ energy from wind turbines", name, energy_bat );
6751 charge_battery( energy_bat );
6752 }
6753 }
6754 if( !water_wheels.empty() ) {
6755 int epower_w = total_water_wheel_epower_w();
6756 int energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower_w, elapsed );
6757 if( energy_bat > 0 ) {
6758 add_msg( m_debug, "%s got %d kJ energy from water wheels", name, energy_bat );
6759 charge_battery( energy_bat );
6760 }
6761 }
6762}
6763
6764void vehicle::process_emitters()
6765{
6766 // Parts emitting fields
6767 for( int idx : emitters ) {
6768 const vehicle_part &pt = parts[idx];
6769 if( pt.is_unavailable() || !pt.enabled ) {
6770 continue;
6771 }
6772 for( const emit_id &e : pt.info().emissions ) {
6773 g->m.emit_field( global_part_pos3( pt ), e );
6774 }
6775 }
6776}
6777
6778void vehicle::invalidate_mass()
6779{
6780 mass_dirty = true;
6781 mass_center_precalc_dirty = true;
6782 mass_center_no_precalc_dirty = true;
6783 // Anything that affects mass will also affect the pivot
6784 pivot_dirty = true;
6785 coeff_rolling_dirty = true;
6786 coeff_water_dirty = true;
6787}
6788
6789void vehicle::refresh_mass() const
6790{
6791 calc_mass_center( true );
6792}
6793
6794void vehicle::calc_mass_center( bool use_precalc ) const
6795{
6796 units::quantity<float, units::mass::unit_type> xf;
6797 units::quantity<float, units::mass::unit_type> yf;
6798 units::mass m_total = 0_gram;
6799 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6800 const size_t i = vp.part_index();
6801 if( vp.part().removed ) {
6802 continue;
6803 }
6804
6805 units::mass m_part = 0_gram;
6806 units::mass m_part_items = 0_gram;
6807 m_part += vp.part().base.weight();
6808 for( const auto &j : get_items( i ) ) {
6809 m_part_items += j.weight();
6810 }
6811 if( vp.part().info().cargo_weight_modifier != 100 ) {
6812 m_part_items *= static_cast<float>( vp.part().info().cargo_weight_modifier ) / 100.0f;
6813 }
6814 m_part += m_part_items;
6815
6816 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE ) && vp.part().has_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag ) ) {
6817 const player *p = get_passenger( i );
6818 // Sometimes flag is wrongly set, don't crash!
6819 m_part += p != nullptr ? p->get_weight() : 0_gram;
6820 }
6821
6822 if( use_precalc ) {
6823 xf += vp.part().precalc[0].x * m_part;
6824 yf += vp.part().precalc[0].y * m_part;
6825 } else {
6826 xf += vp.mount().x * m_part;
6827 yf += vp.mount().y * m_part;
6828 }
6829
6830 m_total += m_part;
6831 }
6832
6833 mass_cache = m_total;
6834 mass_dirty = false;
6835
6836 const float x = xf / mass_cache;
6837 const float y = yf / mass_cache;
6838 if( use_precalc ) {
6839 mass_center_precalc.x = std::round( x );
6840 mass_center_precalc.y = std::round( y );
6841 mass_center_precalc_dirty = false;
6842 } else {
6843 mass_center_no_precalc.x = std::round( x );
6844 mass_center_no_precalc.y = std::round( y );
6845 mass_center_no_precalc_dirty = false;
6846 }
6847}
6848
6849bounding_box vehicle::get_bounding_box()
6850{
6851 int min_x = INT_MAX;
6852 int max_x = INT_MIN;
6853 int min_y = INT_MAX;
6854 int max_y = INT_MIN;
6855
6856 face.init( turn_dir );
6857
6858 precalc_mounts( 0, turn_dir, point() );
6859
6860 int i_use = 0;
6861 for( const tripoint &p : get_points( true ) ) {
6862 const point pt = parts[part_at( p.xy() )].precalc[i_use].xy();
6863 if( pt.x < min_x ) {
6864 min_x = pt.x;
6865 }
6866 if( pt.x > max_x ) {
6867 max_x = pt.x;
6868 }
6869 if( pt.y < min_y ) {
6870 min_y = pt.y;
6871 }
6872 if( pt.y > max_y ) {
6873 max_y = pt.y;
6874 }
6875 }
6876 bounding_box b;
6877 b.p1 = point( min_x, min_y );
6878 b.p2 = point( max_x, max_y );
6879 return b;
6880}
6881
6882vehicle_part_range vehicle::get_all_parts() const
6883{
6884 return vehicle_part_range( const_cast<vehicle &>( *this ) );
6885}
6886
6887int vehicle::part_count() const
6888{
6889 return static_cast<int>( parts.size() );
6890}
6891
6892vehicle_part &vehicle::part( int part_num )
6893{
6894 return parts[part_num];
6895}
6896
6897const vehicle_part &vehicle::cpart( int part_num ) const
6898{
6899 return const_cast<vehicle_part &>( parts[part_num] );
6900}
6901
6902bool vehicle::valid_part( int part_num ) const
6903{
6904 return part_num >= 0 && part_num < static_cast<int>( parts.size() );
6905}
6906
6907std::set<int> vehicle::advance_precalc_mounts( const point &new_pos, const tripoint &src,
6908 const tripoint &dp, int ramp_offset, const bool adjust_pos,
6909 std::set<int> parts_to_move )
6910{
6911 map &here = get_map();
6912 std::set<int> smzs;
6913 // when a vehicle part enters the low end of a down ramp, or the high end of an up ramp,
6914 // it immediately translates down or up a z-level, respectively, ending up on the low
6915 // end of an up ramp or high end of a down ramp, respectively. The two ends are set
6916 // past each other, like so:
6917 // (side view) z+1 Rdh RDl
6918 // z+0 RUh Rul
6919 // A vehicle moving left to right on z+1 drives down to z+0 by entering the ramp down low end.
6920 // A vehicle moving right to left on z+0 drives up to z+1 by entering the ramp up high end.
6921 // A vehicle moving left to right on z+0 should ideally collide into a wall before entering
6922 // the ramp up high end, but even if it does, it briefly transitions to z+1 before returning
6923 // to z0 by entering the ramp down low end.
6924 // A vehicle moving right to left on z+1 drives down to z+0 by entering the ramp down low end,
6925 // then immediately returns to z+1 by entering the ramp up high end.
6926 // When a vehicle's pivot point transitions a z-level via a ramp, all other pre-calc points
6927 // make the opposite transition, so that points that were above an ascending pivot point are
6928 // now level with it, and parts that were level with an ascending pivot point are now below
6929 // it.
6930 // parts that enter the translation portion of a ramp on the same displacement as the
6931 // pivot point stay at the same relative z to the pivot point, as the ramp_offset adjustments
6932 // cancel out.
6933 // if a vehicle manages move partially up or down a ramp and then veers off course, it
6934 // can get split across the z-levels and continue moving, enough though large parts of the
6935 // vehicle are unsupported. In that case, move the unsupported parts down until they are
6936 // supported.
6937 int index = -1;
6938 for( vehicle_part &prt : parts ) {
6939 index += 1;
6940 here.clear_vehicle_point_from_cache( this, src + prt.precalc[0] );
6941 // no parts means this is a normal horizontal or vertical move
6942 if( parts_to_move.empty() ) {
6943 prt.precalc[0] = prt.precalc[1];
6944 // partial part movement means we're zero-ing out after missing a ramp
6945 } else if( adjust_pos && parts_to_move.find( index ) == parts_to_move.end() ) {
6946 prt.precalc[0].z -= dp.z;
6947 } else if( !adjust_pos && parts_to_move.find( index ) != parts_to_move.end() ) {
6948 prt.precalc[0].z += dp.z;
6949 }
6950 if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_UP, src + dp + prt.precalc[0] ) ) {
6951 prt.precalc[0].z += 1;
6952 } else if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, src + dp + prt.precalc[0] ) ) {
6953 prt.precalc[0].z -= 1;
6954 }
6955 prt.precalc[0].z -= ramp_offset;
6956 prt.precalc[1].z = prt.precalc[0].z;
6957 smzs.insert( prt.precalc[0].z );
6958 }
6959 if( adjust_pos ) {
6960 if( parts_to_move.empty() ) {
6961 pivot_anchor[0] = pivot_anchor[1];
6962 pivot_rotation[0] = pivot_rotation[1];
6963 }
6964 pos = new_pos;
6965 }
6966 // Invalidate vehicle's point cache
6967 occupied_cache_time = calendar::before_time_starts;
6968 return smzs;
6969}
6970
6971bool vehicle::refresh_zones()
6972{
6973 if( zones_dirty ) {
6974 decltype( loot_zones ) new_zones;
6975 for( auto const &z : loot_zones ) {
6976 zone_data zone = z.second;
6977 //Get the global position of the first cargo part at the relative coordinate
6978
6979 const int part_idx = part_with_feature( z.first, "CARGO", false );
6980 if( part_idx == -1 ) {
6981 debugmsg( "Could not find cargo part at %d,%d on vehicle %s for loot zone. Removing loot zone.",
6982 z.first.x, z.first.y, this->name );
6983
6984 // If this loot zone refers to a part that no longer exists at this location, then its unattached somehow.
6985 // By continuing here and not adding to new_zones, we effectively remove it
6986 continue;
6987 }
6988 tripoint zone_pos = global_part_pos3( part_idx );
6989 zone_pos = g->m.getabs( zone_pos );
6990 //Set the position of the zone to that part
6991 zone.set_position( std::pair<tripoint, tripoint>( zone_pos, zone_pos ), false );
6992 new_zones.emplace( z.first, zone );
6993 }
6994 loot_zones = new_zones;
6995 zones_dirty = false;
6996 return true;
6997 }
6998 return false;
6999}
7000
7001template<>
7002bool vehicle_part_with_feature_range<std::string>::matches( const size_t part ) const
7003{
7004 const vehicle_part &vp = this->vehicle().part( part );
7005 return vp.info().has_flag( feature_ ) &&
7006 !vp.removed &&
7007 ( !( part_status_flag::working & required_ ) || !vp.is_broken() ) &&
7008 ( !( part_status_flag::available & required_ ) || vp.is_available() ) &&
7009 ( !( part_status_flag::enabled & required_ ) || vp.enabled );
7010}
7011
7012template<>
7013bool vehicle_part_with_feature_range<vpart_bitflags>::matches( const size_t part ) const
7014{
7015 const vehicle_part &vp = this->vehicle().part( part );
7016 return vp.info().has_flag( feature_ ) &&
7017 !vp.removed &&
7018 ( !( part_status_flag::working & required_ ) || !vp.is_broken() ) &&
7019 ( !( part_status_flag::available & required_ ) || vp.is_available() ) &&
7020 ( !( part_status_flag::enabled & required_ ) || vp.enabled );
7021}
